original: @152a * // tshad ma rnam par nges pa bzhugs so//
analyzed: @152a * // tshad ma rnam par nges pa bzhugs so//
translated: Ascertainment of Valid Cognition

original: @152b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @152b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra m'a na bi ni shtsa ya /
analyzed: pra m'a na bi ni shtsa ya /
translated: Pramana-vini≈õcaya

original: bod skad du /üîΩtshad ma rnam par nges pa /
analyzed: bod skad du / tshad ma rnam par nges pa /
translated: In Tibetan:üîΩtshad ma rnam par nges pa

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Manjushri

original: gang la 'phags pa nyid byon rjes gzung de ni dpal ldan dri med blo mnga' ste //
analyzed: gang la 'phags pa nyid byon rjes gzung de ni dpal ldan dri med blo mnga' ste //
translated: He who was accepted by the noble one himself is the glorious stainless-minded one.

original: 'jig rten blo gros blun po 'dis ni de tshig brling ba gsal bar mi shes pas //
analyzed: 'jig rten blo gros blun po 'dis ni de tshig brling ba gsal bar mi shes pas //
translated: This foolish worldly intellect does not clearly understand his profound words.

original: nyer bsten 'jig rten rgyal mdzad de la rmongs pas cung zad smad byas na'ang //
analyzed: nyer bsten 'jig rten rgyal mdzad de la rmongs pas cung zad smad byas na'ang //
translated: Even if he is slightly criticized out of delusion by those who serve and rule the world,

original: don min skye bar 'gyur ba yin pas brtse bas de yi lugs ni gsal bar bya //
analyzed: don min skye bar 'gyur ba yin pas brtse bas de yi lugs ni gsal bar bya //
translated: Since it would lead to meaninglessness, his system should be clarified out of affection.

original: phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong ba ni nges par yang dag pa'i shes pa mngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na de mi mkhas pa rnams la bstan pa'i don du 'di brtsam mo //
analyzed: phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong ba ni nges par yang dag pa'i shes pa mngon du 'gro ba can yin pas na de mi mkhas pa rnams la bstan pa'i don du 'di brtsam mo //
translated: Since obtaining benefit and harm, and abandoning and approaching, definitely proceed from manifest correct knowledge, this is composed for the sake of teaching that to the unskilled.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Right knowledge is of two kinds:

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag /üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces bya ba'o //
translated: perception and inference.

original: 'di dag gis don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa na don bya ba la bslu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa na don bya ba la bslu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one engages in the determination of the meaning by these two, one is not deceived with regard to the activity of the object.

original: gal te sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúAre there not other means of valid knowledge, such as verbal testimony and analogy?‚Äù

original: tshad ma yin na ni 'di gnyis kho nar 'dus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshad ma yin na ni 'di gnyis kho nar 'dus pa'i phyir //
translated: Since these two are included in the two means of valid knowledge,

original: tshad ma rnam gnyis kho na ste //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam gnyis kho na ste //
translated: there are only two means of valid knowledge.

original: 'brel ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel ba ni /
translated: The connection is as follows:

original: gzhan las mngon sum ma yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan las mngon sum ma yin pa //
translated: The other is not perception

original: 'dra ba'i bdag tu rtogs phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i bdag tu rtogs phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood to have a similar nature.

original: don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de mngon sum dang / lkog tu gyur ba'o //üîΩde la gang zhig shes pa'i snang ba bdag @153a * //
analyzed: don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de mngon sum dang / lkog tu gyur ba'o // de la gang zhig shes pa'i snang ba bdag @153a * //
translated: The object is of two kinds: manifest and hidden.

original: nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mthun par byed pa de ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mthun par byed pa de ni mngon sum ste /
translated: That which is consistent with the conformity of the appearance to the cognition itself, whether it follows or does not follow, is perception.

original: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin te rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin te rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the uncommon nature of the thing, its own character.

original: gzhan ni blo la dngos su rang gi ngo bo 'jog pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir rtogs par mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni blo la dngos su rang gi ngo bo 'jog pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir rtogs par mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: The other is not suitable to be understood because it is empty of the power to set forth its own nature to the awareness.

original: gzhan mthong ba na gzhan rtogs pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba na gzhan rtogs pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that when one thing is seen, another is understood,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: de yang med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If that other thing were necessarily concomitant with it, then it would be reasonable.

original: de ni ji lta bu'i rnam pa dang rang bzhin 'brel ba grub pa de lta bu'i rnam pa nye ba nyid du go bar byed la 'brel ba las spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni ji lta bu'i rnam pa dang rang bzhin 'brel ba grub pa de lta bu'i rnam pa nye ba nyid du go bar byed la 'brel ba las spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na ste /
translated: It is understood that it is just the presence of that kind of nature and type that is the evidence, and the understanding of it in a general way from the evidence is inference, so there are only two means of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan du na rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to understand it in any other way.

original: de'i 'brel ba kho na ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i 'brel ba kho na ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin gyi //
translated: The mere relationship is not the definition of evidence.

original: 'on kyang gzung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can la mthong ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can la mthong ba yang yin la /
translated: But if the subject possesses the object that is apprehended, then it is seen.

original: de ni sgra la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma gzhan ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: de ni sgra la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma gzhan ma yin zhe na ;
translated: But since that is not the case with sound, how can it be a valid cognition?

original: de dag de la mthong na 'o na don ci zhig sgrub pa'am 'gog par byed /
analyzed: de dag de la mthong na 'o na don ci zhig sgrub pa'am 'gog par byed /
translated: If it is seen, then what meaning is established or refuted?

original: gang sngar mthong ba de la dran par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gang sngar mthong ba de la dran par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is remembered,

original: sgra dang rtags med par de rang nyid ji zhig ltar yang dran par mi 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: sgra dang rtags med par de rang nyid ji zhig ltar yang dran par mi 'gyur ram ci /
translated: then how is it that it is not remembered without sound or a sign?

original: gnas skabs 'di nyid la bye brag kyang yod dam /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di nyid la bye brag kyang yod dam /
translated: Is there a difference between this state and that state?

original: de'i phyir 'di dag 'ga' zhig tu ma grub pa 'ga' zhig tu sgrub pa'am 'gog par mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag 'ga' zhig tu ma grub pa 'ga' zhig tu sgrub pa'am 'gog par mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it does not establish or refute anything,

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig sgrub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig sgrub par byed pa yin /
translated: how can it establish anything?

original: de dag las don 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag las don 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not establish meaning because

original: de dag der 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag der 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not established as being related to that.

original: smra ba po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don go bar rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: smra ba po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don go bar rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is suitable for the meaning that the speaker intends to convey to be understood.

original: de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i gzhi ni de nyid yin no //üîΩ'o na de yod na yod pa dang / mi dmigs pa las rab tu skye ba dang med pa sgrub pa la rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i gzhi ni de nyid yin no // 'o na de yod na yod pa dang / mi dmigs pa las rab tu skye ba dang med pa sgrub pa la rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: The basis of that knowledge is reality.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, it is not an inference that proves the existence or non-existence of something from non-apprehension, because there is no concomitance.

original: 'di la dpe yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la dpe yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no example for this,

original: sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other proof and because if that itself were the proof, there would be an infinite regress.

original: zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: de la yul bstan pas zhugs pa'i yul can gyi 'brel ba dran pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la yul bstan pas zhugs pa'i yul can gyi 'brel ba dran pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the object is remembered by the subject that has entered into it through the teaching of the object.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The nature of cause and effect is not other than concomitance and non-concomitance.

original: de bzhin du dmigs par rigs pa mi @153b dmigs na yang med do zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs par rigs pa mi @153b dmigs na yang med do zhes brjod de /
translated: Similarly, when the object to be apprehended is not apprehended, it is said to be non-existent.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs na med do zhes rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan pas rmongs pa la tha snyad sgrub par byed do /üîΩskyed par byed pa brjod pa la pha nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs na med do zhes rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan pas rmongs pa la tha snyad sgrub par byed do / skyed par byed pa brjod pa la pha nyid bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the conventional is established for the confused.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa yang rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa yang rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Also, the nonperception of the nonappearing is the negation of the conventional existence of something, because there is no other reason.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin par brjod pa la pha nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin par brjod pa la pha nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nonfather who is not the producer.

original: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa ma yin pa thams cad ni bdag nyid dang 'brel ba'i grub par byed pa mi 'khrul ba gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa ma yin pa thams cad ni bdag nyid dang 'brel ba'i grub par byed pa mi 'khrul ba gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all that is not established by oneself is not perception, because it depends on another, a nonerroneous proof that is related to oneself. There is no valid cognition other than inference.

original: gzhan dag mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni med do //
translated: Others say that there is no valid cognition that is not perception.

original: zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir tshad dang cig shos spyi gzhag dang // gzhan blo rtogs par byed phyir dang // 'ga' zhig 'gog par byed phyir yang //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad dang cig shos spyi gzhag dang // gzhan blo rtogs par byed phyir dang // 'ga' zhig 'gog par byed phyir yang //
translated: because of the understanding of the other mind, and because of the refutation of some,

original: tshad ma gzhan ni srid pa nyid //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni srid pa nyid //
translated: there is the possibility of another valid cognition.

original: de shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi 'jug pa la slu ba dang mi slu ba dag dmigs nas ji ltar nye bar bstan pa la 'jug pa mi 'khrul bar bya ba'i phyir mngon sum kho na tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: de shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi 'jug pa la slu ba dang mi slu ba dag dmigs nas ji ltar nye bar bstan pa la 'jug pa mi 'khrul bar bya ba'i phyir mngon sum kho na tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no
translated: Having observed the deception and non-deception in the engagement of some cognitions that know that, in order to make the engagement in the taught non-erroneous, only direct perception is valid cognition, not inference.

original: zhes de'i mtshan nyid la khyad par smra ba na chos mthong ba las ci lta ba de ltar rab tu bsgrub pa de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba las ma 'das so //
analyzed: zhes de'i mtshan nyid la khyad par smra ba na chos mthong ba las ci lta ba de ltar rab tu bsgrub pa de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba las ma 'das so //
translated: When they speak of a distinction in its definition, that establishment in accordance with what is seen of the property is not beyond what is to be inferred.

original: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir yul nyams su myong ba bstan du med pa'i shes pa'i gsal ba rnams las ma gtogs par cung zad kyang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir yul nyams su myong ba bstan du med pa'i shes pa'i gsal ba rnams las ma gtogs par cung zad kyang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: And because that is not established, apart from the cognitions that are the manifestation of the experience of the object, which are not taught, there is not the slightest valid cognition or non-valid cognition.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gis kyang 'di gzhan la tha snyad du byed par mi dbang ba'i phyir bstan bcos bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gis kyang 'di gzhan la tha snyad du byed par mi dbang ba'i phyir bstan bcos bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: and they are not able to make conventions to others about what is not in their own mind-streams.

original: byed na yang rang gi 'jug pa la rang gi tshig gis co 'dri bar byed pa yin no //üîΩgzhan khong du chud par bya ba'i don du bstan bcos kyang byed la /
analyzed: byed na yang rang gi 'jug pa la rang gi tshig gis co 'dri bar byed pa yin no // gzhan khong du chud par bya ba'i don du bstan bcos kyang byed la /
translated: If they do, they are deceiving themselves with their own words.üîΩIt is not right to say that one composes treatises in order to make others understand,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang 'dor ro zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang 'dor ro zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: but one should not use inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de spangs na 'jug pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de spangs na 'jug pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For if one rejects inference, one‚Äôs own position will be pointless.

original: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
analyzed: lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
translated: The body itself is not the mind,

original: de grub kyang blo'i rnam par brtags pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub kyang blo'i rnam par brtags pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if the body exists, one doubts whether the mind exists.

original: de gzhan dang 'brel ba ni skyes bu tsam gyis mngon sum du mi rtogs so //üîΩ'di 'ga' zhig tu dgag pa byed pa yang mngon sum gyis ni @154a * //
analyzed: de gzhan dang 'brel ba ni skyes bu tsam gyis mngon sum du mi rtogs so // 'di 'ga' zhig tu dgag pa byed pa yang mngon sum gyis ni @154a * //
translated: And one cannot perceive the connection of the body with something else merely by seeing the body.

original: bya bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bya bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not right to say that one should refute this by perception.

original: don gyis nus pa la ltos pa med pas de'i yul nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis nus pa la ltos pa med pas de'i yul nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory that it be the object of that, since it does not depend on the object.

original: mi ltos na ni chos pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ltos na ni chos pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not depend on it, it would follow that it would arise even in the absence of the thing, the subject, etc.

original: log pa las mngon sum nyid kyis dngos po med par nges pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: log pa las mngon sum nyid kyis dngos po med par nges pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: If you say that the non-existence of the object is ascertained by the non-perception of it,

original: de med pa yang yin la des rtogs so //
analyzed: de med pa yang yin la des rtogs so //
translated: then it is not that it is non-existent and that it is perceived.

original: zhes kyang bya ba 'di ni nyams so //
analyzed: zhes kyang bya ba 'di ni nyams so //
translated: This statement is contradicted.

original: de log na ni gang las med do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de log na ni gang las med do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is non-existent, then from what is it said that it is non-existent?

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ascertainment.

original: yod na yang de nyid mi 'khrul ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod na yang de nyid mi 'khrul ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it exists, then it is the non-erroneous object of perception.

original: de ni des dngos po med pa'i rtags nyid do //
analyzed: de ni des dngos po med pa'i rtags nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that is the very reason for the non-existence of the object.

original: 'ga' zhig mi slu yang de'i rang bzhin can la 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir yid brtan du med do zhe na ma yin te de'i rang bzhin ma mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi slu yang de'i rang bzhin can la 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir yid brtan du med do zhe na ma yin te de'i rang bzhin ma mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you say that even though it is not erroneous in some cases, it is not reliable because it is seen to be erroneous in regard to that which has the nature of that, no, because it does not indicate the nature of that.

original: rang bzhin 'brel ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The definition of a reason is that it is related to the nature of that.

original: de la ni 'khrul ba yod pa ma yin te de med na rang gi ngo bo med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni 'khrul ba yod pa ma yin te de med na rang gi ngo bo med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no error in that, because if it did not exist, it would not have its own nature.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum yang ni don med na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum yang ni don med na /
translated: In this way, if perception also is not valid cognition with regard to its object,

original: mi 'byung ba las tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba las tshad ma nyid //
translated: then it is not valid cognition because it does not arise without an object.

original: 'brel ba yi ni rang bzhin de'i //
analyzed: 'brel ba yi ni rang bzhin de'i //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of the relation,

original: rgyu yin pas na gnyis ka mtshungs //
analyzed: rgyu yin pas na gnyis ka mtshungs //
translated: and because it is the cause of both, they are the same.

original: mngon sum yang don la mi slu ba nyid las tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang don la mi slu ba nyid las tshad ma yin no //
translated: Perception is valid cognition because it is nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: mi slu ba yang de las bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang de las bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Nondeceptiveness is obtained from that itself,

original: gzhan las byung ba'am ma byung ba'i yod pa de ni de la nges par mi slu ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las byung ba'am ma byung ba'i yod pa de ni de la nges par mi slu ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the existence of that is ascertained as nondeceptive from something else, whether it arises from that or does not arise from that.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi don la mi slu ba ni don med na mi 'byung ba las ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi don la mi slu ba ni don med na mi 'byung ba las ma yin gyi /
translated: If perception is nondeceptive with regard to its object, it is not because it does not arise without an object.

original: 'on kyang don mthong ba las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang don mthong ba las yin no zhe na /
translated: However, it is because it sees the object.

original: don mthong ba de yang don yin nam shes pa yin /
analyzed: don mthong ba de yang don yin nam shes pa yin /
translated: Is that seeing of the object the object or is it consciousness?

original: don yin no zhe na don thams cad mngon sum yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yin no zhe na don thams cad mngon sum yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is the object, then since all objects are directly perceptible, everyone would see them.

original: shes pa yin no zhe na ji ltar gzhan yod na 'brel ba med pa gzhan nges par yod par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir yod par 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yin no zhe na ji ltar gzhan yod na 'brel ba med pa gzhan nges par yod par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir yod par 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is consciousness, then how is the existence of consciousness established by the perception of something else, since it is seen that something else can exist without a relationship?

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces de nyid brgal zhing brtag pa byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces de nyid brgal zhing brtag pa byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it you who asks, ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called perception?‚Äù and who engages in analysis?

original: de'i phyir shes pa yod pa las don yod par 'dod pas shes pa de dang 'brel bar brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa yod pa las don yod par 'dod pas shes pa de dang 'brel bar brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, since you assert that objects exist because consciousness exists, you must say that consciousness is related to them.

original: de ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dag las rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dag las rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But since that is the same in the case of inference from effects and from nature, inference is not devoid of the characteristics of valid knowledge.

original: de la mngon sum rtog @154b bral ma 'khrul ba //
analyzed: de la mngon sum rtog @154b bral ma 'khrul ba //
translated: Direct perception is non-conceptual and non-mistaken.

original: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa'i 'khrug pa la sogs pas 'khrul ba ma bskyed cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang / grur zhugs pa'i 'khrug pa la sogs pas 'khrul ba ma bskyed cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum mo //
translated: A direct perception is a cognition that is not produced by an error, such as the appearance of floaters, the rapid spinning of a torch, or the illusion of a double moon, and that is not accompanied by conceptualization.

original: rtog pa de yang gang zhe na /üîΩrtog pa mngon par brjod can gyi //
analyzed: rtog pa de yang gang zhe na / rtog pa mngon par brjod can gyi //
translated: What is conceptualization?üîΩConceptualization is verbalization.

original: shes pa rtog pa ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa rtog pa ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: Conceptualization is a cognition that appears as if it were mixed with verbalization.

original: de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'o //
translated: A direct perception is free from that.

original: dbang po'i shes pa la ni de srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la ni de srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Conceptualization is not possible in a sense cognition becauseüîΩa sense cognition arises

original: don gyi mthu yis ni /üîΩyang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi mthu yis ni / yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //
translated: from the power of the object.

original: gang gi phyir de don gyi nus pa las skyes pa na de'i rang bzhin kho na'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de don gyi nus pa las skyes pa na de'i rang bzhin kho na'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it arises from the power of the object, it conforms only to the nature of the object.

original: gang gis de snang ba na de yang snang bar 'gyur ba don la sgra yod pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis de snang ba na de yang snang bar 'gyur ba don la sgra yod pa'am /
translated: If the object were to appear as if it were sound,

original: de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: it would not be the object itself.

original: rig pa'i chos 'di ni don la reg pa dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa'i chos 'di ni don la reg pa dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This quality of awareness is not devoid of contact with the object.

original: de don rtag tu sbyor ba'i phyir dang / de las kyang don rnams mi rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don rtag tu sbyor ba'i phyir dang / de las kyang don rnams mi rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always applied to that object, and because it would follow, absurdly, that one would not understand the object from that.

original: de'i phyir 'di nye bar gyur pas rnam par shes pa bskyed pa na bdag nyid ma yin pa med na mi 'byung ba ni mdun du byed par rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nye bar gyur pas rnam par shes pa bskyed pa na bdag nyid ma yin pa med na mi 'byung ba ni mdun du byed par rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when consciousness is produced by that which is present, it is not known that the non-self-nature of that which is present is the cause of its production,

original: ro la sogs pa phan tshun bzhin no //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa phan tshun bzhin no //
translated: just as with taste, etc.

original: de'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa yang don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa yang don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the consciousness produced by its power the follower of another object,

original: ro la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: just as with the consciousness of taste, etc.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin du chug kyang dbang po gzhan gyi shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin du chug kyang dbang po gzhan gyi shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Even if it were of the nature of that, it would not be able to produce the consciousness of another sense faculty, and that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: rnam par rtog pa can ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Conceptual is the mental consciousness.

original: don gyi nus pa nye ba la ltos pa med par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis kun nas bslangs pa las /
analyzed: don gyi nus pa nye ba la ltos pa med par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis kun nas bslangs pa las /
translated: It is produced by the latent potentialities of conceptualization without regard to the presence of the potency of an object.

original: dbang po'i don ma nges par 'dzin pa can /üîΩnyams su myong ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba las lhan cig gam /
analyzed: dbang po'i don ma nges par 'dzin pa can / nyams su myong ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba las lhan cig gam /
translated: It apprehends the object of the sense faculty without certainty.

original: so sor 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: so sor 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It apprehends the object as simultaneous with the experience or separately, depending on whether it is related to some experience.

original: gzhan yang / don ni nye bar sbyor ba na'ang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / don ni nye bar sbyor ba na'ang //
translated: Moreover, even when the object is present,

original: gzhan yang sgra sbyor dran pa la //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra sbyor dran pa la //
translated: it is related to the memory of the word.

original: gal te dbang po'i blo ltos na //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i blo ltos na //
translated: If the cognition of the sense faculty depends on that,

original: don de chod par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: don de chod par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: then the object would be obstructed.

original: gang gi phyir brda'i dus na goms pa'i brjod pa'i spyi ma dran pa ni de sbyor ba mi srid de sgra gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brda'i dus na goms pa'i brjod pa'i spyi ma dran pa ni de sbyor ba mi srid de sgra gzhan bzhin no //
translated: Because when the word is remembered at the time of the convention, the universal of the expression that was familiarized is not remembered, as in the case of another word.

original: don gyis nye bar sbyor bas byas pa'i nang gi 'du byed sad pa med par yang sgra'i khyad par dran par mi rigs te /
analyzed: don gyis nye bar sbyor bas byas pa'i nang gi 'du byed sad pa med par yang sgra'i khyad par dran par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the particular word is remembered without the internal formative force that is produced by the application of the object,

original: de des ma byas na de'i ming mi 'dzin par thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdes @155a * //
analyzed: de des ma byas na de'i ming mi 'dzin par thal ba'i phyir ro // des @155a * //
translated: because if it is not produced by that, it follows that it would not apprehend the name of that.

original: na dran pas bar du chod pa'i phyir don gyi nye bar sbyor pa'i de ma thag pa'i byed pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na dran pas bar du chod pa'i phyir don gyi nye bar sbyor pa'i de ma thag pa'i byed pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is obstructed by memory, it would not be the effect of the immediately preceding condition of the application of the object.

original: de'i phyir gang sngon blo yi skyed byed min //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang sngon blo yi skyed byed min //
translated: Therefore, it is not the producer of the prior cognition.

original: nyer sbyor khyad par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nyer sbyor khyad par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the special application.

original: de ni phyis kyang 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni phyis kyang 'gyur /
translated: It is also the subsequent cognition.

original: bdag nyid tha dad pa med pas nus pa khyad par med pa'i phyir gcig nyid gcig la byed pa dang mi byed par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid tha dad pa med pas nus pa khyad par med pa'i phyir gcig nyid gcig la byed pa dang mi byed par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no difference in the nature of the cognition, there is no difference in its capacity. Therefore, it is not the case that one cognition is sometimes the cause and sometimes not.

original: des na / don med na yang mig blor 'gyur //
analyzed: des na / don med na yang mig blor 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the cognition arises even when the object is absent.

original: don blo la dngos su mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang / dran pas sad par byed pa la sbyor ba'i phyir blo ni phan pa med pa de yod pa la mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: don blo la dngos su mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang / dran pas sad par byed pa la sbyor ba'i phyir blo ni phan pa med pa de yod pa la mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: Since the object does not directly apply to the cognition, and since the cognition is applied to the awakening of memory, the cognition does not depend on the existence of the object that is useless to it.

original: don gyi nye bar sbyor bas blo skyed par byed na ni brjod pa dran pa'i bar chad med pa'i phyir mngon sum rtogs pa med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi nye bar sbyor bas blo skyed par byed na ni brjod pa dran pa'i bar chad med pa'i phyir mngon sum rtogs pa med par grub pa yin no //
translated: If the cognition were produced by the application of the object, then the cognition would be established without the realization of direct perception, because the memory of the statement would be uninterrupted.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / khyad par dang ni khyad par can //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyad par dang ni khyad par can //
translated: the special and the general,

original: 'brel dang 'jig rten chos lugs ni //
analyzed: 'brel dang 'jig rten chos lugs ni //
translated: the connection, and the way of the world

original: gzung ste de ltar bsdoms byas na //
analyzed: gzung ste de ltar bsdoms byas na //
translated: are apprehended. Thus, they are combined.

original: de ltar rtogs kyis gzhan du min //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs kyis gzhan du min //
translated: Thus, it is understood, but not otherwise.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can dang de'i 'brel ba dang 'jig rten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa shes na ni de bsdoms nas 'dzin pas 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can dang de'i 'brel ba dang 'jig rten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa shes na ni de bsdoms nas 'dzin pas 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: If one knows the distinction, the distinguished, their relation, and the worldly presentation, then, by combining them, one grasps them as a whole. Thus, some grasp the distinguished.

original: dbyig pa can la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa can la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the one with a stick.

original: don dang 'brel ba dang rjod par byed pa'i gtsug lag rnams mi shes na mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang 'brel ba dang rjod par byed pa'i gtsug lag rnams mi shes na mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise, because one would not know the relation to the object and the scriptures that express it.

original: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba dang ldan pa dag ni 'di la mi srid pa nyid ni /
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba dang ldan pa dag ni 'di la mi srid pa nyid ni /
translated: As for the relation to the class, quality, and action, it is impossible here.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa dag mi snang bas sbyor ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir chu dang 'o ma dag bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa dag mi snang bas sbyor ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir chu dang 'o ma dag bzhin no //
translated: Because it is unreasonable to apply the relation of different natures, and because there is no such understanding, like water and milk.

original: gang la tha dad par rtogs pa yod pa de la yang 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: gang la tha dad par rtogs pa yod pa de la yang 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Even where there is the understanding of difference, the grasping is

original: brda dran pa yi rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: brda dran pa yi rgyu can gyi //
translated: due to the memory of the sign.

original: mthong ba sdud pa'i bdag can de //
analyzed: mthong ba sdud pa'i bdag can de //
translated: The one who gathers the seen.üîΩ

original: snga phyi 'dzin pas stong pa yi //
analyzed: snga phyi 'dzin pas stong pa yi //
translated: The eye consciousness is not the appropriator of seeing, because it is devoid of the grasping of prior and subsequent moments.

original: mig shes la ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: mig shes la ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be the appropriator of seeing?

original: gang gi phyir 'di la 'di tsam byed pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la 'di tsam byed pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it does not have the capacity to do so,

original: yul gyi don nye ba'i stobs las skyes pas dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi don nye ba'i stobs las skyes pas dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises through the power of the object, and because it is non-analytical.

original: dpyod par byed pa nyid yin na ni yid kyi shes pa dang dbang po'i shes pa dag tha dad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩtha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dang dpog @155b pa dang mi dpog pa dang don yod pa la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa la sogs par thal
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa nyid yin na ni yid kyi shes pa dang dbang po'i shes pa dag tha dad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro // tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dang dpog @155b pa dang mi dpog pa dang don yod pa la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa la sogs par thal
translated: If it were analytical, then there would be no difference between mental consciousness and sense consciousness.

original: bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no difference, then it would follow, absurdly, that the grasping of the distinctions of past, future, and present things, the non-grasping of them, the measuring of them, the non-measuring of them, the dependence on the existence of the object, and the non-dependence on the existence of the object would all be the same.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa la dbang po'i shes par 'dzin par byed do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa la dbang po'i shes par 'dzin par byed do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the sense consciousness apprehends the object that is being cognized by the mental consciousness, then that is not so.

original: ji skad bshad pa mi 'dzin pas de ltar rtogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa mi 'dzin pas de ltar rtogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unreasonable to understand that which is not apprehended as explained.

original: yul ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not engage objects that are not its domain.

original: rigs la sogs pa dang / 'brel ba dang / 'das pa dang / sgra'i tha snyad las sogs pa rnams ni dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa dang / 'brel ba dang / 'das pa dang / sgra'i tha snyad las sogs pa rnams ni dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the domain of the sense consciousnesses is not the objects of the universals and so on, such as connection, past, and verbal conventions.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa ni don sbyor bar byed pa'i rtog pa rnams kyi nang du gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa ni don sbyor bar byed pa'i rtog pa rnams kyi nang du gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the sense consciousnesses are not included among the conceptual consciousnesses that engage objects.

original: de ni rtogs pas blangs na yang //
analyzed: de ni rtogs pas blangs na yang //
translated: Even if it were to engage them through conceptualization,

original: 'dod pas ldog dang nye ba yi //
analyzed: 'dod pas ldog dang nye ba yi //
translated: the desire to engage or not to engage

original: don la blo ni ltos med 'gyur //
analyzed: don la blo ni ltos med 'gyur //
translated: would be independent of the object.

original: gzhan yang 'di khyad par la sogs pa'i rtogs pas bslang ba yin na tshogs pa tshang ba can gyi 'jug pa yang 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di khyad par la sogs pa'i rtogs pas bslang ba yin na tshogs pa tshang ba can gyi 'jug pa yang 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it were to engage them through conceptualization of universals and so on, then the engagement of the complete collection of sense consciousnesses would be stopped by desire.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par rtogs pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par rtogs pa bzhin no ;
translated: It would be like the conceptual consciousnesses that are different from that.

original: / rnam par rtogs pa rnams ni so sor brtags pas bzlog par nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: / rnam par rtogs pa rnams ni so sor brtags pas bzlog par nus pa yin gyi /
translated: Conceptual thoughts can be averted by analysis,

original: dbang po'i blo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the cognition of the senses.

original: tshogs pa tshang ba la ba lang gi blo bzlog cing rtar rnam par brtags kyang ba lang du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tshang ba la ba lang gi blo bzlog cing rtar rnam par brtags kyang ba lang du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the cognition of an ox is averted and the object is imagined to be a horse, it is still seen as an ox.

original: 'di don nye ba las mi ltos par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di don nye ba las mi ltos par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And it would not depend on the presence of the object,

original: gang gi phyir pa lang la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don nye ba nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pa lang la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don nye ba nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: because the conceptual thought of an ox, etc. does not occur when the object is present.

original: 'di nyid kyis gzhan min zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis gzhan min zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is not so,

original: gang gi phyir 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni nye ba ma yin pa la mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba ni nye ba ma yin pa la mi 'gyur la /
translated: because it is not the case that the cognition of an ox occurs when the object is not present,

original: kho bo cag gi mngon sum yang 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi mngon sum yang 'di nyid yin te /
translated: then this is our perception.

original: don nye ba nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don nye ba nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is characterized by the ascertainment of the presence of the object.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: This is not so, because

original: de dbang spyod yul ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de dbang spyod yul ma yin phyir //
translated: the object is not the domain of the senses.

original: med dang tha dad med pa la'ang //
analyzed: med dang tha dad med pa la'ang //
translated: It is not nonexistent, nor is it not different.

original: rig pa las kyang blo der 'gyur //
analyzed: rig pa las kyang blo der 'gyur //
translated: and the cognition is derived from the awareness.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i don yin pa'i phyir de dbang po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa la med pa las tha dad pa ci yod ;
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i don yin pa'i phyir de dbang po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa la med pa las tha dad pa ci yod ;
translated: What difference is there between the non-existence of a sense-object that is not the domain of a sense-faculty and the non-existence of a sense-faculty that is not the domain of a sense-object?

original: de'i nus pa ni de las dngos su thams cad du logs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i nus pa ni de las dngos su thams cad du logs pa yin la /
translated: The capacity of the sense-object is not directly different from the sense-faculty.

original: brgyud pa nye bar sbyor na ni 'das pa las kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir yul ma yin pa nyid kyis med pa dang khyad par med pa la yang reg pa las 'di bum pa zhes rtogs pas ni 'di mngon sum dang ldan @156a * //
analyzed: brgyud pa nye bar sbyor na ni 'das pa las kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir yul ma yin pa nyid kyis med pa dang khyad par med pa la yang reg pa las 'di bum pa zhes rtogs pas ni 'di mngon sum dang ldan @156a * //
translated: If it were indirectly related, then the past would be seen.

original: par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the cognition of a pot is direct perception because it is not different from the non-existence of an object that is not the domain of a sense-faculty.

original: gal te reg de rdzas yin na /
analyzed: gal te reg de rdzas yin na /
translated: If contact is a substance,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: then it is not so.

original: rdzas ni reg pa yang yin pas reg nas 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas ni reg pa yang yin pas reg nas 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: If you say that contact is a substance and that it is grasped by contact,

original: ma yin 'di ni bum pa zhes //
analyzed: ma yin 'di ni bum pa zhes //
translated: then this is not so.

original: shes la kha dog snang phyir ro //
analyzed: shes la kha dog snang phyir ro //
translated: This is because the color appears in the cognition of a pot.

original: 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni reg pa'i dbang po las skyes par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni reg pa'i dbang po las skyes par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the cognition ‚Äúthis is a pot‚Äù arises from the contact of the sense-faculty because

original: de ltar sems pa na kha dog snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems pa na kha dog snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the color is seen.

original: des na dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni gzugs dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi rgyu can gyi yid yin no //
analyzed: des na dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni gzugs dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi rgyu can gyi yid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this conceptual thought is the mental consciousness that is the cause of the consciousnesses of form and touch.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gang zhig yod la gang mthong ba //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang zhig yod la gang mthong ba //
translated: When one sees something that exists,

original: de mthong ba las de yi sgra //
analyzed: de mthong ba las de yi sgra //
translated: one sees it and then remembers its name.

original: dran rigs de rtogs med na ni //
analyzed: dran rigs de rtogs med na ni //
translated: If one does not understand that,

original: sgra yi khyad par ji ltar dran //
analyzed: sgra yi khyad par ji ltar dran //
translated: how can one remember the particular name?

original: de ma dran na de dang don //
analyzed: de ma dran na de dang don //
translated: If one does not remember that,

original: bsres nas rig pa de ji ltar //
analyzed: bsres nas rig pa de ji ltar //
translated: how can one understand the object mixed with that?

original: gal te rang gi rjod par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i don nyid shes pas nges par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar nges pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rjod par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i don nyid shes pas nges par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar nges pa yin na /
translated: If one is certain that the object itself is ascertained by the cognition that depends on the particular expression of itself,

original: da ni dbang po'i shes pa'i brjod pa yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni dbang po'i shes pa'i brjod pa yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then now the particular expression of the sense consciousness would be understood,

original: rjod par byed pa'i khyad par dran par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i khyad par dran par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable to remember the particular expression.

original: gang gi phyir don mthong ba yod na ni de las don gyi khyad par nye ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don mthong ba yod na ni de las don gyi khyad par nye ba la /
translated: When the object is seen, then the particular object is near.

original: mthong ba'i sgra dran par 'gyur ba yin te me dang du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sgra dran par 'gyur ba yin te me dang du ba bzhin no //
translated: The sound is remembered when the meaning is seen, as in the case of fire and smoke.

original: 'dis sgra med par don mi mthong zhing ma mthong na yang sgra'i khyad par mi dran la ma dran na sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dis sgra med par don mi mthong zhing ma mthong na yang sgra'i khyad par mi dran la ma dran na sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: Without the sound, the meaning is not seen; and if it is not seen, the particular sound is not remembered. If it is not remembered, the connection is not made.

original: ma sbyar na rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa long ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma sbyar na rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa long ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the connection is not made, there is no understanding. Thus, the entire world would be blind.

original: don nye ba nyid kyi nang gi 'du byed sad par byas pa des dran par 'gyur gyi don mthong bas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don nye ba nyid kyi nang gi 'du byed sad par byas pa des dran par 'gyur gyi don mthong bas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The sound is remembered by the awakening of the internal formative forces due to the presence of the meaning, but not by seeing the meaning.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: brda ma mthong ba la med pas de'i 'brel pa ni rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda ma mthong ba la med pas de'i 'brel pa ni rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist for one who has not seen the sign, the connection is not due to its own essential nature.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas ni don rnams yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas ni don rnams yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning does not change due to the desire of a person,

original: brda'i dus su skyes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus su skyes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the essential nature that arises at the time of the sign does not exist.

original: yongs su 'gyur na ni de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan brda ma mthong ba rnams la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur na ni de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan brda ma mthong ba rnams la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to change completely, then it would be that nature, and it would be so for those who have not seen the sign.

original: skyes bu so so la don rnams bdag nyid tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu so so la don rnams bdag nyid tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The meanings are not different natures for each individual person,

original: bdag nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow that they would be without a nature,

original: bdag nyid gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a nature would not be present.

original: de'i phyir mthong bas na 'di sgra ma sbyar ba'i don nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong bas na 'di sgra ma sbyar ba'i don nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is seen, it is seen as the meaning that is not connected to a word.

original: yang na dbang po'i blo rtog @156b pa dang bral bar sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: yang na dbang po'i blo rtog @156b pa dang bral bar sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid do //
translated: Or, the proof that the cognition of the sense faculty is free from conceptuality is direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: thams cad las ni sems bsdus nas //
analyzed: thams cad las ni sems bsdus nas //
translated: When the mind is withdrawn from everything

original: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med par //üîΩgnas na'ang mig gis gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med par // gnas na'ang mig gis gzugs dag ni //
translated: and remains inwardly without wavering,üîΩeven then, the cognition that sees forms

original: mthong ba'i blo de dbang skyes yin //
analyzed: mthong ba'i blo de dbang skyes yin //
translated: is produced by the sense faculty.

original: brjod pa'i snang ba med pa'i snang ba ni srog chags thams cad kyi mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: brjod pa'i snang ba med pa'i snang ba ni srog chags thams cad kyi mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: The appearance of the non-existent appearance of expression is the direct perception of all living beings. Therefore, what is the use of another proof for this?

original: gang gis yod kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ba rnam par rtog pa 'di dag gi skye ba dang 'gag par rig par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis yod kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ba rnam par rtog pa 'di dag gi skye ba dang 'gag par rig par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the arising and ceasing of these conceptual thoughts is not known, because of which they would not be understood even though they exist.

original: 'di ltar slar yang cung zad rnam rtog na //
analyzed: 'di ltar slar yang cung zad rnam rtog na //
translated: In this way, again, a little conceptual thought

original: kho bo'i rnam rtog 'di 'drar 'gyur //üîΩzhes rig sngar bshad rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: kho bo'i rnam rtog 'di 'drar 'gyur // zhes rig sngar bshad rang bzhin gyis //
translated: becomes this kind of conceptual thought for me.üîΩThus, as previously explained,

original: dbang po las rtogs la min no //
analyzed: dbang po las rtogs la min no //
translated: it is known by nature, not by the sense faculties.

original: yang de bsdus pa las sems langs te //
analyzed: yang de bsdus pa las sems langs te //
translated: Moreover, the mind arises from that collection

original: cung zad rnam par rtog pa na //
analyzed: cung zad rnam par rtog pa na //
translated: and when there is a little conceptual thought,üîΩit is known that this kind of conceptual thought has occurred.

original: kho bo'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dang 'di 'dra bar gyur to zhes rang gi sems kyi rgyun sdom par byed do //
analyzed: kho bo'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dang 'di 'dra bar gyur to zhes rang gi sems kyi rgyun sdom par byed do //
translated: Thus, the continuum of one's own mind is connected.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di dag mngon sum yin na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i mthong ba la rtogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di dag mngon sum yin na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i mthong ba la rtogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, if these conceptual thoughts are direct perception, then why would the seeing that is subsumed by conceptual thought not be conceptual?

original: des na mthong ba'i bdag nyid rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa ni mngon sum yin pa'am /
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i bdag nyid rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa ni mngon sum yin pa'am /
translated: Thus that which is not mixed with conceptual thought that has the nature of seeing is direct perception.

original: mthong ba la snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa mi snang bas ni dbang po'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa mi snang bas ni dbang po'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Or, since conceptual thought that has the nature of appearing to seeing does not appear, conceptual thought is eliminated in the sense consciousness.

original: gang gis dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog par khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i blo mngon sum du gyur pa ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde ltar na re zhig skye ba dang 'gag par rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di don nam /
analyzed: gang gis dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog par khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i blo mngon sum du gyur pa ni ma yin no zhe na / de ltar na re zhig skye ba dang 'gag par rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di don nam /
translated: But it is not that a mind that is direct perception that contradicts the assertion that sense consciousness is conceptual.

original: blo gang gi nang du 'du /
analyzed: blo gang gi nang du 'du /
translated: In that case, first, is this conceptual thought that is known to arise and cease included in the object or the mind?

original: don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not included in the object.

original: nang du yongs su gsal ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i dbang gis skye ba dang 'gag par rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du yongs su gsal ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i dbang gis skye ba dang 'gag par rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is completely clear internally, and because it is not reasonable that it arises and ceases under the influence of desire.

original: blo ni 'dir 'gyur ba yin na mngon sum ma yin pa de ni 'jug tu zin kyang gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: blo ni 'dir 'gyur ba yin na mngon sum ma yin pa de ni 'jug tu zin kyang gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: If the mind were to change here, then even though it engages, it would not be clear.

original: gsal ba'i don kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /üîΩ'di gzhan 'ga' zhig dang rjes su 'brel pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir don dang brjod pa'i rjes su byed pa nyams su myong ba'i bdag @157a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i don kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin zhing / 'di gzhan 'ga' zhig dang rjes su 'brel pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir don dang brjod pa'i rjes su byed pa nyams su myong ba'i bdag @157a * //
translated: And the meaning of clarity would not be like that.

original: nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is not related to anything else, the nature of the experience of the mind that conforms to the meaning and the expression would not exist.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yang blo yin la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yang blo yin la /
translated: The experience of pleasure and so on is also the mind.

original: de yang lkog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de las phan pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang lkog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de las phan pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And because that is hidden, it would not be beneficial or harmful.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis myong ba bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the experience of another person.

original: 'di dag mngon sum gyis shes pa ma yin na bdag nyid la rtogs par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag mngon sum gyis shes pa ma yin na bdag nyid la rtogs par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If these are not known by direct perception, then how could they be known by oneself?

original: don ma shes par blo mi 'grub pas na de shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa las khong du chud pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don ma shes par blo mi 'grub pas na de shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa las khong du chud pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since the mind is not established without understanding the object, the understanding of that is the comprehension from inference.

original: gang gis 'di skad smra ba'i tshig la yang 'jig rten na rna gtod par byed pa ni rgyal ba'i sgra bsgrags pas blun po rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di skad smra ba'i tshig la yang 'jig rten na rna gtod par byed pa ni rgyal ba'i sgra bsgrags pas blun po rgyal ba yin no //
translated: But the world listens to the words of one who speaks in this way. The fool is victorious by the proclamation of the Victor.

original: don shes pa zhes bya ba blo'i sgrub par byed pa ni rtogs pa yin la blo ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni bsngags par 'os pa'i shes rab can lha rnams dga' bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don shes pa zhes bya ba blo'i sgrub par byed pa ni rtogs pa yin la blo ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni bsngags par 'os pa'i shes rab can lha rnams dga' bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The establishment of the mind called understanding of the object is the comprehension, not the mind. This is said because the wise who are worthy of praise delight the gods.

original: don shes pa ni blo'i rtags ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po dang don dag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don shes pa ni blo'i rtags ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po dang don dag yin no zhe na /
translated: The understanding of the object is not a mark of the mind, but rather the sense faculty and the object.

original: mi 'khrul na gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul na gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: If there is no error, it is a reason.

original: yid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the mental faculty,

original: de yang bar du ma chod pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin par rig ste /
analyzed: de yang bar du ma chod pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin par rig ste /
translated: then it is known that the prior consciousness itself is the cause of the uninterrupted consciousness.

original: de yul gzhan la sems gtad cing nus pa nyams par gyur na gzhan la shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yul gzhan la sems gtad cing nus pa nyams par gyur na gzhan la shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the mind is directed to another object, its power is diminished, and the cognition of another is not produced.

original: de yang ma grub po //
analyzed: de yang ma grub po //
translated: And that is not established.

original: yul gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the object is clear,

original: gsal ba de nyid blo ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal ba de nyid blo ma yin nam /
translated: is not that clarity itself the cognition?

original: de'i khyad par can de yang ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i khyad par can de yang ma grub po //
translated: And that which has its distinction is not established.

original: gsal ba ni blo ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba ni blo ma yin te /
translated: Clarity is not cognition,

original: don gyi bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is the nature of the object.

original: blos ma bskyed na ji ltar blo'i go par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: blos ma bskyed na ji ltar blo'i go par byed pa yin te /
translated: If it is not produced by cognition, how can it be understood by cognition,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection.

original: don gyi bdag nyid kyang thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi blo yang rjes su dpag par thal lo //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid kyang thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi blo yang rjes su dpag par thal lo //
translated: And because the nature of the object is common, it follows that the cognition of another can also be inferred.

original: rtags grub kyang ma grub pas ni blo dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags grub kyang ma grub pas ni blo dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if the reason is established, it is not established by the non-established, so it is not an inference because there is no connection with cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i brjod pa med pa yang mngon sum du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i brjod pa med pa yang mngon sum du snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, its inexpressibility also appears as perception.

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la //
translated: Without the activity of the sense faculties,

original: sgra yis don ni mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: sgra yis don ni mthong ba bzhin //
translated: like seeing an object with sound.

original: blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it does not appear to the mind.

original: de ni brjod med rtogs byed yin //
analyzed: de ni brjod med rtogs byed yin //
translated: It is the cause of the understanding of the inexpressible.

original: yang mngon sum de ni rjod du med pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: yang mngon sum de ni rjod du med pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: Moreover, that perception has an inexpressible object,

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la mthong ba bzhin du sgras blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la mthong ba bzhin du sgras blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like the activity of the sense faculties, it does not appear to the mind through words.

original: gang gi phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes @157b pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes @157b pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: That which does not appear to the cognition that arises from words is not the meaning of the word.

original: sgra'i yul nyid ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i yul nyid ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The object of the word is not a thing,

original: mthong ba la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears in a different form to the perception.

original: de nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is only for the reason that it is not that [thing] that it is not that [thing].

original: dngos po med kyang sgra las byung ba'i snang ba mi nyams pas med pa'i don snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med kyang sgra las byung ba'i snang ba mi nyams pas med pa'i don snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is not a thing, the appearance that arises from the word is not impaired, so there is no difference between the appearance of a nonexistent object.

original: yod kyang shes pa de ni de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod kyang shes pa de ni de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though it exists, that cognition does not apprehend its nature,

original: de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not follow its existence or nonexistence.

original: dri la ro'i blo bzhin dang / gzugs la mig gi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dri la ro'i blo bzhin dang / gzugs la mig gi blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of taste in regard to smell, and like the cognition of the eye in regard to form.

original: rnam par gtod par nus pa'i phyir shes pa'i yul ni rgyu yin na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gtod par nus pa'i phyir shes pa'i yul ni rgyu yin na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The object of cognition is the cause because it is able to project the cognition. That which does not follow and reverse is not the cause.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no //
translated: That which is not the cause is not the object.

original: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the conceptual cognition that arises from words does not have a real entity as its object.

original: sgra sbyar ba yang don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: sgra sbyar ba yang don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: The application of words is for the purpose of understanding the meaning.

original: gang la sgra dang 'brel par mthong ba tha snyad kyi tshe rtogs par 'gyur ba dbang po'i don ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gcig tu mthong ba'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: gang la sgra dang 'brel par mthong ba tha snyad kyi tshe rtogs par 'gyur ba dbang po'i don ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te / 'di ltar gcig tu mthong ba'i khyad par ni /
translated: When the conventional is seen to be connected with words, the object of the sense faculty is not seen to follow and reverse.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig tu ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig tu ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the difference in seeing one thing is not seen in any other.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba ma yin te ;
translated: Because the individual natures do not follow each other,

original: nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference of potency, manifestation, etc.

original: de las spyi gzhan tha dad ni //
analyzed: de las spyi gzhan tha dad ni //
translated: There is no difference of the universal from that,

original: yod min tha dad blo med phyir //
analyzed: yod min tha dad blo med phyir //
translated: because there is no cognition of difference.

original: gang las sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams las tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i don ni ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams las tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i don ni ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not see a meaning that is different from the individual essences of the things from which the word is used.

original: don tha dad pa nyid la ni blo tha dad pa mthong ste /
analyzed: don tha dad pa nyid la ni blo tha dad pa mthong ste /
translated: In the case of difference of meaning, we do see a difference of cognition,

original: 'byung po dang mgul chings bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung po dang mgul chings bzhin no //
translated: as in the case of ‚Äúelement‚Äù and ‚Äúgarland.‚Äù

original: de la tha dad pa med kyang don tha dad par rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa med kyang don tha dad par rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there were a difference of meaning without a difference of cognition, there would be an absurd consequence:

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid la gcig nges pa med pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma rtogs pas 'gro ba gcig dang du ma ra mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid la gcig nges pa med pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma rtogs pas 'gro ba gcig dang du ma ra mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because there would be no single thing among all the essences, and there would be no cognition of difference, there would be neither a single nor a multiple world.

original: de lta mod kyi spyi snang du zin kyang ma rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad par nges par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi spyi snang du zin kyang ma rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad par nges par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But even if the universal were perceived, it would not be ascertained as different, because it is not cognized.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: de la gzhan la blo dang ni //
analyzed: de la gzhan la blo dang ni //
translated: The cognition and the word do not fail to apply to the other.

original: sgra 'jug phyir na mi rtogs min //
analyzed: sgra 'jug phyir na mi rtogs min //
translated: The cognition and the word do not fail to apply to the other.

original: blo dang sgra rjes su 'gro ba'i mi rten pa'i khyad par 'di spyi mthong ba'i stobs @158a * //
analyzed: blo dang sgra rjes su 'gro ba'i mi rten pa'i khyad par 'di spyi mthong ba'i stobs @158a * //
translated: This is the difference between the non-dependent and the dependent.

original: kyis rjes su 'gro ba ni ci ltar mi rtogs zhes bya /
analyzed: kyis rjes su 'gro ba ni ci ltar mi rtogs zhes bya /
translated: How can it be that the cognition and the word do not fail to apply to the other?

original: gang las gang la sgra dang blo 'jug pa de ma rtogs par ni de de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang las gang la sgra dang blo 'jug pa de ma rtogs par ni de de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not understand that the cognition and the word apply to the other unless one understands that the cognition and the word apply to the other.

original: dbyug pa can la sogs pa bzhin bdag nyid las ji ltar tha snyad du 'gyur /üîΩyul can nyid //
analyzed: dbyug pa can la sogs pa bzhin bdag nyid las ji ltar tha snyad du 'gyur / yul can nyid //
translated: How can there be a convention from the self, as in the case of the club-man?

original: de la spyi mi snang ba'i phyir dang / gsal ba rnams kyang rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir dbang po'i blo ni brjod du med pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin khyad par can nyid mngon sum du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la spyi mi snang ba'i phyir dang / gsal ba rnams kyang rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir dbang po'i blo ni brjod du med pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin khyad par can nyid mngon sum du byed pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty is the direct perception of the special nature of the inexpressible thing, because the universal does not appear and the particulars do not follow.

original: 'o na da ni mngon sum ma yin ma nges pa'i bdag nyid las ji ltar tha snyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na da ni mngon sum ma yin ma nges pa'i bdag nyid las ji ltar tha snyad du 'gyur /
translated: Then how can there be a convention from the non-direct perception and the uncertain self?

original: 'di'o zhes bya bar nges na ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa dag thob pa dang spong ba'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'o zhes bya bar nges na ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa dag thob pa dang spong ba'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If one ascertains ‚Äúthis is it,‚Äù then one would engage in the aim of obtaining pleasure and avoiding pain.

original: skyon ni med de /
analyzed: skyon ni med de /
translated: There is no error,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: don mthong ba nyid mthong rnams la //
analyzed: don mthong ba nyid mthong rnams la //
translated: Those who see the object see it

original: myong ba'i mthu las byung ba yi //
analyzed: myong ba'i mthu las byung ba yi //
translated: through the power of experience.

original: dran pas mngon par 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: dran pas mngon par 'dod pa yis //
translated: Desire is generated through memory,

original: tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa yin //
translated: and conventional activity is engaged in.

original: mngon sum don la lta ba tsam yin yang nyams su myong ba'i mthu las byung ba myong ba mtshams sbyor ba'i dran pa las /
analyzed: mngon sum don la lta ba tsam yin yang nyams su myong ba'i mthu las byung ba myong ba mtshams sbyor ba'i dran pa las /
translated: Even though the seeing of the object is merely seeing, through the power of experience, memory that connects with experience is generated.

original: de mthong ba nyid na mthong ba rnams la mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de mthong ba nyid na mthong ba rnams la mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Through that, desire is generated for those who see it, and conventional activity is engaged in by the other.

original: gsal bar nyams su myong ba las dran pa'i sa bon 'jog pa gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar nyams su myong ba las dran pa'i sa bon 'jog pa gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin la /
translated: It is the nature of things that the seed of memory is planted through the experience of the object.

original: de dang 'dra ba mthong ba las 'di sad pas mngon par 'dod pa'i bag chags 'jug cing de las kyang 'jug pa yin no //üîΩdbang shes de ma thag rkyen las //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba mthong ba las 'di sad pas mngon par 'dod pa'i bag chags 'jug cing de las kyang 'jug pa yin no // dbang shes de ma thag rkyen las //
translated: The mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.

original: byung zhing de don de ma thag /'dzin par byed pa'i yid kyang ngo //üîΩmngon sum zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byung zhing de don de ma thag /'dzin par byed pa'i yid kyang ngo // mngon sum zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
