translated: The mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.

original: rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i skad cig ma lhan cig byed pa tsam gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i yid kyang mngon sum yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir dbang po med par mthong ba ma yin zhing /üîΩyul gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin no //üîΩrang gi shes pa'i dus na yod pa de dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa yin pa'i don ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i skad cig ma lhan cig byed pa tsam gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i yid kyang mngon sum yin no // de nyid kyi phyir dbang po med par mthong ba ma yin zhing / yul gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin no // rang gi shes pa'i dus na yod pa de dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa yin pa'i don ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.üîΩThe mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.

original: gnyis ka yang dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental consciousness is also direct perception, because it arises from the immediately antecedent condition of the sense consciousnesses and grasps the object that is immediately past.

original: med pas lngar nus pa med pa'i phyir dang / nus pa'i dus na yang @158b 'bras bu rdzogs zin pas nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu yul ni lhan cig 'byung bar 'gal lo //üîΩdus tha dad pa ji ltar gzung //
analyzed: med pas lngar nus pa med pa'i phyir dang / nus pa'i dus na yang @158b 'bras bu rdzogs zin pas nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu yul ni lhan cig 'byung bar 'gal lo // dus tha dad pa ji ltar gzung //
translated: Because the object does not exist, it cannot be the cause of consciousness. And even if it could exist, it would be useless as a cause, since the effect has already been completed.

original: zhe na shes la rnam pa ni //
analyzed: zhe na shes la rnam pa ni //
translated: How can there be an object that is different from consciousness?üîΩThe form of an object is placed in consciousness

original: 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid la //
analyzed: 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid la //
translated: by the power of the cause.

original: gzung bar 'thad pa shes pas rig / ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar 'thad pa shes pas rig / ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verse is an interpolation.

original: 'di tshad ma snga ma'i yul 'dzin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma snga ma'i yul 'dzin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The object of a prior valid cognition is not the object of a subsequent valid cognition,

original: tshad ma ni ma rtogs pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma ni ma rtogs pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because a valid cognition is defined as a nonerroneous awareness of an uncognized object.

original: gzhan du na ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmthong ba'i 'du byed ma nyams pa'i gzung ba 'dzin pa ni dran pa las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro // mthong ba'i 'du byed ma nyams pa'i gzung ba 'dzin pa ni dran pa las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.üîΩThe object of a memory that apprehends a perceived and unimpaired object is not different from the object of a prior perception.

original: bya ba rdzogs pa'i las la khyad par du byed pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rdzogs pa'i las la khyad par du byed pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The object of a prior perception is not different from the object of a subsequent memory.

original: zhes bya ba yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshul las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshul las 'das pa yin no //
translated: This also is beyond the method of proof.

original: don de rgyur gyur pa can gyi blo rnams rim gyis 'byung ba 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: don de rgyur gyur pa can gyi blo rnams rim gyis 'byung ba 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: And it is contradictory that the cognitions which have that object as their cause should arise in succession.

original: gzhan gyi khyad par du bya ba med pa ni ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / mi ltos na yang rim gyis skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par du bya ba med pa ni ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / mi ltos na yang rim gyis skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not tenable that what is not the qualifier of another is dependent, and if it is not dependent, it is not tenable that it arises in succession.

original: khyad par du bya ba nyid yin na ni gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba nyid yin na ni gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: If it is the qualifier, it is different.

original: don rnams skad cig ma nyid kyis 'das pa'i phyir med pa ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don rnams skad cig ma nyid kyis 'das pa'i phyir med pa ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Since objects are momentary, they do not exist when they are apprehended.

original: de'i phyir rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir don gzhan nyid yid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir don gzhan nyid yid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are produced by conditions, the mind understands objects as different.

original: bde ba la sogs rang rig rnams //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa rnams kyang mngon sum mo //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs rang rig rnams // bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa rnams kyang mngon sum mo //
translated: Cognition of pleasure, etc., and of itselfüîΩare also direct perception.

original: bde ba la sogs pa smos pa ni nyams su myong ba gsal ba bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa smos pa ni nyams su myong ba gsal ba bstan pa'i don te /
translated: The mention of pleasure, etc., is for the purpose of teaching the clarity of experience.

original: shes pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rig pa ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rig pa ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the awareness of the nature of all cognitions is perception.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid rig pa la ni rnam par rtog pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid rig pa la ni rnam par rtog pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible that the awareness of the nature of pleasure, etc. is conceptual,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: gzhan la brten min bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la brten min bdag nyid phyir //
translated: they are not dependent on another, because of their nature.

original: bde sogs rnams la brda nus min //
analyzed: bde sogs rnams la brda nus min //
translated: The convention is not possible in regard to pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa rnams ma rig pas yul du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa rnams ma rig pas yul du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The individual natures of pleasure, etc., which are not produced, are not objects of ignorance,

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is their nature.

original: 'di dag la 'di rjod par byed pa sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la 'di rjod par byed pa sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The application of the expression ‚Äúthis‚Äù to them is not possible,

original: bdag nyid la de ltar 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la de ltar 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for it to operate in that way on itself.

original: de'i rang bzhin sngon ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / brjod par gzo ba na yul @159a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin sngon ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / brjod par gzo ba na yul @159a * //
translated: Because its nature is not seen previously, and because it is not possible to express it when the object is

original: dang de tha dad pa med pas na rig pa yang 'gags pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i brda med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: dang de tha dad pa med pas na rig pa yang 'gags pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i brda med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: and since the two are not different, consciousness also is not perceived, because there is no sign of the object and subject.

original: gzhan gyis kyang 'das pa'i rang bzhin rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang 'das pa'i rang bzhin rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the nature of the past perceived by another.

original: yang 'byung ba ma yin pa ni brda don med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba ma yin pa ni brda don med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it a future object, because there is no sign of the object.

original: de phyir de dag rang rig ni //
analyzed: de phyir de dag rang rig ni //
translated: Therefore, that self-awareness

original: brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin //
analyzed: brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin //
translated: is not related to expression.

original: brda mi nus pa'i phyir na bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid rig pa brjod pa dang ma 'brel pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: brda mi nus pa'i phyir na bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid rig pa brjod pa dang ma 'brel pa de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not capable of being a sign, the self-awareness of pleasure and so on, which is not related to expression, is a valid form of direct perception.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Pleasure and so on are not by nature self-awareness.

original: 'on kyang don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: Rather, they are objects of self-awareness that are included in the same consciousness.

original: zhes zer ba de dag gi yang //üîΩde dang de min rang bzhin can //
analyzed: zhes zer ba de dag gi yang // de dang de min rang bzhin can //
translated: But for them,üîΩit would arise from a cause that is

original: de de min dngos rgyu las skyes //
analyzed: de de min dngos rgyu las skyes //
translated: neither that nor something other.

original: des shes tha dad med rgyus bskyed //
analyzed: des shes tha dad med rgyus bskyed //
translated: The cause of the non-difference of the cognition is the cause of the difference of the pleasure, etc.

original: bde sogs ci phyir shes ma yin //
analyzed: bde sogs ci phyir shes ma yin //
translated: Why are pleasure, etc. not cognitions?

original: de dag kyang de dang de ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo can gyi dngos po rnams kyi de'i rang bzhin can dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can la brgal zhing brtags pa na /
analyzed: de dag kyang de dang de ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo can gyi dngos po rnams kyi de'i rang bzhin can dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can la brgal zhing brtags pa na /
translated: When one examines and analyzes the entities that have the nature of pleasure, etc., which have the nature of being and not being that,

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin dang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes rgyu'i rang bzhin la brten te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin dang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes rgyu'i rang bzhin la brten te /
translated: the cause of that nature is the cause of that nature, and the cause of the non-nature of that is the cause of the non-nature of that.

original: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dag las ni de bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dag las ni de bskyed pa yin la /
translated: For example, from rice seeds, rice is produced,

original: de las gzhan pa dag las ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag las ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
translated: and from other seeds, other things are produced.

original: glo bur ba nyid la ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur ba nyid la ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the accidental has a definite place, time, and nature.

original: de la bde ba la sogs pa yul med par ni skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la bde ba la sogs pa yul med par ni skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Among them, pleasure, etc. do not arise without an object.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yul dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams de tshogs pa med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yul dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams de tshogs pa med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure, etc. are related to the object as it is, and they do not occur without that assemblage.

original: dbang po med par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po med par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it without a sense faculty,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang rjes su 'brel ba can rnams de'i yul can gyi dbang po dang bral ba la ma mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang rjes su 'brel ba can rnams de'i yul can gyi dbang po dang bral ba la ma mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: because those that are related to form, etc. are not seen to be divorced from the sense faculty that is their object,

original: dbang po nyams pa med pa nye bar gnas pa na yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa med pa nye bar gnas pa na yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because they occur when the unimpaired sense faculty is present.

original: yid la byed pa med par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it without attention,

original: gnyis ka tshogs kyang gnyid la sogs pas bslad pa'i blo can la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka tshogs kyang gnyid la sogs pas bslad pa'i blo can la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist for those who are asleep, etc., even when the two are assembled.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba la yang rgyu'i tshogs pa 'di dag tsam kho nar zad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba la yang rgyu'i tshogs pa 'di dag tsam kho nar zad do //
translated: The assemblage of causes for the arising of consciousness is just this much.

original: @159b des na rang gi ngo bos de'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa na bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: @159b des na rang gi ngo bos de'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa na bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the nature of its effect is ascertained as having its own nature, pleasure, etc. are not of the nature of the non-apprehension of objects.

original: 'dus byas pa la nges pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa la nges pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is the conditioned that is the cause, that is not so,

original: de'i nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its power is not seen.

original: de tsam las byung ba la gzhan rgyur brtags na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam las byung ba la gzhan rgyur brtags na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine something else as the cause of that, there would be the fault of an infinite regress.

original: 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyur rung ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin par kho bos rtogs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyur rung ba'i rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin par kho bos rtogs te /
translated: We understand that the so-called conditioned is the prior consciousness itself, which is suitable as the cause of consciousness.

original: nang gi byed pa nyid las byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa goms pa g-yer ba dang gzhan pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi byed pa nyid las byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa goms pa g-yer ba dang gzhan pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because pleasure, etc., which arise from the inner activity, conform to the differences of the consciousness that is the cause of the pleasure, etc.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it follows that there would be no difference in pleasure, etc., because the cause is the same, that is not so.

original: de'i tshogs pa nyid kyi nang gi khyad par gyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i tshogs pa nyid kyi nang gi khyad par gyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because the difference is made by the inner difference in the collection of causes, just as doubt and certainty, etc., are.

original: gzhan dag bde ba la sogs pa ni nang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag bde ba la sogs pa ni nang ma yin la /
translated: Others say: Pleasure, etc. are not internal,

original: sems pa can yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems pa can yang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor do they have a mind.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sgra la sogs pa nyams su myong ba las de nyams su myong bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sgra la sogs pa nyams su myong ba las de nyams su myong bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But they are known through the experience of sound, etc. that is of their nature.

original: zhes zer ba de'i ltar na yang //
analyzed: zhes zer ba de'i ltar na yang //
translated: Even according to that,

original: phyi rol khyad par med na yang //
analyzed: phyi rol khyad par med na yang //
translated: if external things are not different,

original: dga' dang yongs su gdung ba dang // goms pas khyad par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dga' dang yongs su gdung ba dang // goms pas khyad par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: then pleasure, pain, and indifference would not be different, because they are habituated.

original: bde sogs don gyi rang bzhin min //
analyzed: bde sogs don gyi rang bzhin min //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. are not the nature of objects.

original: gang gi phyir gal te bde ba la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin na khyad par med pa la goms pa'i khyad par las dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te bde ba la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin na khyad par med pa la goms pa'i khyad par las dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If pleasure, etc. were of the nature of sound, etc., then without difference, pleasure and pain would not be different due to the difference of habituation.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: This is like the difference in the appearance of blue, etc.

original: de'i khyad par la mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par dang rjes su 'brel ba de dag ni blo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par la mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par dang rjes su 'brel ba de dag ni blo nyid yin te /
translated: Those that are not dependent on that difference, but are related to the difference of habituation, are just cognition.

original: shes rab la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the wisdom faculty, etc.

original: myong phyir sems pa de'i rang bzhin //
analyzed: myong phyir sems pa de'i rang bzhin //
translated: It is the nature of the mind, because it is experienced.

original: ma yin myong ba min phyir ro //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni sems pa can yang yin te /
analyzed: ma yin myong ba min phyir ro // bde ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni sems pa can yang yin te /
translated: It is not, because it is not experienced.

original: myong bar bya ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir gang zhig yul gang gi rnam pa myong ba @160a * //
analyzed: myong bar bya ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir gang zhig yul gang gi rnam pa myong ba @160a * //
translated: These feelings, etc. are also the possessor of the mind, because they are also to be experienced.

original: ma yin pa de ni de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin pa de ni de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not experience the form of an object is not the experiencer of that object,

original: phan tshun rang bzhin med pa'i bde ba la sogs pa myong ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin med pa'i bde ba la sogs pa myong ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: like the feeling of pleasure, etc. which is not the nature of each other.

original: 'di 'di'i myong bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mngon par gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di 'di'i myong bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mngon par gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for the relation, ‚ÄúThis is the experiencer of that,‚Äù is clearly evident.

original: dbang po la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur bas de myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur bas de myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since the faculties, etc. would also be the consequence, the characteristic of the experience is the same.

original: sngar de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de phyis kyang de'i bdag nyid nyams pa med pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba yang sems la ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sngar de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de phyis kyang de'i bdag nyid nyams pa med pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba yang sems la ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it were not of that nature previously, then later also it would not be of that nature, because it would not have been damaged. How could it be similar to the mind?

original: 'di ni 'di'i nyes pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i nyes pa gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another fault of his theory.

original: 'dra ba med par ni myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba med par ni myong ba ma yin no //
translated: There is no experience without similarity.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa yod pa nyid ni de'i myong bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa yod pa nyid ni de'i myong bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The existence of awareness is not reasonable as its experience,

original: thams cad la khyad par med pas na thams cad rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la khyad par med pas na thams cad rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference between them, and it would follow that everything would be aware of everything.

original: de la 'dra ba yod na ni 'dra bar byed pa la sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dra ba yod na ni 'dra bar byed pa la sbyor ba yin no //
translated: If there were similarity, then it would be applied to the one who makes it similar.

original: sim par myong ba gang yin pa 'di nyid kyang kho bo cag gi bde ba yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni sems pa can yin par grub bo //
analyzed: sim par myong ba gang yin pa 'di nyid kyang kho bo cag gi bde ba yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni sems pa can yin par grub bo //
translated: Since this very experience of pleasure is our pleasure, it is established that pleasure and so on are mental.

original: yul dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir myong ba de'i bdag nyid yin na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir myong ba de'i bdag nyid yin na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that experience is of the nature of the object because it is similar to the object, then pleasure and so on would not be experienced.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: khyed kyi phyogs la yang bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ni yod pa de yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs la yang bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ni yod pa de yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du bkod pa yin no //
translated: You also experience pleasure, etc.

original: de la yang dga' ba dang yongs su gdung bar gcig tu nang na nyams su myong ba nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la yang dga' ba dang yongs su gdung bar gcig tu nang na nyams su myong ba nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: And in this case, the experience of pleasure, etc. is seen to be internal.

original: 'di'i bdag nyid 'di 'jog par byed pa gzhan yin par ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩde khyad par med khyad par du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid 'di 'jog par byed pa gzhan yin par ni rigs pa ma yin te / de khyad par med khyad par du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to posit another self that is the experiencer of this.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa ni khyad par du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa ni khyad par du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from it, and because it is established as different.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa ni blo yin gyi myong ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa ni blo yin gyi myong ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is the cognition that is endowed with the distinction, not the experience.

original: blo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / zhe na pa'o ;
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / zhe na pa'o ;
translated: What is this so-called cognition?

original: / myong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: / myong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: What is this so-called experience?

original: 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi don ni myong ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi don ni myong ba med pa yin la /
translated: The object that has the form of the object is not the experience.

original: gzhan ni myong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni myong ba yin no //
translated: The other is the experience.

original: myong ba med pa'i 'dra ba blo'o mtshan nyid yin na ni 'dra ba @160b gzhan yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong ba med pa'i 'dra ba blo'o mtshan nyid yin na ni 'dra ba @160b gzhan yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: If the characteristic of cognition is a likeness that is not experienced, then other likenesses would also be that.

original: khyad par yod na yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang brjod dgos so //
translated: And if there is a difference, it must be stated.

original: nang gi byed pa nyid la sogs pa yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'am /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa nyid la sogs pa yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'am /
translated: And the internal activity itself, etc., are based on that.

original: rtogs pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrags par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrags par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, because it is not a part of understanding, it is not to be proclaimed,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i shin tu dang ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i shin tu dang ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is another difference, such as extreme clarity, etc.

original: yul rnam par 'jog pa yang myong bar mthar thug pa'i phyir sems pa med pa des don rnam par 'jog par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul rnam par 'jog pa yang myong bar mthar thug pa'i phyir sems pa med pa des don rnam par 'jog par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: And how can that which is without thought determine objects, because the determination of objects is ultimately experienced?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsgra la sogs pa'i bde ba khyad par med kyang ;
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // sgra la sogs pa'i bde ba khyad par med kyang ;
translated: Because it would lead to absurdity.üîΩAnd the statement that although there is no difference in the pleasure of sound, etc.,

original: blo'i bde ba khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba yang tshig tsam yin te /
analyzed: blo'i bde ba khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba yang tshig tsam yin te /
translated: the pleasure of cognition is different is mere words,

original: 'di dag gcig la cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gcig la cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because these are mutually exclusive in one thing at one time.

original: de'i phyir sems pa yod pa las gzhan khyad par can gyi blo ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems pa yod pa las gzhan khyad par can gyi blo ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no cognition that is different from the existence of mind.

original: de yi rang bzhin las ldog pa'i //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin las ldog pa'i //
translated: The cognition that is the opposite of its nature

original: blo ni rtogs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni rtogs pa med phyir ro //
translated: is not perceived.

original: 'di ni dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur /
translated: This is because it is seen that there is a variety of mental states, such as joy and dejection,

original: rnam pa du mar gcig tu myong ba nyid yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar gcig tu myong ba nyid yin par mthong ste /
translated: and that a single mind has many different experiences.

original: de la ming ni ji ltar 'dod par byed la rag go //
analyzed: de la ming ni ji ltar 'dod par byed la rag go //
translated: The name is given as one wishes.

original: myong ba ni mngon sum ma yin la blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni mngon sum yin no zhe na /
analyzed: myong ba ni mngon sum ma yin la blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni mngon sum yin no zhe na /
translated: But experience is not perception, and the transformation of the mind is perception.

original: yul la longs spyod pa ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: yul la longs spyod pa ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: The experience of an object is perception.

original: de mngon sum ma yin na gzhan gyi mngon sum bzhin du thams cad mngon sum yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum ma yin na gzhan gyi mngon sum bzhin du thams cad mngon sum yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not perception, then, like the perception of another, everything would be perception.

original: yul yod pa las yul la longs spyod par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul yod pa las yul la longs spyod par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the experience of an object occurs because of the existence of an object.

original: de'i longs spyod pa ni mngon sum ma yin pas khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i longs spyod pa ni mngon sum ma yin pas khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since its experience is not perception, the difference is not established.

original: yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is no different from a non-existent.

original: rtags can gyi nye bar longs spyod pa yang nye bar longs spyod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtags can gyi nye bar longs spyod pa yang nye bar longs spyod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The experience of the possessor of the sign is not an experience,

original: gzhan gyis longs spyod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis longs spyod pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is like the experience of another.

original: rtags ma grub pa'i phyir de las kyang mi 'grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtags ma grub pa'i phyir de las kyang mi 'grub pa nyid de /
translated: The reason is not established, so it is not established from that either,

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it was explained before.

original: de lta na yang yul dmigs pa mngon sum yin pa na tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes pa yod pa gzhan ni don med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang yul dmigs pa mngon sum yin pa na tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes pa yod pa gzhan ni don med do //
translated: Even so, since the object is directly perceived when the perception is complete, the other existence is meaningless.

original: de yang rang bzhin gcig nyid du mthong ba'i phyir @161a * //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gcig nyid du mthong ba'i phyir @161a * //
translated: And that is seen to be the same nature,

original: blo gzhan la nyams su myong ba yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gzhan la nyams su myong ba yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: so the experience of another mind is not another.üîΩIf you say that the object is not different from the mind,

original: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin du //üîΩ'dres pas rnam dbyer med ce na //
analyzed: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin du // 'dres pas rnam dbyer med ce na //
translated: because they are mixed like a lump of iron and fire,

original: sems pa dang ni zhen pa dag tha dad kyang 'dres pas rnam par bslad pa la bye brag tu rtogs par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: sems pa dang ni zhen pa dag tha dad kyang 'dres pas rnam par bslad pa la bye brag tu rtogs par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: then the distinction is not understood in the error of mixing, even though thinking and attachment are different.

original: lcags kyi gong bu dang me bzhin te /
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu dang me bzhin te /
translated: It is like a lump of iron and fire.

original: de'i gzugs dang reg pa ni nges pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang reg pa ni nges pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because its form and touch are certain.

original: de ltar yin na dngos kun la //
analyzed: de ltar yin na dngos kun la //
translated: If that were so, then all things

original: tha dad tha dad med gzhag nyams //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med gzhag nyams //
translated: Would be undermined in being posited as different or not different.

original: don dmigs pa thams cad la 'dres par dogs par gcig tu nges pa med pa'i phyir dang / bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa dag kyang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dmigs pa thams cad la 'dres par dogs par gcig tu nges pa med pa'i phyir dang / bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa dag kyang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no certainty that all objects of observation that are mixed are one, and because objects of observation that are different, such as pleasure and blue, and so forth, are not different.üîΩOh! How are those different and not different posited in dependence on what cause?

original: ae ma'o tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa de dag rgyu ci la brten nas rnam par 'jog / tha dad med rig gcig yin na //
analyzed: ae ma'o tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa de dag rgyu ci la brten nas rnam par 'jog / tha dad med rig gcig yin na //
translated: If there is no difference in awareness,

original: de ltar gang yin de tha dad //
analyzed: de ltar gang yin de tha dad //
translated: Then whatever it is, it is different.

original: 'grub par 'gyur de sgrub byed min //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur de sgrub byed min //
translated: It would be established, but it is not an establisher.

original: tha dad sgrub byed 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad sgrub byed 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: If it is different, it would not be an establisher.

original: dkar sdug la sogs tha dad snang //
analyzed: dkar sdug la sogs tha dad snang //
translated: White, beautiful, and so forth appear different.

original: tha dad ma yin blo myong ni //üîΩtha dad med snang tha dad na //
analyzed: tha dad ma yin blo myong ni // tha dad med snang tha dad na //
translated: The experience of awareness is not different.üîΩIf it appears different, it is different.

original: tha dad tha dad med rten cing //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med rten cing //
translated: Difference and nondifference are dependent.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses that summarize the chapter.

original: lcags kyi gong bu la yang me dang 'brel ba las de ltar skyes pa'i don gcig nyid mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu la yang me dang 'brel ba las de ltar skyes pa'i don gcig nyid mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: In the case of a lump of iron, one sees that the same thing occurs when it is in contact with fire.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rdzas dag 'dres pa'i phyir rnam par ma phyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rdzas dag 'dres pa'i phyir rnam par ma phyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the two substances, which are different in nature, are mixed together and so cannot be distinguished.

original: yang rdzas de'i rgyun rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu rgyun chad pa'i phyir de ldog cing de'i nye bar len pa la ltos pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa rnams las kyang rdzas gzhan skye ba yin te /
analyzed: yang rdzas de'i rgyun rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu rgyun chad pa'i phyir de ldog cing de'i nye bar len pa la ltos pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa rnams las kyang rdzas gzhan skye ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the continuum of that substance is interrupted because the cause of the continuum is destroyed, and so it ceases. And from the contact of cold, etc., which depend on its appropriation, another substance is produced.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa nang yin zhing myong ba yang yin no //üîΩ'jigs sogs bzhin du bsgoms pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa nang yin zhing myong ba yang yin no // 'jigs sogs bzhin du bsgoms pa yi //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. are internal and are also experienced.üîΩThe cognition that is not deceptive,üîΩwhich appears clearly through the power of meditation

original: stobs kyis gsal bar snang gyur pa'i //üîΩshes gang slu ba can min pa //
analyzed: stobs kyis gsal bar snang gyur pa'i // shes gang slu ba can min pa //
translated: on fear, etc.,

original: rtog med de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rtog med de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: is nonconceptual perception.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas gzung ba nges pa'i don rigs pa sems las byung bas rnam par gzhag nas sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas gzung ba nges pa'i don rigs pa sems las byung bas rnam par gzhag nas sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de rdzogs pa na /
translated: When yogis who have established the meaning of the scriptures through the wisdom that arises from hearing, and who meditate on that meaning through the mental factor of right investigation, have completed that meditation,

original: 'jigs pa la sogs @161b pa bzhin du gsal bar snang zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can gang yin pa de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs @161b pa bzhin du gsal bar snang zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can gang yin pa de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: then whatever is a nonconceptual, nonerroneous subject that clearly appears like a fear, etc., is also a valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba bzhin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like the seeing of the noble truths.

original: ji ltar kho bos tshad ma rnam 'grel du gtan la phab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kho bos tshad ma rnam 'grel du gtan la phab pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as I have determined it in the Pramanavarttika.üîΩThose who are possessed by desire, fear, and sorrow,

original: 'dod 'jigs mya ngan gyis brlams dang // chom rkun rmi sogs kyis bslad pas //üîΩyang dag min pa'ang mdun na ni //
analyzed: 'dod 'jigs mya ngan gyis brlams dang // chom rkun rmi sogs kyis bslad pas // yang dag min pa'ang mdun na ni //
translated: and those who are affected by thieves, dreams, etc.,üîΩsee what is not real

original: gnas pa bzhin du mthong 'gyur te //üîΩbslad pa ji bzhin gus pa ni //
analyzed: gnas pa bzhin du mthong 'gyur te // bslad pa ji bzhin gus pa ni //
translated: as if it were right in front of them.üîΩJust as the affected see

original: sgrub pa rab tu mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa rab tu mthong phyir ro //
translated: the worship of the gods,

original: lkog gyur rtogs pa'i 'du shes la //
analyzed: lkog gyur rtogs pa'i 'du shes la //
translated: the perception that realizes the hiddenüîΩis seen by the one who practices well.

original: de lta'i 'jug pa ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: de lta'i 'jug pa ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because such an operation is not seen,

original: de phyir yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: de phyir yang dag yang dag min //
translated: therefore it is neither real nor unreal.

original: gang gang shin tu bsgoms gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gang shin tu bsgoms gyur pa //
translated: Whatever is well cultivated,

original: sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa na //
analyzed: sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa na //
translated: when the cultivation is complete,

original: de gsal mi rtogs blo 'bras bu //
analyzed: de gsal mi rtogs blo 'bras bu //
translated: the result is a clear, non-conceptual cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: 'di ltar mi sdug pa dang zad par sa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yul can la yang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba dang rnam par rtog pa med par grub par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi sdug pa dang zad par sa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yul can la yang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba dang rnam par rtog pa med par grub par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even with respect to an unreal object, such as the meditation on the impurities or the totality of earth, etc., it is accepted that there is a clear appearance and non-conceptualization by the power of cultivation.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba yin du zin kyang rtog pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba yin du zin kyang rtog pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if there is a clear appearance by the power of cultivation, how can there be non-conceptualization?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: rnam rtog rjes su 'brel ba la //
analyzed: rnam rtog rjes su 'brel ba la //
translated: When there is a connection with conceptualization,

original: don gsal snang ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: don gsal snang ba yod ma yin //
translated: there is no clear appearance of the object.

original: rnam par bslad pa'i blo yang rung ste brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i shes pa thams cad la ni don gsal ba nyid ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par bslad pa'i blo yang rung ste brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i shes pa thams cad la ni don gsal ba nyid ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all cognitions that are mixed with expressions, whether they are distorted or not, have the cessation of the clarity of the object.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa can 'di ni gsal bar snang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa can 'di ni gsal bar snang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this conceptual cognition is not fit to be a clear appearance.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rmi lam na yang dran pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rmi lam na yang dran pa ste //
translated: Even in dreams, there is memory.

original: de 'dra'i don ldan mi dran par //
analyzed: de 'dra'i don ldan mi dran par //
translated: There is no memory of an object that is like that.

original: gnyid kyis bslad pa rnams la yang nyams su myong ba dran pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni 'byung la /
analyzed: gnyid kyis bslad pa rnams la yang nyams su myong ba dran pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni 'byung la /
translated: Even for those who are affected by sleep, conceptual cognitions that have the aspect of remembering experiences occur.

original: de dag de ltar snang ba can du ni dran pa med do //
analyzed: de dag de ltar snang ba can du ni dran pa med do //
translated: But there is no memory of them as having such an appearance.

original: de'i phyir bslad pa'am gzhan gyis kyang rnam par rtog pa ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin gyi /üîΩgsal @162a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bslad pa'am gzhan gyis kyang rnam par rtog pa ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin gyi / gsal @162a * //
translated: Therefore, even if they are distorted or otherwise, conceptual cognitions do not make clear appearances.

original: bar snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bar snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Clear appearances are nonconceptual.

original: 'o na ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir gsal bar snang ba'i rmi lam gyi shes pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir gsal bar snang ba'i rmi lam gyi shes pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if that is so, then a dream consciousness to which objects appear clearly would be a direct perception, because it is non-conceptual.

original: ma 'khrul ba zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is taught that it is non-erroneous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,üîΩbecause conceptual consciousnesses do not perceive things

original: rnam rtog dngos mi snang phyir dang // nye bar bslad pa slu ba'i phyir /üîΩmngon sum ltar snang /
analyzed: rnam rtog dngos mi snang phyir dang // nye bar bslad pa slu ba'i phyir / mngon sum ltar snang /
translated: and because they are deceptive,

original: rnam par gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par gnyis su brjod do //
translated: they are said to be of two types:üîΩlike direct perception andüîΩlike inference.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba yin te /
translated: Because direct perception is the appearance of things,

original: de med na de'i snang ba nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na de'i snang ba nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: if it does not exist, the appearance of that is lost.

original: zhes kyang brjod zin to //
analyzed: zhes kyang brjod zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Conceptual consciousnesses are not like that.

original: de'i snang ba dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i snang ba dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their appearance is not in accord with things.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Therefore they are like direct perception.

original: nye bar bslad pa yang ste /
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa yang ste /
translated: They are also like inference.

original: dbang skyes kyang /
analyzed: dbang skyes kyang /
translated: Even though they are produced by the sense faculties,

original: gzhan las des khyad med phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las des khyad med phyir ro //
translated: they are not distinguished from the other two by that.

original: nye bar bslad pa gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ni dbang po las skyes pa yang yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ni dbang po las skyes pa yang yin te /
translated: Some of these are born from the sense faculties,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from those born from the sense faculties.

original: 'di yang slu ba'i phyir dngos po dang mthun par snang ba ma yin pas mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang slu ba'i phyir dngos po dang mthun par snang ba ma yin pas mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Since they are deceptive, they do not appear in accordance with their object, and therefore they are like direct perception but are not.

original: 'dis ni yid kyi rnam par bslad pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yid kyi rnam par bslad pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the error of the mental faculty.

original: kha cig zla ba gnyis la sogs par 'khrul ba ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig zla ba gnyis la sogs par 'khrul ba ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the error of two moons, etc., is not born from the sense faculties.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: dbang po las byung ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i phyir la /
translated: because that which arises from the sense faculties is characterized by the presence or absence of an object, and

original: de ni 'di la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / dbang po gyur na 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / dbang po gyur na 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: that is the same here, and because when the sense faculties change, it changes,

original: rten du 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten du 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is the only reason for positing a sense faculty.

original: yid las skyes pa'i 'khrul ba yin na sprul la sogs pa'i 'khrul ba ltar dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba yod kyang ldog par thal ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba yod kyang ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid las skyes pa'i 'khrul ba yin na sprul la sogs pa'i 'khrul ba ltar dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba yod kyang ldog par thal ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba yod kyang ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And likewise, even though there be a modification of the sense faculty, it would be reversible.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa 'di ni dbang po las skyes @162b kyang mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa 'di ni dbang po las skyes @162b kyang mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this error, even though born of the sense faculty, is not a perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas par bstan pa'i don du'o zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan las logs shig tu rnam par bcad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas par bstan pa'i don du'o zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan las logs shig tu rnam par bcad de /
translated: And for that very reason, it is stated separately in the section on conceptual differentiation, in order to show that it is an exception.

original: rab rib kyis mtshon pa'i bslad pa mngon sum ltar snang bar gsungs so //
analyzed: rab rib kyis mtshon pa'i bslad pa mngon sum ltar snang bar gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the error, as illustrated by cataracts, is a false perception.

original: gzhan du yang mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams zla ba gnyis dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams zla ba gnyis dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And elsewhere, the atoms of the eye, etc., are said to be the cause of the consciousness that appears as two moons, blue, etc.

original: yang tshad ma 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin /
analyzed: yang tshad ma 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin /
translated: What is the effect of this valid knowledge?

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa'o //
translated: The object of comprehension is realized.

original: de ni shes pa yin pa de yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni shes pa yin pa de yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That is consciousness, and that is also the effect.

original: da ni tshad ma gang zhig yin //
analyzed: da ni tshad ma gang zhig yin //
translated: Now, what is valid knowledge?

original: gang las bar chad med par gzhal bya rtogs pa 'di'i de nyid 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang las bar chad med par gzhal bya rtogs pa 'di'i de nyid 'grub pa'o //
translated: That from which the object of comprehension is realized without obstruction.

original: de la 'di'i don dang 'brel byed pa //
analyzed: de la 'di'i don dang 'brel byed pa //
translated: In that regard, the one that is related to the object

original: don gyi rang bzhin min pa med //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin min pa med //
translated: is not unrelated to the nature of the object.

original: de phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: de phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa yis //
translated: Therefore, by the realization of the object of comprehension,

original: tshad ma gzhal bya'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhal bya'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: valid knowledge is the nature of the object of comprehension.

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad bya ba thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad bya ba thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it is the proof of what is to be proven, not everything is the proof of everything.

original: 'on kyang gang las gang 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang las gang 'grub pa'o //
translated: However, it is that from which something is established.

original: de la nyams su myong ba tsam du las thams cad la 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni gang gis 'di ni 'di'o zhes las so so las rnam par 'byed pa'i de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de la nyams su myong ba tsam du las thams cad la 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni gang gis 'di ni 'di'o zhes las so so las rnam par 'byed pa'i de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
translated: In that case, the consciousness that is the same in all actions, merely as an experience, must be made to have that nature which distinguishes it from each action, ‚ÄúThis is this.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa yang dbang po dang don dang phrad pa la sogs pa rgyu rnams la bye brag yod du zin kyang las kyi bye brag la bdag nyid tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa bye brag tu nges par byed pa po ni ma yin
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa yang dbang po dang don dang phrad pa la sogs pa rgyu rnams la bye brag yod du zin kyang las kyi bye brag la bdag nyid tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa bye brag tu nges par byed pa po ni ma yin
translated: Even though there is a difference in the causes, such as the contact of the sense faculty and object, etc., the consciousness that is not different in nature from the difference in action is not the determiner of the difference.

original: te / byed pa'i de nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / byed pa'i de nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of the agent is the reason for the accomplishment of the object.

original: de khyad par med na yang de'i khyad par yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de khyad par med na yang de'i khyad par yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: If that is not different, its difference is not established.

original: yod kyang de'i yan lag ma yin pas de'i byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod kyang de'i yan lag ma yin pas de'i byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it exists, it is not a part of that, so it is not the agent of that.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i bdag nyid kyi bye brag gang las 'di'i rtogs pa ni 'di yin no zhes 'di'i las la nges pa 'dir 'gyur ba de ni sgrub par byed pa @163a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i bdag nyid kyi bye brag gang las 'di'i rtogs pa ni 'di yin no zhes 'di'i las la nges pa 'dir 'gyur ba de ni sgrub par byed pa @163a * //
translated: Therefore, the proof is that the cognition of this is from the particular of its own nature, and the ascertainment of its activity is in this.

original: yin no // shes pa'i don dang 'brel ba 'di don dang 'dra ba las gzhan la ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no // shes pa'i don dang 'brel ba 'di don dang 'dra ba las gzhan la ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: This connection with the object of cognition is not possible for anything other than that which is like the object.

original: dbang po la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i rang gi bye brag gis bye brag tu byed pa po yin yang de ltar don dang 'brel bar byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i rang gi bye brag gis bye brag tu byed pa po yin yang de ltar don dang 'brel bar byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though the sense faculty, etc. are the particularizers by means of their own particularities, such as clarity and unclarity, they do not act in that way to connect with the object.

original: de la nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no proximate cause for that.

original: don gyis byas pa'i nyams su myong ba'i bye brag gang las rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyis byas pa'i nyams su myong ba'i bye brag gang las rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The particular of the experience produced by the object is the cause of the cognition that occurs in this way,

original: don dang 'dra ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not from that which is like the object.

original: da ni yod pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar mi ston /
analyzed: da ni yod pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar mi ston /
translated: Now, how can the existent nature not be shown?

original: de ni 'di'o zhes bstan par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'di'o zhes bstan par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not possible to show that this is it.

original: 'di'i bdag nyid nges par rtogs pa med pas 'di ni 'di'i yin gyi 'di'i ma yin no zhes dngos po rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni legs par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid nges par rtogs pa med pas 'di ni 'di'i yin gyi 'di'i ma yin no zhes dngos po rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni legs par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no definite determination of its nature, it is not proper to posit things by saying, ‚ÄúThis is that,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThat is this.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa yi //
translated: Therefore, the means of valid cognition

original: sgrub byed gzhal bya'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: sgrub byed gzhal bya'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: is the very nature of the object of valid cognition.

original: sgrub par byed pa gzhan yin na //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gzhan yin na //
translated: If the means of valid cognition were different,

original: de yi las dang 'brel mi 'grub //
analyzed: de yi las dang 'brel mi 'grub //
translated: its relation to the object would not be established.

original: de yang de yi bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: de yang de yi bdag nyid yin //
translated: And that is the very nature of the object.

original: des na 'bras bu don gzhan min //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu don gzhan min //
translated: Therefore, the object is not a different entity from the result.

original: de yi bdag nyid 'dzin de ni //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid 'dzin de ni //
translated: The apprehension of that very nature

original: don rtogs pa yi bdag nyid kyi //üîΩbyed pas rang gi las la ni //
analyzed: don rtogs pa yi bdag nyid kyi // byed pas rang gi las la ni //
translated: is the very nature of the realization of the object.üîΩBecause of the activity,

original: byed dang bcas pa lta bur snang //
analyzed: byed dang bcas pa lta bur snang //
translated: it appears as if it had an agent for its own object.

original: rang nyid byed po min na yang //
analyzed: rang nyid byed po min na yang //
translated: Even though it is not itself an agent,

original: de yi dbang gis der gzhag phyir //
analyzed: de yi dbang gis der gzhag phyir //
translated: it is posited as such because of the activity.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: 'dis ni dbang po dang phrad pa dang / don la lta ba dang / khyad par gyi shes pa yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po dang phrad pa dang / don la lta ba dang / khyad par gyi shes pa yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: This also rejects the view that the object is seen by the sense faculty, or that the object is seen by a special consciousness.

original: de las las dang 'brel ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las las dang 'brel ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the connection with action is not established.

original: bar du ma chod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar du ma chod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no obstruction.

original: byed pa po khyad par can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po khyad par can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the special agent is not established.

original: byed pa po thams cad bsgrub par bya ba la nye bar sbyor yang tha ma'i bye brag tu byed pa po 'di nyid sgrub par byed pa dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po thams cad bsgrub par bya ba la nye bar sbyor yang tha ma'i bye brag tu byed pa po 'di nyid sgrub par byed pa dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though all agents are engaged in the accomplishment of the object, this very agent is the supreme accomplisher of the specific object.

original: dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang yul so so la bye brag med pa na @163b 'di'i bye brag tu byed pa po ni byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang yul so so la bye brag med pa na @163b 'di'i bye brag tu byed pa po ni byed pa po yin no //
translated: Even though the sense faculties and so on exist, when there is no distinction in the individual objects, this distinction is the agent.

original: dbang po ni bye brag tu byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni bye brag tu byed pa yin te /
translated: The sense faculty is the distinction.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of all consciousnesses.

original: don la lta ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don la lta ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the seeing of the object.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin te de'i don la lta de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin te de'i don la lta de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not of the nature of that, because the object of that is not established.

original: de bzhin du khyad par gyi shes pa yang yul gyi khyad par du ma byas na khyad par gyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag yul tha dad pa 'gal ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par gyi shes pa yang yul gyi khyad par du ma byas na khyad par gyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag yul tha dad pa 'gal ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the cognition of a distinction is not established as a distinction, because if it is not distinguished by the object, it is not distinguished from the cognition of a distinction, and because it is contradictory for the object of proof and the proof to be different.

original: yul tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni gnyis dag don med do //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni gnyis dag don med do //
translated: If they are not different, then the two are pointless.

original: rgyu tha dad pa med pa dag ni rim gyis 'byung ba bkag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa med pa dag ni rim gyis 'byung ba bkag pa yang yin no //
translated: And if they are not different causes, then the refutation of their sequential arising is also pointless.

original: cig car 'byung ba la ni /
analyzed: cig car 'byung ba la ni /
translated: In the case of their simultaneous arising,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the object of proof and the proof do not exist.

original: shes pa'i cha dag ni rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i cha dag ni rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: The parts of cognition are the object of proof and the proof in dependence on the establishment of the distinction.

original: dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gcig pas 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gcig pas 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a contradiction because the probandum and the proof are the same, since there is no difference in the thing,

original: ma yin te chos tha dad pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ma yin te chos tha dad pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: that is not so, because we accept a difference in the properties.

original: / tha snyad 'di dngos po la gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / tha snyad 'di dngos po la gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: This convention does not rest on a thing,

original: dngos po tha dad pa med kyang nus pa'i bye brag gis rnam par gzhag pa tha dad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa med kyang nus pa'i bye brag gis rnam par gzhag pa tha dad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though there is no difference in the thing, we see a difference in the presentation by way of a difference in capacity.

original: phrad pa yang tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa yang tshad ma yin te /
translated: Contact is also a valid cognition,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi phrad kyang chos 'ga' zhig kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi phrad kyang chos 'ga' zhig kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though there is contact by all of itself, there is the understanding of some property.

original: de khyad par med na yang khyad par 'di ni blo'i snang bas byas pa'i phyir de kho na tshad mar rigs so //
analyzed: de khyad par med na yang khyad par 'di ni blo'i snang bas byas pa'i phyir de kho na tshad mar rigs so //
translated: If there is no difference in that, then because this difference is made by the appearance of the mind, it is reasonable that it alone is a valid cognition.

original: de nas gang tshad ma'i 'bras bu don rig pa 'di gang zhig / mngon sum du gyur pa'i rig pa gang yin pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: de nas gang tshad ma'i 'bras bu don rig pa 'di gang zhig / mngon sum du gyur pa'i rig pa gang yin pa 'di nyid do //
translated: Then, what is the object of awareness, which is the result of a valid cognition? It is just this awareness that is manifest.

original: myong ba yod pa 'di'i don de rig pa yin par gang gis skyes pa dang 'dra ba dag gis so //
analyzed: myong ba yod pa 'di'i don de rig pa yin par gang gis skyes pa dang 'dra ba dag gis so //
translated: The meaning of this experience is cognition, because it is like what is produced.

original: 'o na ni yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa de ma thag yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa de ma thag yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the object is the immediately preceding condition of the cognition that has the same object.

original: 'o na da 'dis gang zhig nyams su myong /üîΩkho bo cag kyang tshul 'di nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod @164a * //
analyzed: 'o na da 'dis gang zhig nyams su myong / kho bo cag kyang tshul 'di nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod @164a * //
translated: If that is so, then what does this experience?

original: pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don‚Äôt we also accept this very method?

original: 'di bltas pa'am mnyan no zhes mthong ba'am thos pa dag las gang la nges pa'i shes par 'gyur ba de dag ni de'i nyams su myong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di bltas pa'am mnyan no zhes mthong ba'am thos pa dag las gang la nges pa'i shes par 'gyur ba de dag ni de'i nyams su myong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúI see or hear this,‚Äù then what is ascertained by seeing or hearing is experience.

original: ji ltar de de'i mthong ba yin zhes de dag gi nye ba de nyid dpyod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar de de'i mthong ba yin zhes de dag gi nye ba de nyid dpyod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt you analyze the nature of that experience, asking, ‚ÄúHow is it seen?‚Äù

original: lta ba po'i nges pa 'di ni de dag gi 'brel ba la brten nas 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: lta ba po'i nges pa 'di ni de dag gi 'brel ba la brten nas 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of the seer is based on the relation between them.

original: de med na ni der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na ni der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that does not exist, it would not be that.

original: rnam par shes pa yul dang 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yul dang 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is consciousness like the object.

original: de la snang ba rags pa'i rnam par ni rdul phra rab so so ba rnams la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la snang ba rags pa'i rnam par ni rdul phra rab so so ba rnams la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of the appearance of gross objects, it is not the case that the individual subtle particles have that appearance.

original: shes pa la gnas pa 'di yang gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa la gnas pa 'di yang gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is not reasonable to say that this appearance is based on consciousness, because it is one.

original: rang bzhin mang po'i tshogs pa rnams la yang de ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mang po'i tshogs pa rnams la yang de ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it appears that way to the collection of many natures.

original: rang bzhin gcig ni du ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig ni du ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one nature is incompatible with many.

original: mang po rnams la yang rnam pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mang po rnams la yang rnam pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that many have that appearance, so they are not similar.

original: yul rags pa gcig de ltar snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul rags pa gcig de ltar snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that a single gross object appears that way,

original: lag pa la sogs pa gcig g-yo na thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa gcig g-yo na thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because if one part, such as the hand, moves, all would move.

original: mi g-yo na yang g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag so sor grub par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi g-yo na yang g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag so sor grub par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not move, then it follows that the moving and the unmoving would be established separately,

original: ras dang chu bzhin no //
analyzed: ras dang chu bzhin no //
translated: like cloth and water.

original: gcig bsgribs na yang thams cad bsgribs par thal te /
analyzed: gcig bsgribs na yang thams cad bsgribs par thal te /
translated: And if one part is obscured, it follows that all would be obscured,

original: tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, since it would not be obscured in any way, it would be seen completely.

original: yan lag bsgribs kyi yan lag can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bsgribs kyi yan lag can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is obscured in part, not in its entirety.

original: phyed bsgribs kyang ma bsgribs pa'i phyir 'di snga ma kho na bzhin du mthong bar thal lo //
analyzed: phyed bsgribs kyang ma bsgribs pa'i phyir 'di snga ma kho na bzhin du mthong bar thal lo //
translated: Even if it were obscured in part, it would still be seen, just as it was before.

original: yan lag gi sgo nas de mthong ba'i phyir yan lag ma mthong ba la de rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gi sgo nas de mthong ba'i phyir yan lag ma mthong ba la de rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not seen, because it is seen by means of its parts.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: tha dad pa med pas rnam pa thams cad du mi rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas rnam pa thams cad du mi rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be cognized in any way, since it is not different from its parts.

original: yan lag thams cad kyang cig car mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'di mi mthong bar thal lo //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad kyang cig car mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'di mi mthong bar thal lo //
translated: And since it is not possible to see all of its parts simultaneously, it would follow, absurdly, that it is never seen.

original: yan lag cung zad gcig mthong ba yin na ni yan lag cung zad gcig mthong @164b ba yang de bzhin du rangs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag cung zad gcig mthong ba yin na ni yan lag cung zad gcig mthong @164b ba yang de bzhin du rangs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is seen by means of a part of it, then even when a part of it is seen, it would be seen completely.

original: gcig kha bsgyur na yang thams cad kha bsgyur ba'am ma bsgyur bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩyan lag kha bsgyur na yang yan lag can kha ma bsgyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig kha bsgyur na yang thams cad kha bsgyur ba'am ma bsgyur bar rtogs par 'gyur ro // yan lag kha bsgyur na yang yan lag can kha ma bsgyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If one part is changed, then all would be changed or not changed.

original: bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a part is changed, then the whole would be changed and not changed.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig shes pa la 'dra bar byed pa'i don gcig pu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig shes pa la 'dra bar byed pa'i don gcig pu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no single object that causes a cognition to be similar.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: blo yis nyams myong bya gzhan med //
analyzed: blo yis nyams myong bya gzhan med //
translated: There is no other experience than cognition.

original: de yi myong ba gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de yi myong ba gzhan yod min //
translated: There is no experience of that other than itself.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no object and subject,

original: de ni de ltar rang nyid bsal //
analyzed: de ni de ltar rang nyid bsal //
translated: It is self-eliminated in that way.

original: yul gyi mtshan nyid bkag pa'i phyir //üîΩ'ga' zhig kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan nyid bkag pa'i phyir // 'ga' zhig kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin la /
translated: Because the characteristics of objects are refuted,üîΩNothing is experienced.

original: 'di'i yang 'ga' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i yang 'ga' zhig ma yin te /
translated: And in this case, nothing is experienced.

original: de la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no characteristic of object and subject in that.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba ni blo'i bdag nyid kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba ni blo'i bdag nyid kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, experience is only of the nature of cognition.

original: de yang gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not some other.

original: 'di'i mngon sum du so sor rig par bya ba nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mngon sum du so sor rig par bya ba nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: And the fact that it is to be known by itself is also of the same nature.

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is of the same nature,

original: rang nyid rab tu gsal ba yin pa des na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes kyang brjod de /
