analyzed: rang nyid rab tu gsal ba yin pa des na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes kyang brjod de /
translated: it is said to be self-illuminating,

original: gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: like illumination.

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid nyams su myong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid nyams su myong ba nyid yin no //
translated: And the so-called experience of blue and so on is the experience of its own nature.

original: rig bya rig byed rnam pa med //
analyzed: rig bya rig byed rnam pa med //
translated: There is no object of awareness and awareness.

original: skra sogs shes pa'i tha dang bzhin //üîΩgang tshe gzung 'dzin rnam phye ba'i //
analyzed: skra sogs shes pa'i tha dang bzhin // gang tshe gzung 'dzin rnam phye ba'i //
translated: Like the cognition of hair and so on.üîΩWhen the characteristics of the distinction between object and subject

original: mtshan nyid rnam par bslad pa can //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par bslad pa can //
translated: are distorted,

original: ji ltar 'khrul pas mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pas mthong gyur pa //
translated: it is like seeing a mirage.

original: de ltar 'di ni gzhag byas pa //üîΩde tshe gzung dang 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni gzhag byas pa // de tshe gzung dang 'dzin pa yi //
translated: It is posited in that way.üîΩAt that time, it is not to be disputed

original: mtshan nyid can la brtsad bya min //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can la brtsad bya min //
translated: that it has the characteristics of object and subject.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a verse of intermission.

original: de tshe gzhan rig med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de tshe gzhan rig med pa'i phyir //
translated: At that time, because there is no awareness of another,

original: rang nyid rig pa 'bras bur 'dod //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa 'bras bur 'dod //
translated: self-awareness is accepted as the result.

original: gang dag gi blo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nye bar ston par skye ba de dag la ni rig par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir /üîΩrang @165a * //
analyzed: gang dag gi blo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nye bar ston par skye ba de dag la ni rig par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir / rang @165a * //
translated: For those whose mind arises to manifest the aspects of object and subject, because there is no other object of awareness,

original: rig pa 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: rig pa 'bras bu yin te /
translated: self-awareness is the result.

original: de'i rtogs pa ni de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtogs pa ni de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its realization is its essence.

original: gang gi phyir gal te nyams su myong ba de 'dod pa'i rnam pa'am mi 'dod pa'i rnam par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te nyams su myong ba de 'dod pa'i rnam pa'am mi 'dod pa'i rnam par gyur na /
translated: If that experience becomes the aspect of desire or the aspect of non-desire,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul so sor rig par 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul so sor rig par 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: then the object of desire and the object of non-desire are individually cognized.

original: / phyi rol gyi don yod kyang rang rig pa ji lta ba bzhin don 'grub pa'i phyir de nyid 'bras bur rigs so //
analyzed: / phyi rol gyi don yod kyang rang rig pa ji lta ba bzhin don 'grub pa'i phyir de nyid 'bras bur rigs so //
translated: Even if external objects exist, because self-awareness establishes the object as it is, it is reasonable that it is the result.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the essence of the object is established as it is.

original: shes pa thams cad rnam pa gcig tu thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad rnam pa gcig tu thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that all cognitions would have the same aspect.

original: rnam pa ni du mar rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni du mar rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The aspect is manifold, because it is the representation of many.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gcig nyid gcig gi yid du 'ong la gzhan gyi ni yid du mi 'ong bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gcig nyid gcig gi yid du 'ong la gzhan gyi ni yid du mi 'ong bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the same nature is seen as pleasant by one and unpleasant by another.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par snang ba ni rtog pa yin gyi dbang po'i blo ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par snang ba ni rtog pa yin gyi dbang po'i blo ni ma yin no zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: The appearance as desirable or undesirable is conceptualization, not the sense cognition.

original: de la yang 'chi ltas la sogs tshe mtshams sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i phyir dang / gzhan la yang tha dad pa med pa'i sgra dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis srog chags kyi bye brag rnams kyis dbang po nyid kyi bde ba dang mi bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir don rtogs pa ni rang rig pa kho na'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yang 'chi ltas la sogs tshe mtshams sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i phyir dang / gzhan la yang tha dad pa med pa'i sgra dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis srog chags kyi bye brag rnams kyis dbang po nyid kyi bde ba dang mi bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir don rtogs pa ni rang rig pa kho na'i rang bzhin no //
translated: No, because even in that case, the appearance of the signs of death, etc., is seen without the connection of life. And because, in the case of others, the different species of living beings generate pleasure and pain by means of the differences of sound, smell, taste, etc., which are not different.üîΩTherefore, the understanding of the object is of the nature of reflexive awareness alone.

original: 'di'i sgrub par byed pa ni yul gyi rnam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i sgrub par byed pa ni yul gyi rnam pa nyid yin te /
translated: The proof of this is the aspect of the object.

original: rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears in the aspect of the object.

original: don gnas pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang rig pa yin yang 'bras bu las 'di ni don rig pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: don gnas pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang rig pa yin yang 'bras bu las 'di ni don rig pa yin par blta'o //
translated: Although the result of self-cognition is the self-cognition of the nature of the object, it is seen as the cognition of the object from the point of view of the result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dang 'bras bu dang / yul tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dang 'bras bu dang / yul tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the valid cognition, the result, and the object are not different.

original: rang bzhin sems pa yin na ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin sems pa yin na ni //
translated: If it is the nature of cognition,

original: don rig de yi bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: don rig de yi bdag nyid phyir //
translated: the cognition of the object is its nature.

original: rang nyid rig pa 'bras bur bshad //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa 'bras bur bshad //
translated: Self-cognition is explained as the result.

original: de dang 'dra pa'am gzhan 'dra'ang rung //
analyzed: de dang 'dra pa'am gzhan 'dra'ang rung //
translated: Whether it is similar to that or similar to something else,

original: shes pa de ltar snang ba yi //
analyzed: shes pa de ltar snang ba yi //
translated: that cognition appears in that way.

original: rgyu ni don yang yin pas na //
analyzed: rgyu ni don yang yin pas na //
translated: The cause is also the object.

original: don ni gzhal bya nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: don ni gzhal bya nyid du 'dod //
translated: Therefore, the object is asserted to be the object of comprehension.

original: ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar //
translated: Just as in some cases,

original: don dngos med par snang can de //
analyzed: don dngos med par snang can de //
translated: the object appears without an object.

original: ji ltar don 'dzin zhe na bden //
analyzed: ji ltar don 'dzin zhe na bden //
translated: How is it that it apprehends the object? That is true.

original: ngas kyang de 'dra @165b mi shes so //
analyzed: ngas kyang de 'dra @165b mi shes so //
translated: I also do not know such a thing.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: phyi rol gyi don med na 'o na ji ltar tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang 'bras bu rnam par gnas she na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med na 'o na ji ltar tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang 'bras bu rnam par gnas she na /
translated: If external objects do not exist, how can valid cognitions, objects of valid cognitions, and results be established?

original: 'di la rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin yin gyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin yin gyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: This is a presentation that accords with appearances, not with the way things really are.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: yul gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig dang nang du yongs su gcod pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba na mtshon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig dang nang du yongs su gcod pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba na mtshon par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the aspect of an object and the internal determination arise with the nature of reflexive awareness, they are perceived.

original: de la tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni ji ltar mtshon pa kho na ltar yin no ;
analyzed: de la tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni ji ltar mtshon pa kho na ltar yin no ;
translated: The presentation of valid cognitions, objects of valid cognitions, and results is just as they are perceived.

original: / blo bdag rnam par dbyer med kyang //üîΩmthong ba phyin ci log rnams kyis //
analyzed: / blo bdag rnam par dbyer med kyang // mthong ba phyin ci log rnams kyis //
translated: Although the mind and self are inseparable,üîΩthose who see falsely

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa rnams //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa rnams //
translated: perceive the awareness that apprehends the object

original: tha dad bcas bzhin rtogs 'gyur te //üîΩdper na dbang po sngags sogs kyis //
analyzed: tha dad bcas bzhin rtogs 'gyur te // dper na dbang po sngags sogs kyis //
translated: as if it were different.üîΩFor example, to those whose sense faculties are impaired by spells and so on,

original: bslad pa rnams la 'jim dum sogs //
analyzed: bslad pa rnams la 'jim dum sogs //
translated: a lump of clay and so onüîΩappears as a horse or an elephant.

original: de yi gzugs dang bral na yang //
analyzed: de yi gzugs dang bral na yang //
translated: But when they are separated from their form,

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba bzhin //
translated: They appear in a different way.

original: mig ma bslad pa rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: mig ma bslad pa rnams kyis ni //
translated: Those whose eyes are not impaired

original: de dag de ltar ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: de dag de ltar ma mthong phyir //
translated: Do not see them in that way.

original: ji ltar thag ring mya ngam na //
analyzed: ji ltar thag ring mya ngam na //
translated: Just as in a desert, far away,

original: chung ngu chen por snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: chung ngu chen por snang ba bzhin //
translated: A small fire appears to be large.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa rnams //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa rnams //
translated: Although the object of apprehension and the apprehenderüîΩDo not exist, they are posited as the object of evaluation,

original: yod pa min yang gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed 'bras bur gnas pa 'di //
analyzed: yod pa min yang gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed 'bras bur gnas pa 'di //
translated: The means of evaluation, and the result of evaluation,

original: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du byas //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du byas //
translated: Just as they appear.

original: gzhan du gcig gi ngo bo la //
analyzed: gzhan du gcig gi ngo bo la //
translated: Otherwise, how could a single entity

original: rang bzhin du mar snang ba yi //
analyzed: rang bzhin du mar snang ba yi //
translated: Have multiple natures?

original: rnam pa ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
translated: How could it be true in any way?üîΩBecause singularity would be undermined,

original: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir dang // gzhan gyis gzhan nyid nyams phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir dang // gzhan gyis gzhan nyid nyams phyir ro //
translated: And because difference would be undermined by difference.

original: dngos mthong med phyir gcig ma yin //
analyzed: dngos mthong med phyir gcig ma yin //
translated: Because the entity is not seen, it is not singular.

original: blo dngos tha dad mi mthong bas //
analyzed: blo dngos tha dad mi mthong bas //
translated: Because the mind and the entity are not seen to be different,

original: tha dad med par nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad med par nges par 'gyur //
translated: They are ascertained to be not different.

original: gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na //
translated: When an entity is analyzed,

original: de nyid du ni de dngos med //
analyzed: de nyid du ni de dngos med //
translated: It does not exist as an entity.

original: gang gi phyir na de dag la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na de dag la //
translated: Because of that,

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
translated: It has no intrinsic nature as one or many.

original: chos mthun pa ni mthong ba las //
analyzed: chos mthun pa ni mthong ba las //
translated: The world is confused by seeing

original: de bdag min la de bdag tu //üîΩzhen pa yis ni 'jig rten na //
analyzed: de bdag min la de bdag tu // zhen pa yis ni 'jig rten na //
translated: what is not a self as a self.

original: 'khrul skye 'dir ni de med de //üîΩ'gro ba 'di la de'i bdag nyid //
analyzed: 'khrul skye 'dir ni de med de // 'gro ba 'di la de'i bdag nyid //
translated: Here, that does not exist,üîΩand a self of that is not seen in this world.

original: gcig kyang mthong ba med phyir ro //üîΩde yang yod na nang gi ni //
analyzed: gcig kyang mthong ba med phyir ro // de yang yod na nang gi ni //
translated: Nor is a self of that seen in any way in this world.üîΩIf it did exist, it would be like

original: bslad pa @166a * //üîΩlas byung gang yin de //
analyzed: bslad pa @166a * // las byung gang yin de //
translated: the internal sense bases,üîΩwhich arise from error.

original: nyes pas bskyed phyir rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: nyes pas bskyed phyir rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Because they are produced by faults,

original: phyin ci log tu snang 'gyur te //üîΩchos mthun mthong sogs can nyid la //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu snang 'gyur te // chos mthun mthong sogs can nyid la //
translated: they appear as inverted.üîΩThe existence of similarity of attributes, etc.,

original: ltos med rab rib la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: ltos med rab rib la sogs bzhin //
translated: is not established, like visual distortion, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: 'di rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin na ni tshad ma la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ci ltar snang ba bzhin du 'gyur na de nyid ci ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin na ni tshad ma la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ci ltar snang ba bzhin du 'gyur na de nyid ci ltar grub ce na /
translated: If this is mere representation, how can the appearance of the establishment of valid knowledge, etc., exist?

original: 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because it is devoid of the characteristics of object and subject.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the certainty of simultaneous observation,

original: sngo dang de blo gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: sngo dang de blo gzhan ma yin //
translated: The cognition of blue and so on is not different.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad par snang ba nyid yin yang sngon po ni nyams su myong ba las don gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad par snang ba nyid yin yang sngon po ni nyams su myong ba las don gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because, although they appear as different, blue and the experience of blue are not different in nature.

original: de dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the certainty of simultaneous observation.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like two moons.

original: 'di dag las rnam pa gcig ma dmigs na gzhan dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: 'di dag las rnam pa gcig ma dmigs na gzhan dmigs pa med do //
translated: If one of these two is not observed, the other is not observed.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa la ni 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa la ni 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not tenable for different natures.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reason for a connection.

original: gzugs dang snang ba dag la ni de'i shes pa bskyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: gzugs dang snang ba dag la ni de'i shes pa bskyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: In the case of form and light, the cognition of that is either characterized by suitability for production or by the nature of being a cause.

original: dbang po rung bar bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir snang ba med par gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rung bar bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir snang ba med par gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is a relationship that is characterized by the production of a suitable sense faculty, form is not perceived in the absence of light,

original: 'bras bu rgyu las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect does not deviate from its cause.

original: snang ba bar chad med pa'i gzugs dang lhan cig gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba bar chad med pa'i gzugs dang lhan cig gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Light is perceived because it is characterized by being apprehended together with form that is not obstructed.

original: yang na snang ba 'ga' zhig kyang mthong ba'i phyir dang / snang ba med pa'i gzugs kyang srog chags kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin gyi sngon po'i rnam pa dang rig pa dag nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na snang ba 'ga' zhig kyang mthong ba'i phyir dang / snang ba med pa'i gzugs kyang srog chags kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin gyi sngon po'i rnam pa dang rig pa dag nges pa nyid do //
translated: Or, because some light is seen and because some species of living beings see form in the absence of light, the ascertainment of simultaneous apprehension does not exist for them. But the ascertainment of the aspect of blue and awareness does exist.

original: tha dad pa la ni de rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni de rig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained that that is awareness, because it is different.

original: sngon po dang ser po bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po bzhin no //
translated: Like blue and yellow.

original: yul ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyur nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyur nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The object is the cause of consciousness because it exists as the cause of consciousness.

original: sngar dmigs la rigs pa ni phyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngar dmigs la rigs pa ni phyis yin no zhe na /
translated: But the object is prior to the cognition, and the reasoning is subsequent.

original: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
translated: If the object is not directly perceived,

original: de mthong rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de mthong rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: then the seeing is not established.

original: yul yod pas ni yul dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yul yod pas ni yul dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The object is not perceived because of the existence of the object,

original: 'on kyang de'i dmigs pa yod pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i dmigs pa yod pas so //
translated: but rather because of the existence of its perception.

original: de yang tshad ma dang mi ldan pas yod pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad 'jug par @166b mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma dang mi ldan pas yod pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad 'jug par @166b mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is not established by a valid cognition, so the conventional usage ‚Äúexists‚Äù does not apply.

original: de rab tu ma grub na don rab tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rab tu ma grub na don rab tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is not established, then the object is not established, and so

original: thams cad nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: everything would be lost.

original: yod kyang ma grub pa la yod pa'i tha snyad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod kyang ma grub pa la yod pa'i tha snyad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it exists, if it is not established, the conventional usage ‚Äúexists‚Äù does not apply.

original: de'i phyir rig pa 'ga' yang mi dmigs na rig par byad pa zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig pa 'ga' yang mi dmigs na rig par byad pa zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if no cognition is perceived, then there is not the slightest thing that is called ‚Äúcognized.‚Äù

original: rig pa gzhan gyi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa gzhan gyi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that another cognition perceives it,

original: re zhig yul de rang dmigs pa'i tshe na ni sgrub par ma grub pas ma grub la /
analyzed: re zhig yul de rang dmigs pa'i tshe na ni sgrub par ma grub pas ma grub la /
translated: then when the object is perceived by itself, it is not established because the proof is not established.

original: gzhan dmigs pa'i dus su ni grub pa'i phyir dmigs kyang de'i tshe ni ma grub la /
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa'i dus su ni grub pa'i phyir dmigs kyang de'i tshe ni ma grub la /
translated: But when it is the object of another cognition, it is established.

original: phyin ci log tu gzhan gyi tshe na ni grub po zhes legs par tha snyad du byas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gzhan gyi tshe na ni grub po zhes legs par tha snyad du byas so //
translated: Thus, it is well said that it is not established when it is the object of itself, but it is established when it is the object of another.

original: rig pa yang gzhan gyis dmigs la de yang ma grub na ni rig pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ngo //üîΩde'i phyir re zhig dmigs pa mthar thug pa la sdod pa ni skyes bu 'dis don 'ga' yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa yang gzhan gyis dmigs la de yang ma grub na ni rig pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ngo // de'i phyir re zhig dmigs pa mthar thug pa la sdod pa ni skyes bu 'dis don 'ga' yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And if the cognition is the object of another cognition, and that is not established, then the cognition is not established, and so the object of that cognition is not established.

original: gcig ma grub na thams cad mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ma grub na thams cad mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the person would never understand any object, because if one is not established, all are not established.

original: dmigs pa thams cad kyi skye ba la yang mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad kyi skye ba la yang mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the arising of all objects is endless, the world would be blind and mute.

original: 'ga' zhig tu mthar thug pa yin na ni de rang gi bdag nyid dang yul gyi rnam pa cig car dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu mthar thug pa yin na ni de rang gi bdag nyid dang yul gyi rnam pa cig car dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were the ultimate, then it would simultaneously perceive itself and the form of the object, and other consciousnesses would be the same.

original: bye brag gi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag gi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no cause for distinction.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the certainty of simultaneous perception is established,

original: gcig gi bya ba la rig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig gi bya ba la rig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not reasonable that one thing has two actions,

original: de ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be without distinction.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar gsal ba'o //
translated: And it is clear that way because it is the nature of that.

original: de gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not something else,

original: bdag nyid rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa bzhin no //
translated: like self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir yang de ni don gzhan du rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de ni don gzhan du rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not known as a different object,

original: sngon po la sogs pa myong ba las don gzhan ma yin na ni de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de ltar gsal ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa myong ba las don gzhan ma yin na ni de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de ltar gsal ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it is not different from the experience of blue, etc., it is clear in that way as its nature, and thus it is the experience of blue, etc.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar snang ba na yang rang dang gzhan gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar snang ba na yang rang dang gzhan gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is of the nature of that, when it appears in that way, it is the illuminator of itself and others,

original: gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: like a lamp.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rang rig pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rang rig pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of the apprehender is asserted to be the proof of reflexive awareness,

original: de las de'i dngos po rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de'i dngos po rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of that is posited from that.

original: dper na 'dod chags sogs tshor bzhin //üîΩder bdag yul du @167a * //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags sogs tshor bzhin // der bdag yul du @167a * //
translated: For example, it is like the feeling of attachment and so on.

original: bzhag pa na //
analyzed: bzhag pa na //
translated: When the self is posited as the object,

original: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
translated: the object of comprehension, the means of comprehension, and the result are present.

original: 'di ni kun la sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: 'di ni kun la sbyar bar bya //
translated: This should be applied to all.

original: de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //
translated: Also, because of the experience of that,

original: de dag rang bdag myong bar rung //
analyzed: de dag rang bdag myong bar rung //
translated: those are suitable to be experienced by the self.üîΩTherefore, that suitability is the measure of the self.

original: de phyir rung nyid de tshad bdag / gzhal bya rang rig 'bras bu yin //üîΩ'dzin pa yi ni rnam pa dang // bdag la rung bar brjod pa yis //
analyzed: de phyir rung nyid de tshad bdag / gzhal bya rang rig 'bras bu yin // 'dzin pa yi ni rnam pa dang // bdag la rung bar brjod pa yis //
translated: The result of the object of comprehension is reflexive awareness.üîΩThe aspect of the apprehenderüîΩand the expression of suitability to the self

original: yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid de //
translated: are the nature of ascertainment.

original: tshang ma rang bdag rig par brjod //
analyzed: tshang ma rang bdag rig par brjod //
translated: The self-experience of the complete is expressed as reflexive awareness.

original: ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a verse of intermission.üîΩTherefore, although external objects exist,

original: de phyir snang don blo de dag / phyi don yod kyang tha dad min //
analyzed: de phyir snang don blo de dag / phyi don yod kyang tha dad min //
translated: the cognition of the object of appearance is not different from it.

original: lhan cig dmigs pa dang rig pa dag gis phyi rol gyi don yod kyang sngon po la sogs pa snang ba dang de rig pa dag tha dad med par grub po //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa dang rig pa dag gis phyi rol gyi don yod kyang sngon po la sogs pa snang ba dang de rig pa dag tha dad med par grub po //
translated: By the reason of simultaneous observation and the reason of awareness, although external objects exist, it is established that the appearance of blue, etc. and the awareness of it are not different.

original: des na blo ni tshul gnyis pa /
analyzed: des na blo ni tshul gnyis pa /
translated: Therefore, cognition is twofold.

original: de'i phyir yul dang shes pa'i rang bzhin dag gis blo tshul gnyis su grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dang shes pa'i rang bzhin dag gis blo tshul gnyis su grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the nature of the object and the cognition, cognition is established as twofold.

original: gal te snang ba'i yul gyis rnam pa blo la tha mi dad na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i yul gyis rnam pa blo la tha mi dad na /
translated: If the aspect of the appearing object is not different from the cognition,

original: de las tha dad pa yod do zhes bya ba gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa yod do zhes bya ba gang las shes she na /
translated: from what is it known that it exists as different from that?

original: phyi rol ldog pa las grub 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi rol ldog pa las grub 'gyur //
translated: It is established from the exclusion of external objects.

original: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu shes pa mi skye na rgyu gzhan ma tshang bar ston pa yin la de yang phyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu shes pa mi skye na rgyu gzhan ma tshang bar ston pa yin la de yang phyi'i don yin no //
translated: Even if there is another potential cause, if the effect, the cognition, does not arise, it shows that another cause is incomplete, and that is an external object.

original: gal te 'dir 'ga' zhig nye bar len pa'i khyad par med pas 'bras bu ldog par mi smra na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dir 'ga' zhig nye bar len pa'i khyad par med pas 'bras bu ldog par mi smra na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the result is not stopped because there is no difference in the appropriation, then that is so.

original: de yang shes pa thams cad kyi yul bzlog pa na bslad pa dang cig shos su ji ltar smra ste /
analyzed: de yang shes pa thams cad kyi yul bzlog pa na bslad pa dang cig shos su ji ltar smra ste /
translated: And when the object of all consciousness is stopped, how can you say that it is either adulterated or not?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: nye bar bslad pa'i bag chags mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i skyon gyis mi mkhas pas kyang tha snyad la yid brtan du med par mthong bas gcig ni tshad ma ma yin par brjod la /
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa'i bag chags mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i skyon gyis mi mkhas pas kyang tha snyad la yid brtan du med par mthong bas gcig ni tshad ma ma yin par brjod la /
translated: The fault of the non-connection of the latent potentialities of adulteration is such that even the unwise see that conventional reality is undependable. Therefore, one is said to be non-validating cognition.

original: gzhan ni bag chags brtan pa'i phyir 'khor ba ji srid par mi 'bral bar rjes su 'brel pa ni tha snyad la mi slu ba la ltos nas 'dir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bag chags brtan pa'i phyir 'khor ba ji srid par mi 'bral bar rjes su 'brel pa ni tha snyad la mi slu ba la ltos nas 'dir tshad ma yin no //
translated: The other, because of the stability of the latent potentialities, is connected with them as long as cyclic existence lasts. It is a validating cognition in regard to the non-deceptiveness of conventional reality.

original: 'di ni kun tu tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i rang bzhin brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kun tu tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i rang bzhin brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the nature of validating cognition in regard to the conventional.

original: 'di la yang pha rol rmongs pas 'jig rten slu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang pha rol rmongs pas 'jig rten slu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, too, the confused opponent deceives the world.

original: bsams pa las byung ba nyid kyi shes rab goms par byas pas rnam par 'khrul pas dben zhing dri ma med la ldog pa med pa'i don dam pa'i tshad ma mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba nyid kyi shes rab goms par byas pas rnam par 'khrul pas dben zhing dri ma med la ldog pa med pa'i don dam pa'i tshad ma mngon sum du byed do //
translated: By cultivating the wisdom that arises from reflection, one realizes the ultimate valid cognition, which is free from error, stainless, and irreversible.

original: @167b de yang cha tsam bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: @167b de yang cha tsam bstan pa yin no //
translated: This has been explained only in part.

original: mngon sum gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pa ste le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: mngon sum gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pa ste le'u dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter on the ascertainment of perception.

original: // / rjes dpag rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: // / rjes dpag rnam gnyis te /
translated: Inference is of two kinds:

original: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don no //
analyzed: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don no //
translated: for one's own sake and for the sake of others.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Because it is of the nature of cognition and expression, it is not the cause of non-erroneous understanding.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir sgra logs shig tu mi brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir sgra logs shig tu mi brjod do zhe na /
translated: It is not stated separately because it is not distinct.

original: ma yin te 'jug pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'jug pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the engagement is different.

original: don ni rtags can go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: don ni rtags can go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is understood through the sign,

original: de'i rtags 'di sgras yin no //
analyzed: de'i rtags 'di sgras yin no //
translated: and that sign is expressed by the word.

original: ma yin te mtshan nyid gzhan brjod par byar med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te mtshan nyid gzhan brjod par byar med pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, because another characteristic cannot be expressed.

original: gang 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba de gang dang 'brel ba de shes pa la de des de nyid du go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba de gang dang 'brel ba de shes pa la de des de nyid du go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: That which is seen in some place is understood by that which is related to it.

original: zhes dngos po rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes dngos po rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the thing is understood.

original: de ltar go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pas rtogs par 'dod pa'i ngag gi tshul bstan par byas pa nyid de ;
analyzed: de ltar go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pas rtogs par 'dod pa'i ngag gi tshul bstan par byas pa nyid de ;
translated: By stating the definition of the means of understanding, the method of speech which is desired to be understood is demonstrated,

original: gzhan du brjod na go bar byed pa'i chos ma bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du brjod na go bar byed pa'i chos ma bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were stated otherwise, the means of understanding would not be taught.

original: don gang ji ltar shes pa'i tshig shes pa de dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang nye bar bstan pa gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gang ji ltar shes pa'i tshig shes pa de dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang nye bar bstan pa gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the words which are known as they are known to convey a meaning do not depend on another demonstration in order to be understood,

original: de ltar bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni byis pas rtogs pa'i rgyur brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni byis pas rtogs pa'i rgyur brtsams pa yin no //
translated: it is true, but this is undertaken as the cause of understanding for the childish.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin rtogs kyang chos ma khyab pa dang ldog pa dag gis smra ba mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin rtogs kyang chos ma khyab pa dang ldog pa dag gis smra ba mthong ste /
translated: Even though things are understood as they are, one sees speech which is not pervaded by the teaching and which is reversed.

original: med na mi 'byung ba mi brjod pa'i phyir dang / nye bar rtogs pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / de zlos pa'i tshig dag sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba mi brjod pa'i phyir dang / nye bar rtogs pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / de zlos pa'i tshig dag sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not state that the reason is the invariable concomitant of the probandum, and because it employs the words ‚Äúrealization,‚Äù ‚Äúprobandum,‚Äù and ‚Äúrepetition.‚Äù

original: de la / rang don ni /
analyzed: de la / rang don ni /
translated: The purpose of the syllogism is

original: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong yin /
analyzed: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong yin /
translated: to show the probandum through a reason having the three modes.

original: mtshan nyid gsum pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: That which is the realization of the probandum through a reason having the three modes is an inference for oneself.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The result of this should be understood to be like perception.

original: de ni de ma yin la der 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: de ni de ma yin la der 'dzin phyir //
translated: It is mistaken because it apprehends what is not that to be that.

original: 'khrul kyang 'brel phyir tshad ma nyid //üîΩrang gi snang ba don med pa la don du mngon par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin yang don dang 'brel pa de la @168a * //
analyzed: 'khrul kyang 'brel phyir tshad ma nyid // rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du mngon par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin yang don dang 'brel pa de la @168a * //
translated: But it is valid knowledge because it is related to the object.

original: mi 'khrul ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: Although it is mistaken because it engages by way of the manifest adherence to what is meaningless as meaningful, it is valid knowledge because it is unmistaken with regard to the object with which it is related.

original: 'dir ltar rang bzhin nam 'bras bu ni ngo bo rgyu med na med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ltar rang bzhin nam 'bras bu ni ngo bo rgyu med na med pa yin te /
translated: In this way, the nature or effect does not exist if the cause does not exist.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du de dag med na de las skyes pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du de dag med na de las skyes pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: Because they are not different and because it is established by itself.

original: de las byung ba'i ngo bo dang rgyu rtogs pa med do //üîΩde bzhin du snang ba'i dngos po yod na /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ngo bo dang rgyu rtogs pa med do // de bzhin du snang ba'i dngos po yod na /
translated: In the same way, if they do not exist, the cognition that arises from them or the nature that arises from them is not cognized.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi mthong ba ldog pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi mthong ba ldog pa mi srid do //
translated: In the same way, if the thing that appears exists, it is impossible to stop seeing it, even if the other causes are incomplete.

original: snang ba de nyid ni don dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba de nyid ni don dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: That appearance itself is not meaningful,

original: de ni mngon sum gyis gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/'di ltar dngos gang ji lta ba //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro ; /'di ltar dngos gang ji lta ba //
translated: because it is seen otherwise by direct perception.üîΩIn this way, the mind that is the sign of that thing,

original: de ni de 'dra'i rtags sems kyis //
analyzed: de ni de 'dra'i rtags sems kyis //
translated: just as it is,

original: rgyu yin de las de lta yi //
analyzed: rgyu yin de las de lta yi //
translated: is the cause. From that, it is like that.

original: dngos las nges bskyed rtags can blo //
analyzed: dngos las nges bskyed rtags can blo //
translated: The mind that has the sign is definitely produced from the thing.

original: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //
analyzed: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //
translated: In this way, the mind that has the sign and the sign

original: brgyud pa yis ni dngos po dang // 'brel phyir der snang ba yis ni //
analyzed: brgyud pa yis ni dngos po dang // 'brel phyir der snang ba yis ni //
translated: Because of the lineage, there is the connection with the thing; because of the appearance, there is the deception.

original: stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
analyzed: stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
translated: Even though empty, it is not a deceiver.

original: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
analyzed: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
translated: Even though it is not a deceiver,

original: de yi ngo bos stong de la //
analyzed: de yi ngo bos stong de la //
translated: it is empty of that nature.

original: de yi ngo bo zhen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo zhen pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the adherence to that nature,

original: 'khrul par rnam gzhag byas pa yin //
analyzed: 'khrul par rnam gzhag byas pa yin //
translated: it is established as a delusion.

original: nor bu sgron me'i 'od dag la //
analyzed: nor bu sgron me'i 'od dag la //
translated: In the light of a jewel and a lamp,

original: nor bu blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
analyzed: nor bu blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
translated: the mind runs to the jewel.

original: log pa'i shes par khyad med kyang //
analyzed: log pa'i shes par khyad med kyang //
translated: There is no difference in the false cognition,

original: ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
analyzed: ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
translated: but there is a difference in the performance of a function.

original: de bzhin rjes dpag der snang dag / ji bzhin don can ma yin yang //
analyzed: de bzhin rjes dpag der snang dag / ji bzhin don can ma yin yang //
translated: In the same way, even though inference and the appearance are not just as the object,

original: don byed pa dang rjes 'brel pas //
analyzed: don byed pa dang rjes 'brel pas //
translated: because of the connection with the performance of a function,üîΩthey are established as valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag / ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag / ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i //üîΩtshad ma gnyi ga dngos po yi //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i // tshad ma gnyi ga dngos po yi //
translated: both direct perception and inferenceüîΩare valid cognitions that have as their object

original: yul can yin te /
analyzed: yul can yin te /
translated: a thing.

original: dpyod pa ni don byed par rung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni don byed par rung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because investigation has as its object a thing that is capable of effective action.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba cung zad yongs su rtog pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa shes nas ji ltar 'os pa sgrub par 'dod pas yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba cung zad yongs su rtog pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa shes nas ji ltar 'os pa sgrub par 'dod pas yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: One who is slightly curious about the truth, who is desirous of accomplishing happiness and suffering, having understood the means of accomplishing them, does not cling to them.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i snang ba de nyid ni don sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i snang ba de nyid ni don sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That appearance of inference does not accomplish the object.

original: don sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po 'gags kyang de ma 'gags pa'i phyir dang / de las kyang don cung zad 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po 'gags kyang de ma 'gags pa'i phyir dang / de las kyang don cung zad 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the thing that accomplishes the object has ceased, it has not ceased for that person, and also because nothing is accomplished from it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yod kyang spyi ni don ma yin @168b no ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yod kyang spyi ni don ma yin @168b no ;
translated: Therefore, even though it exists, the universal is not the object.

original: / de las dngos po'i rang bzhin la mi slu ba nyid ni 'di'i yang tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: / de las dngos po'i rang bzhin la mi slu ba nyid ni 'di'i yang tshad ma yin no //
translated: The non-deceptiveness of that with regard to the nature of things is its validity.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po'i rtags la ltos pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po'i rtags la ltos pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it depends on the reason of a thing that is related to it.

original: slob dpon gyi ni snang ba tha dad pas //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi ni snang ba tha dad pas //
translated: The master's is different.

original: gcig la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gcig la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is not tenable that they are one.

original: don gyi dbye ba bshad pa yin //
analyzed: don gyi dbye ba bshad pa yin //
translated: The division of objects has been explained.

original: phan tshun rnam pa mi mthun pa de dag ni gcig par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam pa mi mthun pa de dag ni gcig par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Those that are mutually different aspects are not tenable as one.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i yul tha dad par tshad ma'i yul tha dad du bshad kyi tshad ma'i bya ba'i yul tha dad pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i yul tha dad par tshad ma'i yul tha dad du bshad kyi tshad ma'i bya ba'i yul tha dad pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the objects of the valid cognitions are explained to be different in terms of their observed objects, but not in terms of their objects of activity of the valid cognitions.

original: tha dad ces bya ba yang 'dir tha mi dad pa yin pa bkag pa nyid du blta'i /
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba yang 'dir tha mi dad pa yin pa bkag pa nyid du blta'i /
translated: Also, the term ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù here should be seen as negating nondifference.

original: yul du ma nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul du ma nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they are many objects.

original: mngon sum bzhin du de'i snang ba rang gi yul du 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir dang / spyi yang dangs po las gzhan du brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du de'i snang ba rang gi yul du 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir dang / spyi yang dangs po las gzhan du brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like direct perception, the appearance of that does not follow the concomitance and reversal of the object that is asserted, and because the conception of inference is objectless, since the universal is inexpressible as different from the individual.

original: gal te gnyis ka'i tshad ma'i yul dngos po yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka'i tshad ma'i yul dngos po yin na /
translated: If the object of both valid cognitions is a thing,üîΩthen how could the object of inference be a thing?

original: da ni ji ltar rtags las spyi rtogs la //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar rtags las spyi rtogs la //
translated: Now, how is a universal understood from a reason?

original: gzhan las ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: And how is an individual characteristic understood from another?

original: bshad pa / de bzhin rang bzhin la ldog pa'i //
analyzed: bshad pa / de bzhin rang bzhin la ldog pa'i //
translated: In response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: dngos po tsam zhig rab sgrub phyir //
analyzed: dngos po tsam zhig rab sgrub phyir //
translated: In order to establish just the mere thingüîΩthat is the opposite of that nature,

original: rtags spyi'i yul can du bshad de //
analyzed: rtags spyi'i yul can du bshad de //
translated: a reason is explained as having a universal as its object,

original: khyad par gnas pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gnas pa med phyir ro //
translated: because a particular does not exist.

original: dgos pa gang dang ldan pa'i don shes par 'dod pas de las ldog pa las tha dad pa'i don tsam rtags kyis nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can du bshad de /
analyzed: dgos pa gang dang ldan pa'i don shes par 'dod pas de las ldog pa las tha dad pa'i don tsam rtags kyis nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can du bshad de /
translated: Because one who wishes to understand an object that has a purpose establishes just the mere object that is the opposite of that by means of a reason, it is explained as having a universal as its object,

original: de las tha dad pa gnas pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa gnas pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: because a particular that is different from that does not exist.

original: dngos po yod pa bskal pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa bskal pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because an existent thing is excluded.

original: rtags rtogs pa yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags rtogs pa yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the understanding of a reason is also like that, and because it depends on a universal.

original: cig shos ni khyad par gzhan 'dzin pas dben pas na so sor gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni khyad par gzhan 'dzin pas dben pas na so sor gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin te /
translated: The other is the nature of a particular, because it is endowed with the aspect of a nature that is isolated from the apprehension of other distinctions.

original: rang las don rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang las don rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the subject of an intrinsic identity, because it is the realization of an object from itself.

original: yang lag gzhan la rtogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: yang lag gzhan la rtogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the realization of another object is not like that,

original: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the capacity for that.

original: don la mi slu bar ni gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa'i phyir tshad ma ni dngos po'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: don la mi slu bar ni gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa'i phyir tshad ma ni dngos po'i yul can nyid do //
translated: But both are the same in not deceiving with regard to the object, so valid knowledge is the subject of an existent object.

original: tshul gsum pa ni /üîΩrjes dpag bya dang de mtshungs pa //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa ni / rjes dpag bya dang de mtshungs pa //
translated: The trimodal condition isüîΩthe existence of the sign in the similar instance

original: yod dang med la med par ni //
analyzed: yod dang med la med par ni //
translated: and the nonexistence of the sign in the dissimilar instance.

original: nges pa / rjes su dpag par bya ba ni 'dir shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: nges pa / rjes su dpag par bya ba ni 'dir shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i chos can te /
translated: The object of inference is the subject endowed with the particular that is desired to be known here.

original: @169a * // de la mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: @169a * // de la mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seen by direct perception or inference.

original: de bzhin du de dang mthun pa nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang mthun pa nyid la yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, it is the same with the similar instance.

original: chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa gzhan na yod par 'gal la /
analyzed: chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa gzhan na yod par 'gal la /
translated: It is contradictory for something to be present in another thing that is qualified by the property.

original: khyad par du mi byed na yang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: khyad par du mi byed na yang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i chos ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: But if it does not qualify, then it is not the property of the inferential subject.

original: ma yin te mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is qualified by the exclusion of non-possession.

original: chos kyi tshig phrad tha dad par //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig phrad tha dad par //
translated: The word property is used

original: byed pas mi ldan pa dang ni //
analyzed: byed pas mi ldan pa dang ni //
translated: because it is not possessed by

original: gzhan pa dag dang ldan pa dang // gtam mi ldan nyid rnam gcod byed //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag dang ldan pa dang // gtam mi ldan nyid rnam gcod byed //
translated: others and because it excludes non-possession.üîΩThe qualifier and the qualified

original: khyad par khyad par can dag dang // bya ba dang ni lhan cig brjod //
analyzed: khyad par khyad par can dag dang // bya ba dang ni lhan cig brjod //
translated: are expressed together with the action.

original: de sbyar med kyang brjod 'dod las //
analyzed: de sbyar med kyang brjod 'dod las //
translated: Even when it is not connected,

original: de yi don ni rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi don ni rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: the meaning is understood from the desire to express it.

original: gang phyir ngag 'bras rnam gcod phyir //üîΩdper na nag pa 'phong skyen pa'am //üîΩsrid sgrub 'phong skyen zhes bya'am //
analyzed: gang phyir ngag 'bras rnam gcod phyir // dper na nag pa 'phong skyen pa'am // srid sgrub 'phong skyen zhes bya'am //
translated: Because speech is for the purpose of exclusion,üîΩlike saying NƒÅgƒÅrjuna is skilled in archeryüîΩor Siddhasena is skilled in archery,

original: sngon po mtsho skyes 'gyur nyid bzhin //
analyzed: sngon po mtsho skyes 'gyur nyid bzhin //
translated: or the blue lotus.

original: der yang zla po rnam gcod pa'i //
analyzed: der yang zla po rnam gcod pa'i //
translated: There too, the exclusion of non-moonüîΩis the meaning of the word moon.

original: don rnams la ni rtogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: don rnams la ni rtogs 'gyur te //
translated: But the meaning is understood.üîΩThus, the word is not a mere expression of desire,

original: de ltar grags dang nus pa dang // sgra ni brjod 'dod rjes 'brang phyir //
analyzed: de ltar grags dang nus pa dang // sgra ni brjod 'dod rjes 'brang phyir //
translated: because of the fame, the ability, and the desire to speak.

original: des na mi ldan rnam gcod pa //üîΩchos can chos kyi khyad par yin //
analyzed: des na mi ldan rnam gcod pa // chos can chos kyi khyad par yin //
translated: Therefore, the word is a differentiator of the non-possessor.üîΩThe property of the subject is the differentia.

original: de yi khyad par can gyi chos //
analyzed: de yi khyad par can gyi chos //
translated: The property of the differentia

original: rjes 'gro med pa'i skyon rten min ;
analyzed: rjes 'gro med pa'i skyon rten min ;
translated: is not the basis of the fault of non-pervasion.

original: / zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: gzhan yang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par yin na gcig der 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par yin na gcig der 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the differentia were a differentiator by the exclusion of possession, then one would be that,

original: gzhan de nyid ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan de nyid ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: and the other would not be that.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can dang 'brel pa'i tshig phrad dang yang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can dang 'brel pa'i tshig phrad dang yang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And there would be no difference in the compound words that express the relation of the differentia and the differentia-possessor.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po nges par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po nges par bya'o //
translated: By this, the relation of the differentia and the differentia-possessor should be ascertained even in the case of the property to be established.

original: des na khyad par yod kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par yod kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even when there is a differentia, there is not non-pervasion.

original: de bzhin du spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin yang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin yang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, even though the general is to be established, it is not the establishment of the established itself.

original: de dang mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the exclusion of that which does not possess it is established.

original: de dang mtshungs pa nyid la zhes nges gzung ba'i phyir chos can la med par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa nyid la zhes nges gzung ba'i phyir chos can la med par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that because of the specification ‚Äúin that which is similar to it,‚Äù it would not exist in the subject, that is not so.

original: gzhan dgag pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dgag pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the exclusion of another is the meaning of the specification.

original: de la yod par grub pa sdud pa'i nges par gzung bas ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yod par grub pa sdud pa'i nges par gzung bas ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa yin te /
translated: The specification that includes the establishment of existence in that is the exclusion of another.

original: @169b dper na /
analyzed: @169b dper na /
translated: For example,

original: dang po rang la bu gnyis skyes 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang po rang la bu gnyis skyes 'gyur te /
translated: First two sons were born to me,

original: na ra dang ni sred med bu nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa la yod pa'i gtan tshigs de'i med pa la med pa la med pa nyid ni tshul gzung pa ste /
analyzed: na ra dang ni sred med bu nyid do // zhes bya ba lta bu'o // bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa la yod pa'i gtan tshigs de'i med pa la med pa la med pa nyid ni tshul gzung pa ste /
translated: Nara and Narayana.üîΩThe nonexistence of the reason in the nonexistence of the probandum is the third rule, which is also ascertained.

original: de yang nges pa yin no / tha mar smos pa'i nges pa nyid ni tshul gsum ga la blta'o //
analyzed: de yang nges pa yin no / tha mar smos pa'i nges pa nyid ni tshul gsum ga la blta'o //
translated: The specification at the end is seen in all three rules.

original: don gzhan dang rang bzhin dag rab tu skye ba dang de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba grub na bltar rung ba'i yul can rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs pas 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don gzhan dang rang bzhin dag rab tu skye ba dang de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba grub na bltar rung ba'i yul can rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs pas 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the non-perception of a cause or a pervader establishes the non-existence of a perceptible object, then it is established by the non-perception of something else or of its nature, or of something arisen from it, or of something merely concomitant with it.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don no ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don no ;
translated: But not by any other means.

original: / mi dmigs pa yang bzlog pa la mngon sum 'jug pa ldog pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: / mi dmigs pa yang bzlog pa la mngon sum 'jug pa ldog pa nges pa yin no //
translated: And the non-perception of the opposite is ascertained by the perception of the reverse of that.

original: de dang mthun pa nyid la yod pa zhes bya bas ldog pa 'grub mod kyi /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa nyid la yod pa zhes bya bas ldog pa 'grub mod kyi /
translated: It is true that the existence of something is established by the mere existence of something compatible with it.

original: med pa la med pa nyid brjod pa ni med pa kho na la med pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa la med pa nyid brjod pa ni med pa kho na la med pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: But the expression ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is used only when there is non-existence,

original: gzhan pa la yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan pa la yang ma yin la /
translated: not when there is something else,

original: 'gal ba la yang ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba la yang ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: nor when there is incompatibility.

original: de la mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir chos gzhan la yod pa 'gog par dogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir chos gzhan la yod pa 'gog par dogs pa ni med do //
translated: There is no fear of the negation of something else because it is impossible.

original: 'gal ba la 'gog pa yang de kho na la 'gog na ni skyon du 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'gal ba la 'gog pa yang de kho na la 'gog na ni skyon du 'gyur na /
translated: If the negation of incompatibility is only the negation of that, then there is a fault.

original: gang gis de kho na las ldog pa'i phyir mes dro ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de dang mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes bya bas 'gal ba kho na de dang mthun pa ma yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis de kho na las ldog pa'i phyir mes dro ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de dang mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes bya bas 'gal ba kho na de dang mthun pa ma yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, it is not contradictory to say that heat is only in what is similar to fire, and that it is not in what is not similar to fire.

original: 'on kyang de dang mthun pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang mthun pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: But it is not in what is dissimilar to that.

original: des na 'di la skyon med pa'i phyir tshul gsum pa 'di mi brjod pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: des na 'di la skyon med pa'i phyir tshul gsum pa 'di mi brjod pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, since there is no fault in this, the three modes are not stated.

original: / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las khyab pa nges pa dang ldan pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bas kyang don gyis go ba gnyis pa rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes sbyor ba bstan pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir na skyon med do //
analyzed: / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las khyab pa nges pa dang ldan pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bas kyang don gyis go ba gnyis pa rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes sbyor ba bstan pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir na skyon med do //
translated: Even when the pervasion is ascertained from the forward and reverse formulations, the second meaning is understood implicitly, because the purpose of the statement is to teach the application. Therefore there is no fault.

original: de'i phyir gcig kyang sbyor bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig kyang sbyor bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even a single application is possible.

original: gal te mnyan par byed pa nyid ldog pa yin yang go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mnyan par byed pa nyid ldog pa yin yang go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that although the hearer has ceased, he is not the understander,

original: ma yin te ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because there is no cessation.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni 'ga' las kyang ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni 'ga' las kyang ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the property to be proven is excluded from anything at all,

original: the tshom sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩldog pa dang ldan pa la ni the tshom med pa'i @170a * //
analyzed: the tshom sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro // ldog pa dang ldan pa la ni the tshom med pa'i @170a * //
translated: because it establishes doubt.üîΩBecause there is no doubt

original: phyir te / byas pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir te / byas pa nyid las mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: about that which possesses the property to be negated, just as impermanence does in relation to that which is produced.

original: dngos po'i chos dang dngos po thams cad las ldog pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos dang dngos po thams cad las ldog pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the property to be negated and all things are mutually exclusive.

original: des na yod par dogs pa nyid kyis the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yod par dogs pa nyid kyis the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is doubt about existence, there is doubt.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa dang ldan par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa dang ldan par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that the property to be negated is not seen to be concomitant with the reason.

original: ldog pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: This kind of negation is not an inferential mark because

original: go bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: go bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brjod zin to //
translated: the inferential mark has already been stated.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, it cannot be taught that the property to be negated is not seen to be concomitant with the reason,

original: de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the inferential mark is established by seeing the nature and cause of the reason.

original: 'o na rtags tshul gnyis par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rtags tshul gnyis par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Well, then, it becomes the second mode of the reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tshul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tshul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the positive and negative concomitances are different modes.

original: de dag ni ngag gcig gis kyang bstan par nus pa'i phyir sbyor ba bsdus te brjod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni ngag gcig gis kyang bstan par nus pa'i phyir sbyor ba bsdus te brjod kyi /
translated: Because those can be indicated by a single statement, the syllogism is abbreviated and stated.

original: tshul bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the mode is not abbreviated.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: yang na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas gnyis ka rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas gnyis ka rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Or, because the meaning is understood, either one can indicate both.

original: gzhan dag med pa la med pa nyid ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag med pa la med pa nyid ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: Others say: Nonexistence is not established in nonexistence,

original: med pa ni gzhi la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni gzhi la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonexistence is not tenable as a basis, etc.

original: zhe'o // re zhig phyugs dag kyang gang mi rig pa mthong ba de'i tshe de la mi spyod na 'di ni phyugs pas kyang phyugs yin no //
analyzed: zhe'o // re zhig phyugs dag kyang gang mi rig pa mthong ba de'i tshe de la mi spyod na 'di ni phyugs pas kyang phyugs yin no //
translated: If even cattle do not use what is seen to be unknown, then this is cattle even more than cattle.

original: chen po'i chen po la smod pa'i phyir na bdag nyid mi shes pa gzhan ci yod /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po la smod pa'i phyir na bdag nyid mi shes pa gzhan ci yod /
translated: What other ignorant person is there who would disparage the great of the great?

original: 'di ldog pa'i don ston par byed pa'i tshig 'di nyid kyis med pa la tha snyad mi 'thad par ston cing gzhan dag 'gog par byed pa'i phyir 'di ni gsal bar rgyal po'i chos lugs yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ldog pa'i don ston par byed pa'i tshig 'di nyid kyis med pa la tha snyad mi 'thad par ston cing gzhan dag 'gog par byed pa'i phyir 'di ni gsal bar rgyal po'i chos lugs yin no ;
translated: The very words that show the meaning of the negation of this also show that a convention is not tenable in the case of nonexistence, and they refute others. This is clearly the king‚Äôs law.

original: / bdag nyid mi smra na ni gzhan rtogs par mi nus la /
analyzed: / bdag nyid mi smra na ni gzhan rtogs par mi nus la /
translated: If you do not speak, you cannot be understood.

original: smra na yang skyon 'di spang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: smra na yang skyon 'di spang bar mi nus so //
translated: And if you do speak, you cannot escape this fault.

original: med pa la gtan tshigs mi 'gog na sgrub pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa la gtan tshigs mi 'gog na sgrub pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If you do not refute the reason in the case of nonexistence, you will have established it,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa las ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa las ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its definition is the negation of nonexistence.

original: med pa las ldog pa med do zhes ldog pa de nyid re zhig ji ltar 'dod /
analyzed: med pa las ldog pa med do zhes ldog pa de nyid re zhig ji ltar 'dod /
translated: How can you assert that negation, saying ‚ÄúThere is no negation of nonexistence‚Äù?

original: dngos yod med la'ang yod yin la //üîΩdngos po med pa yod min zhes //
analyzed: dngos yod med la'ang yod yin la // dngos po med pa yod min zhes //
translated: Even in the case of nonexistence, existence is.

original: blun po yi ni spyod la ltos //
analyzed: blun po yi ni spyod la ltos //
translated: Look at the behavior of the fool who says, ‚ÄúNonexistence is not.‚Äù

original: gal te de las ldog med na //
analyzed: gal te de las ldog med na //
translated: If there is no negation of that,

original: gtan tshigs 'jug par 'dod dam ci //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'jug par 'dod dam ci //
translated: do you want to say that the reason is applicable?

original: de yang min na 'di nyid ni //
analyzed: de yang min na 'di nyid ni //
translated: If that is not so, then this is.

original: dgag yin ldog pa ci ste 'gog / sgrub @170b dang dgag pa ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: dgag yin ldog pa ci ste 'gog / sgrub @170b dang dgag pa ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from affirmation and negation,

original: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan //
translated: There is no other verbal convention.

original: yod min de yang med pa la //
analyzed: yod min de yang med pa la //
translated: And that also does not exist in the nonexistent,

original: med phyir 'di la mi smra 'thob //
analyzed: med phyir 'di la mi smra 'thob //
translated: Because it does not exist. Therefore, one should be silent about this.

original: yod pa rnams la dgag pa med //
analyzed: yod pa rnams la dgag pa med //
translated: There is no negation of existents,

original: de ni med pa la'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: de ni med pa la'ang yod pa min //
translated: And that also does not exist in the nonexistent.

original: rigs pa 'di yis 'gro ba la //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di yis 'gro ba la //
translated: By this reasoning,

original: dgag pa'i don ni med par 'gyur ;
analyzed: dgag pa'i don ni med par 'gyur ;
translated: The object of negation does not exist in the world.

original: / gal te yul dus 'gog ce na //üîΩji ltar de yod de ltar ni //
analyzed: / gal te yul dus 'gog ce na // ji ltar de yod de ltar ni //
translated: If you say that it is negated in terms of time and place,üîΩThen just as it exists, it is not negated.

original: mi 'gog ji ltar de med pa //
analyzed: mi 'gog ji ltar de med pa //
translated: Just as it does not exist,

original: de ltar yang ni 'gog mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar yang ni 'gog mi 'gyur //
translated: It is not negated in that way either.

original: de phyir dngos dngos med brten pa //
analyzed: de phyir dngos dngos med brten pa //
translated: Therefore, existence and nonexistence are based on

original: phyi rol rten min sgra son la //
analyzed: phyi rol rten min sgra son la //
translated: The external world, which is not a basis for sound.üîΩHere, all affirmations and negations

original: brten nas 'dir ni sgrub pa dang // dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: brten nas 'dir ni sgrub pa dang // dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin //
translated: Are accepted as based on that.

original: de 'dra med kyang chos can de //
analyzed: de 'dra med kyang chos can de //
translated: Even though such a thing does not exist,

original: de dag dang ni 'brel bar snang //
analyzed: de dag dang ni 'brel bar snang //
translated: The subject appears to be related to them.

original: de yang sgra 'jug pa nyid phyir //
analyzed: de yang sgra 'jug pa nyid phyir //
translated: And because that also is the basis for the use of words,

original: yod ces tha snyad brten par 'dod //
analyzed: yod ces tha snyad brten par 'dod //
translated: It is accepted that the convention of existence is based on that.

original: de lta min na don rnams kyis //
analyzed: de lta min na don rnams kyis //
translated: If it were not so, then the objectsüîΩWould not be established or refuted.

original: chos gcig sgrub dang 'gog pa na //
analyzed: chos gcig sgrub dang 'gog pa na //
translated: When one phenomenon is established or refuted,

original: bdag nyid thams cad bsgrubs pa dang // bkag 'gyur bdag tha dad med phyir //
