analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad bsgrubs pa dang // bkag 'gyur bdag tha dad med phyir //
translated: The whole of it is established or refuted, because there is no difference between the parts.

original: tha dad min na gzhan dang gzhan //üîΩbkag pa dang ni bsgrubs pa bzhin //
analyzed: tha dad min na gzhan dang gzhan // bkag pa dang ni bsgrubs pa bzhin //
translated: If there were no difference, then the otherüîΩWould not be refuted or established.üîΩThe established and the refuted

original: bsgrubs pa dang ni bkag pa dag / chos can gcig la 'du mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa dang ni bkag pa dag / chos can gcig la 'du mi 'gyur //
translated: Would not be combined in a single basis.

original: sna tshogs chos kyi gzhir gyur pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs chos kyi gzhir gyur pa //
translated: The basis of various phenomena

original: chos can gcig gis dbang byas te //
analyzed: chos can gcig gis dbang byas te //
translated: Is controlled by a single phenomenon.üîΩWhen one is established, the other is supported,üîΩAnd the rest are indifferent, as it were.üîΩWhen one is refuted, the other is isolated,

original: gcig bsgrub pa na de rten dang // gzhan rnams btang snyoms lta bu dang // 'gog na de yid dben pa dang // de las gzhan la ltos lta bur //
analyzed: gcig bsgrub pa na de rten dang // gzhan rnams btang snyoms lta bu dang // 'gog na de yid dben pa dang // de las gzhan la ltos lta bur //
translated: And the rest are dependent on it, as it were.üîΩHow can a conventional

original: med pa yi ni don can gyi //
analyzed: med pa yi ni don can gyi //
translated: Objectless

original: tha snyad ji ltar blos bstan pa //
analyzed: tha snyad ji ltar blos bstan pa //
translated: Be indicated by the mind?

original: de bzhin nyid de ma brtags par //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ma brtags par //
translated: In the same way, without analysis,

original: tha dad don brten khas len pas //
analyzed: tha dad don brten khas len pas //
translated: The basis of the various objects is accepted.

original: thog med bag chags las byung ba //
analyzed: thog med bag chags las byung ba //
translated: Arising from beginningless latent propensities,

original: 'jig rten don la gnod pa med //
analyzed: 'jig rten don la gnod pa med //
translated: The worldly meaning is not undermined.

original: de 'bras can dang de 'bras med //
analyzed: de 'bras can dang de 'bras med //
translated: It has a result and it does not have a result.üîΩIt is different from that, and it is the same object.

original: de de las tha dad don gcig / tha dad rten can 'phel ba dang // 'grib pa lta bur byed pa yi //üîΩbslad pa de dang de dag gi //
analyzed: de de las tha dad don gcig / tha dad rten can 'phel ba dang // 'grib pa lta bur byed pa yi // bslad pa de dang de dag gi //
translated: It is the cause of increase and decrease,üîΩas if it were the basis of that difference.üîΩThat which is related to those

original: 'brel pa 'ga' las de ldan nyid //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' las de ldan nyid //
translated: corruptions is not the possessor of them.

original: min yang mthong bar sbyor des na //
analyzed: min yang mthong bar sbyor des na //
translated: Even though it is not, it is seen.

original: de dag bslad pa'ang shes ma yin //
analyzed: de dag bslad pa'ang shes ma yin //
translated: Therefore, those corruptions are not known.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa pa'i //
translated: The reason which possesses that characteristic

original: gtan tshigs de ni mi dmigs dang // bdag dang 'bras bu zhes bya gsum //üîΩkho na'o // rtags ni gsum @171a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni mi dmigs dang // bdag dang 'bras bu zhes bya gsum // kho na'o // rtags ni gsum @171a * //
translated: is said to be threefold: non-apprehension, nature, and effect.

original: ste ; / mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: ste ; / mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: The evidence is threefold: non-apprehension, nature, and effect.

original: dper na / phyogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de /
analyzed: dper na / phyogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúA pot does not exist in some particular place,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-apprehension of it is not the apprehension of it.‚Äù

original: gal te yod na dmigs pa'i yod pa can nyid du 'gyur gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yod na dmigs pa'i yod pa can nyid du 'gyur gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it exists, it would be the existence of the apprehension, but not otherwise.

original: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni shing ngo //
analyzed: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni shing ngo //
translated: This is a tree because it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: du ba las ni 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba las ni 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Here there is fire because there is smoke.

original: de la gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa yin la gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de la gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa yin la gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: Of these, the first two are affirmative reasons, and the third is a negative reason.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na ni don gyi 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na ni don gyi 'khrul pa med de /
translated: When there is a relation of essential identity, there is no error in the meaning,

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is of the nature of that.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is of the nature of that, there is no difference between the probandum and the probans.

original: chos kyi bye brag kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi bye brag kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because the distinction of properties is imagined.üîΩThus it is said,

original: de skad du yang rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi bye brag kho nas yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi bye brag kho nas yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: All this usage of inference and that which is to be inferred is only on the basis of the distinction of properties and subjects that exist in the mind.

original: chos dang chos can nyid du tha dad pa blos kun brtags pa yin gyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos can nyid du tha dad pa blos kun brtags pa yin gyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
translated: The distinction of property and subject is imagined by the mind, but not the object.

original: blo'i bye brag rang dga' ba rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i bye brag rang dga' ba rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the various individual cognitions are not the basis of the object.

original: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gyi don go na ni mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gyi don go na ni mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands the object that is imagined by them, one will not attain it.

original: gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Because all things by nature

original: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //üîΩmthun phyogs gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir // mthun phyogs gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
translated: abide in their own natures,üîΩthe exclusion from other things that are not in accord with them

original: ldog pa la ni brten pa can //üîΩde phyir gang dang gang las don //üîΩldog pa de yi rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni brten pa can // de phyir gang dang gang las don // ldog pa de yi rgyu can gyi //
translated: is the basis.üîΩTherefore, the exclusion of the objectüîΩfrom whatever it is is the cause of the differentiation of its type.

original: rigs dbye de yi khyad par ni //
analyzed: rigs dbye de yi khyad par ni //
translated: The difference of that is

original: rtogs gyur ba dag rab tu dbye //
analyzed: rtogs gyur ba dag rab tu dbye //
translated: distinguished by the understanding of it.

original: des na khyad par gang zhig chos //
analyzed: des na khyad par gang zhig chos //
translated: Therefore, the difference of whatever property

original: gang gis go bar gyur pa de //
analyzed: gang gis go bar gyur pa de //
translated: by which there is understanding

original: de las gzhan gyis nus ma yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis nus ma yin //
translated: cannot be done by anything else.

original: des na tha dad rnam par gnas //
analyzed: des na tha dad rnam par gnas //
translated: Therefore, the difference is established.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: 'bras bu yang rang bzhin 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rang bzhin 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The effect is also related by nature,

original: de'i rang bzhin de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature arises from that.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir der snang ba nyid ma yin yang de las skyes pa'i phyir der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir der snang ba nyid ma yin yang de las skyes pa'i phyir der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin te /
translated: Because these two‚Äîthe object of inference and the knowledge of that‚Äîare not produced from the thing, they are not appearances of that. But because they are produced from that, they are not mistaken with respect to that.

original: des na tshad ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no //üîΩmed par nges @171b pa'i 'bras bu can ma dmigs med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i 'bras bu can gyi mi dmigs pa ni de la mi 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: des na tshad ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no // med par nges @171b pa'i 'bras bu can ma dmigs med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i 'bras bu can gyi mi dmigs pa ni de la mi 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Therefore they are valid cognitions, like direct perception.

original: tha snyad grub pa la yul yod pa 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad grub pa la yul yod pa 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-observation that has the effect of ascertaining nonexistence is non-mistaken with respect to that, because the effect of the non-observation that is the engagement of the term ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù is the non-mistaken existence of the object.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If non-observation is the evidence for proving nonexistence,

original: dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then non-observation would have to be proven by another non-observation, and so there would be an infinite regress.

original: mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would not be proven.üîΩIf nonexistence were to become the non-observation of observation,

original: ci ste dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa med par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa med par 'gyur na ni /
translated: then

original: de bzhin du yod pa med par yang 'gyur bas mi dmigs pa don med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa med par yang 'gyur bas mi dmigs pa don med do //
translated: Likewise, non-apprehension is meaningless, since what exists would become nonexistent.

original: ci ste gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that non-apprehension is established by the apprehension of something else,

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa yin gyis mi dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa yin gyis mi dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and is not non-apprehension because it is established by direct perception,

original: de bzhin du gzhan yod pas med pa ci ste mi 'grub /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yod pas med pa ci ste mi 'grub /
translated: then why is nonexistence not established by the existence of something else?

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa 'di lta bu mi dmigs pa nyid med pa rnams kyi med pa yin pa de'i tshe yul grub pas yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dag rtogs pa'am sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa 'di lta bu mi dmigs pa nyid med pa rnams kyi med pa yin pa de'i tshe yul grub pas yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dag rtogs pa'am sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: When non-apprehension itself is nonexistent in this way, then the nonexistence of those is established by the object, and the cognition, the word, and the convention that have it as their object are understood or established,

original: yul rab tu bstan pas brda la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rab tu bstan pas brda la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the symbol is engaged by the indication of the object.

original: dper na 'di ni ba lang yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni ba lang yin te /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThis is a cow,

original: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it has the nature of a collection of dewlap and so on.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang dpe ma grub par rgol ba yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dpe ma grub par rgol ba yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the opponent‚Äôs objection that the example is not established is also refuted.

original: yul rtogs kyang yul can ma rtogs pa dag snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rtogs kyang yul can ma rtogs pa dag snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though the object is realized, the subject is not realized.

original: gal te dngos po log pa ni dngos po med pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po log pa ni dngos po med pa yin la /
translated: If the negation of an entity is a nonentity,

original: mi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa log pa yin na ji ltar dngos po med pa yin dmigs pa log pas dngos po med par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa log pa yin na ji ltar dngos po med pa yin dmigs pa log pas dngos po med par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: and nonapprehension is the negation of apprehension, how could it be a nonentity? And how could the negation of apprehension be a nonentity?

original: 'bras bu log kyang rgyu med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu log kyang rgyu med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because even if the effect is negated, it is not established that the cause does not exist.

original: de 'dra ba'i yod pa rnam par gzhag pa ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa dang / rgyu gzhan tshang ba na dmigs par rung ba'i rang bzhin yod pa ni de la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dmigs pa ni yod pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i yod pa rnam par gzhag pa ni dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa dang / rgyu gzhan tshang ba na dmigs par rung ba'i rang bzhin yod pa ni de la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dmigs pa ni yod pa yin par brjod do //
translated: We say that apprehension exists because such an existence is characterized by the object, and because the existence that is the nature of the object is not mistaken with regard to it when the other causes are complete.

original: tshogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is mistaken because it depends on the transformation of the assemblage,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'bras bu'i dus na med par rtogs pa'i phyir te /üîΩgzhan @172a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na med par rtogs pa'i phyir te /üîΩgzhan @172a * //
translated: Because it is understood that it does not exist at the time of the effect.

original: dmigs pa na de mi dmigs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa na de mi dmigs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that it is not perceived when it is perceived.

original: mthu dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir yod kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir yod kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: Even if it exists, it is not perceived because it is blessed by one who has power.

original: ma yin te /üîΩyul dang dbang po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: ma yin te / yul dang dbang po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gam /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: gnyi ga gzhan du 'gyur ba med par byin gyis brlabs pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga gzhan du 'gyur ba med par byin gyis brlabs pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that either the object or the sense faculty or both are blessed without changing into something else.

original: de 'dus byas na ni mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'dus byas na ni mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is conditioned, it is not perceived,

original: de'i tshe yang rnam pa de lta bu'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i med pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang rnam pa de lta bu'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i med pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: and at that time, the nonexistence of the object to be apprehended by such a sense faculty is itself existent.

original: de'i phyir shes pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid ni 'di'i yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid ni 'di'i yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the suitability of being mixed with consciousness is its existence,

original: de las bzlog pa'i mi dmigs pa ni med pa yin te //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i mi dmigs pa ni med pa yin te //
translated: and the nonapprehension that is the opposite of that is its nonexistence.

original: des kyang yul can sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: des kyang yul can sgrub par byed do //
translated: That also establishes the subject.

original: 'dis ni 'dir rgyu 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dir rgyu 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: Here, this also removes error regarding cause and effect.

original: de la yang tha snyad de'i mtshan can yin par grub kyang de'i rgyu yod pa'i sgo nas kyang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la yang tha snyad de'i mtshan can yin par grub kyang de'i rgyu yod pa'i sgo nas kyang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, even though it is established that it has the character of that convention, it is to be established by the non-apprehension of its cause.

original: rgyu mtshan can gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can gzhan bzhin no //
translated: It is like any other reason.

original: re zhig mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: re zhig mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is that non-apprehension itself established?

original: 'di ni 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained later.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang /
translated: And that non-apprehension

original: 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam bzhi dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam bzhi dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no //
translated: is of four kinds, according to the specific application. All of those are from non-apprehension.

original: de ltar de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed de /
translated: Thus, it is of two kinds:

original: 'ga' zhig bsgrub pas sam 'gag pas so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bsgrub pas sam 'gag pas so //
translated: by establishing something or by negating something.

original: sgrub na yang 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba zhig sgrub grang na /
analyzed: sgrub na yang 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba zhig sgrub grang na /
translated: If it establishes, does it establish something that is not contradictory or something that is contradictory?

original: mi 'gal ba ni lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pas 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba ni lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pas 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is not contradictory, it is not a negation, because there is no contradiction in its co-existence.

original: 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa med par 'gal ba mi rtogs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa med par 'gal ba mi rtogs te /
translated: And if it is contradictory, the contradiction is not understood without non-apprehension.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ma gtugs pa can 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ma gtugs pa can 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs la /
translated: Thus, when the existence of one thing is incompatible with the existence of another, they are understood to be mutually exclusive.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no //
translated: And that is established by non-apprehension.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Mutually exclusive characteristics are also incompatible,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: like permanence and impermanence.

original: de la yang gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par brjod pa yin te /
translated: And in that case, the apprehension of one is the non-apprehension of the other.

original: de lta ma yin dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the non-apprehension of the excluded would not be established.

original: gcig bkag pas gzhan med par bsgrub pa la mi dmigs pa grub nyid de dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i @172b phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig bkag pas gzhan med par bsgrub pa la mi dmigs pa grub nyid de dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i @172b phyir ro //
translated: The establishment of non-apprehension is the establishment of the absence of one by the exclusion of the other, because exclusion is the nature of non-apprehension.üîΩIn that case, the proof of the exclusion of another object is the reason.

original: don gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam /üîΩgnyi ga ma yin pa bkag pa gtan tshigs yin grang na /
analyzed: don gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam /üîΩgnyi ga ma yin pa bkag pa gtan tshigs yin grang na /
translated: But is it the effect of the reason or not?

original: de la gnyi ga ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de med pa'i phyir med pas gzhan med par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la gnyi ga ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de med pa'i phyir med pas gzhan med par mi rigs so //
translated: The third alternative is impossible, because there is no connection between them.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs kyang rgyu ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir de med par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs kyang rgyu ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir de med par ga la 'gyur /
translated: And how can the cause be absent when the effect is not perceived, since the cause is necessarily associated with the effect?

original: nus pa rgyu yin gyi mi nus pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa rgyu yin gyi mi nus pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: A cause is a potentiality, not a non-potentiality.

original: nus pa las ni gegs bya bar yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: nus pa las ni gegs bya bar yang mi gnas te /
translated: And it is not possible to obstruct a potentiality,

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs na yongs su 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs na yongs su 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it does not change into something else in the final moment,

original: skad cig la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a moment is partless.

original: 'bras bu skye ba dang mi mthun pa bskyed pa ni gegs kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba dang mi mthun pa bskyed pa ni gegs kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the production of an effect that is incompatible with production is the characteristic of an obstruction.

original: de lta ma yin na cung zad mi byed pa ni gegs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na cung zad mi byed pa ni gegs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, something that does not do anything would not be an obstruction.

original: de 'dra ba'i rgyu ni 'bras bu med pa las med par rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rgyu ni 'bras bu med pa las med par rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: And such a cause is understood to be absent when the effect is absent.

original: dper na 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med de /
translated: For example, here, the cause of smoke is not a non-existent unobstructed potentiality.

original: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúBecause there is no smoke.

original: 'bras bu de ni rgyu las khyab pa dang ldog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo dang khyad par med pas de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par bshad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni rgyu las khyab pa dang ldog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo dang khyad par med pas de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par bshad do //
translated: ‚Äù Since the effect is pervaded by the cause and is not absent when the cause is absent, the non-apprehension of that effect is explained as the non-apprehension of the nature of the cause, because there is no difference between the nature of the cause and the effect.

original: de bzhin du de dang 'gal ba dmigs pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang 'gal ba dmigs pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa dag med de /
translated: Similarly, the apprehension of something incompatible with that is, for example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold to the touch that is unobstructed with regard to its ability to be a cause,

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because there is fire.

original: rgyu'i rdzas spyi la bsams nas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu'i rdzas spyi la bsams nas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod de /
translated: ‚Äù The non-apprehension of the effect is not stated to be an indicator of the absence of the cause when the cause is considered in general.

original: dper na 'di na me med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na me med de /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no fire.

original: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because there is no smoke.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äù The non-apprehension of the cause is an indicator of the absence of the effect.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang nyid med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang nyid med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of the nature of the effect is itself the absence of the effect.

original: de la ni yul can sgrub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de la ni yul can sgrub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: In that case, it is only the establishment of the subject.

original: de'i ngo bo khyab pa'i 'bras bu med pas ni med par yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo khyab pa'i 'bras bu med pas ni med par yang yin no //
translated: Since there is no pervasion that is an effect of that, it is also non-existent.

original: gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba'i med par smra ba de'i tshe yang dngos po med par yang yin pa nyid do //üîΩdes na de ltar sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas 'ga' zhig 'gog pa la ni go bar byed @173a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba'i med par smra ba de'i tshe yang dngos po med par yang yin pa nyid do // des na de ltar sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas 'ga' zhig 'gog pa la ni go bar byed @173a * //
translated: When one speaks of the non-existence of the pervaded due to the non-apprehension of the pervader, then it is also non-existent as an entity.

original: pa thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: pa thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in this way, when one refutes something by way of proof or negation, all the means of expression have the nature of non-apprehension.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other logical reason for negation.

original: dgag pa'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa de ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gi rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /üîΩ'gal ba grub pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa de ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gi rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te / 'gal ba grub pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: That non-apprehension which has a negated object has four aspects due to the difference of application.

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The establishment of a contradiction is, for example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch, because there is fire.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya ste /
translated: By this, one should understand that the establishment of a contradictory pervasion is also explained.

original: dper na 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩ'gal ba'i 'bras bu grub pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o // 'gal ba'i 'bras bu grub pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no contact with cold because there is fire.‚Äù

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩrgyu ma grub pa ni dper na 'di na du ba med de /
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o // rgyu ma grub pa ni dper na 'di na du ba med de /
translated: The establishment of a contradictory effect is, for example, ‚ÄúHere there is no contact with cold because there is smoke.‚Äù

original: me med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩrang bzhin ma grub pa ni dper na 'di na du ba med de /
analyzed: me med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o // rang bzhin ma grub pa ni dper na 'di na du ba med de /
translated: The nonestablishment of the cause is, for example, ‚ÄúHere there is no smoke because there is no fire.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The nonestablishment of the nature is, for example, ‚ÄúHere there is no smoke because it is not observed although it is observable.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma grub par yang bshad pa yin te /üîΩdper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma grub par yang bshad pa yin te / dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This also explains the nonestablishment of the pervader.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no shasha tree because there is no tree.‚Äù

original: med pa dang tha snyad sgrub pa'i ma dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid kho na'i de dag dang de 'gal ba dag dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan nye ba las ma grub pa dang grub pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: med pa dang tha snyad sgrub pa'i ma dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid kho na'i de dag dang de 'gal ba dag dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan nye ba las ma grub pa dang grub pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: In all these cases, the non-observation of something observable is established by the presence of something incompatible with it, and the non-observation of something unobservable is not established by the presence of something incompatible with it.

original: gzhan dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang 'gal ba dag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang 'gal ba dag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In other cases, the existence, non-existence, and incompatibility of cause and effect are not established.üîΩIn the absence of the perception of light,

original: snang ba mthong ba med pa dang // dngos po mi dmigs pa la ni //
analyzed: snang ba mthong ba med pa dang // dngos po mi dmigs pa la ni //
translated: and in the non-observation of an entity,

original: rgyu mi srid par gyur pa na //
analyzed: rgyu mi srid par gyur pa na //
translated: when the cause is not possible,

original: dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: one understands the non-existence of the entity.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the summary verse.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pas kyang med par grub na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pas kyang med par grub na /
translated: If non-existence is established by the observation of an effect that is incompatible with it,

original: de'i rgyu dmigs pas ci ste mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu dmigs pas ci ste mi 'grub ce na /
translated: why is it not established by the observation of its cause?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not,

original: de ni 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that is mistaken.

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: For example, here there is no cold sensation,üîΩbecause there is fire.

original: shing yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the wood exists.‚Äù

original: gang las de med par go bar 'gyur ba rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom par ma nges pas na grang ba bzlog pa'i me gdon mi za bar 'gyur @173b ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las de med par go bar 'gyur ba rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom par ma nges pas na grang ba bzlog pa'i me gdon mi za bar 'gyur @173b ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But since the causes of the effect are not necessarily engaged in producing the effect, it is not certain that the fire will appear to ward off the cold.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la 'khrul ba med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la 'khrul ba med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: There is no error in the special case of the final moment.

original: de las 'bras bu skye ba ni /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu skye ba ni /
translated: The effect arises from that,

original: gdod ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at the beginning.

original: mtha'i skad cig gi bar du ni skye ba la gegs srid kyi /üîΩmtha'i skad cig la gegs med pas rtags de mthong ba las 'bras bu dran pa la ltos te /üîΩrjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa na mtha'i skad cig bar chad med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig gi bar du ni skye ba la gegs srid kyi / mtha'i skad cig la gegs med pas rtags de mthong ba las 'bras bu dran pa la ltos te / rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa na mtha'i skad cig bar chad med pa'i phyir /
translated: Up to the final moment, the arising of the effect is possible, because an obstruction to arising is possible.üîΩBut since there is no obstruction to the final moment, the effect is perceived from seeing the sign, in dependence on the memory of the effect.

original: de'i sngon rol du 'bras bu skyes pa nyid mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sngon rol du 'bras bu skyes pa nyid mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the object of inference is understood, the final moment is uninterrupted, and the arising of the effect is directly perceived prior to that.

original: gang gis rgyu las de rtogs par 'gyur ba 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: gang gis rgyu las de rtogs par 'gyur ba 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa la ni rgyu'i dngos po rtogs pa med de /
translated: But if the effect is not manifest, then the cause is not understood.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not established from the cause.

original: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal na ni go bar byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal na ni go bar byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: If the reason contradicts the cause, then it is a proof.

original: dper na 'di na spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag med de /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no particular that is called a ‚Äòbristle‚Äô

original: gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag nye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag nye ba'i phyir ro // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because the particular of ‚Äòburning‚Äô is present.‚Äù

original: spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang 'gal ba yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu me ni grang ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir grang ba rgyun chad na de'i 'bras bu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang 'gal ba yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu me ni grang ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir grang ba rgyun chad na de'i 'bras bu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of burning, fire, which contradicts the particular of a ‚Äòbristle‚Äô and so on, is cold because it contradicts cold. When cold is interrupted, its effect also does not exist.

original: 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu las kyang de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par bshad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu las kyang de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par bshad par rig par bya ste /
translated: This explains that by the effect of that, one understands that the effect that contradicts that does not exist.

original: dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'di ni spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i me dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'di ni spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i me dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThis particular place is not endowed with fire that has the particular of ‚Äòhaving a tuft of hair,‚Äô

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because smoke exists.‚Äù

original: de dang 'gal ba grub pa 'di yang sngar bstan pa'i rgyu ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba grub pa 'di yang sngar bstan pa'i rgyu ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: And this establishment of the contradictory of that is also the nonestablishment of the reason as previously explained.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu yin no //
translated: Thus, this nonapprehension is of ten kinds by the variety of the syllogisms.

original: 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
analyzed: 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
translated: And in the case of the effect of the contradictory,üîΩone should understand the dependence on the object,

original: dus la sogs pa ltos par 'dod //üîΩgzhan du 'khrul 'gyur mi grang ba //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa ltos par 'dod // gzhan du 'khrul 'gyur mi grang ba //
translated: time, etc.

original: sgrub pa la ni thal ba bzhin //
analyzed: sgrub pa la ni thal ba bzhin //
translated: Otherwise, there would be error, as in the case of the nonchillingüîΩof the proof.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediary verse.

original: bskal pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: bskal pa rnams la ni /
translated: As for the eons,

original: med par nges pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: med par nges pa yod ma yin //
translated: there is no certainty of nonexistence.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pas na bskal pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pas na bskal pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Because of the difference of place, time, and nature, the eon is of three kinds.

original: de dag la ni mi dmigs pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la ni mi dmigs pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In those cases, nonapprehension is not an instrument of knowledge.

original: gal te yod pa ni gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te yod pa ni gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa'am /
translated: If something exists, it is certainly perceived by someone.

original: @174a * // 'das pa'am 'ongs pa ni dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: @174a * // 'das pa'am 'ongs pa ni dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If the past and future are perceived,

original: de ji ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir med pa la ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir med pa la ma yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be said that they do not exist because they are not perceived?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa ni 'di rtags ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa ni 'di rtags ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The negation of the perception of all things is not a logical reason,

original: bdag dang gzhan la ma grub pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la ma grub pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is not established for either the proponent or the opponent.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa nyid tshad mar byed pa na spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa nyid tshad mar byed pa na spong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the negation of the perception of these things is itself perceived, it is rejected.

original: de ni bskal pa bdag las yang yod na de dag med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bskal pa bdag las yang yod na de dag med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is possible that they exist in the future, then their nonexistence is not established.

original: de yang yod na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung rnams las gcig tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang yod na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung rnams las gcig tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And if they do exist, then they are perceived by direct perception, inference, and scriptural authority.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: 'ga' zhig la bstan bcos kyi dbang du byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la bstan bcos kyi dbang du byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of the perception of all things is not established for either the proponent or the opponent.

original: bstan bcos 'jug pa ni skyes bu'i don sgrub par byed pa'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten nas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'jug pa ni skyes bu'i don sgrub par byed pa'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten nas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The treatise is engaged in by means of some method for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa brjod pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa brjod pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, it would not be valid because it would be a statement of what is unrelated.

original: skabs der yang don mang po dag gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skabs der yang don mang po dag gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Even in that context, it is not necessarily the case that many things must be taught.

original: dper na bdag nyid so so la nges pa skyes bu rnams kyis sems kyi 'jug pa rgyu mtshan nges pa las byung ba ma yin can 'ga' zhig gam /
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid so so la nges pa skyes bu rnams kyis sems kyi 'jug pa rgyu mtshan nges pa las byung ba ma yin can 'ga' zhig gam /
translated: For example, for people who have developed certainty in themselves, the engagement of the mind does not arise from a definite reason.

original: yul dang dus kyis chod pa skabs su nye bar mkho ba med pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par lta bu ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyis chod pa skabs su nye bar mkho ba med pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par lta bu ste /
translated: Or, for example, like a particular substance that is not needed in a context where there is a separation of place and time.

original: de dag ni bstan bcos kyi yul du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bstan bcos kyi yul du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Those are not taken as the subject matter of the treatise.

original: de ltar bskal pa dag la ni rang gi mthus nye bar gnas pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa dag la ni rang gi mthus nye bar gnas pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In that way, even in eons, there is no capacity to generate knowledge that abides by its own power.

original: gang gis rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ba de dag gi 'bras bu gdon mi za bar dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ba de dag gi 'bras bu gdon mi za bar dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the effect of those that are to be inferred is not necessarily perceived.

original: de dag ni tshad ma gsum log tu zin kyang med do zhes nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshad ma gsum log tu zin kyang med do zhes nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And even if the three means of valid knowledge are contradicted, one cannot conclude that they do not exist.

original: gang yang shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa'i don nam /üîΩrang bzhin gyi khyad par dag spong bar byed pa dper na sems 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /üîΩlha'i khyad par dag med pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa'i don nam / rang bzhin gyi khyad par dag spong bar byed pa dper na sems 'dod chags dang bral ba'am / lha'i khyad par dag med pa'am /
translated: Moreover, one cannot deny the existence of a transcendent object or of a specific nature, because there is no proof of their nonexistence.üîΩFor example, one cannot deny the existence of a mind free from attachment, or of a specific divinity, or of a mind that is free from generosity and violence, etc.,

original: sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa spong ba'i sems ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa spong ba'i sems ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: or of a mind that is not the cause of high status.

original: mngon sum gyi don la yang 'bras bu de ma thag pa nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu de dang ldan pa ma yin @174b pa dang chos mtshungs pas na de phyin ci log pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don la yang 'bras bu de ma thag pa nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu de dang ldan pa ma yin @174b pa dang chos mtshungs pas na de phyin ci log pa yin no //
translated: And even if the object of direct perception does not immediately follow, one cannot deny that it possesses that effect, because it is similar to a phenomenon that does possess that effect.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu chod pa dag kyang skye ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu chod pa dag kyang skye ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the effect is seen to arise from a cause that is interrupted,

original: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa'i dug gi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa'i dug gi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: like the transformation of the poison of a mouse or a mad dog.

original: de 'byung ba la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'di la mi dmigs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'byung ba la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'di la mi dmigs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no contradiction in its arising, mere non-observation is not a valid means of knowledge in this case.

original: de 'byung ba la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de 'byung ba la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the valid means of knowledge of its arising?

original: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, one would be doubtful,

original: yang na tshad ma srid pas mi spong ngo //
analyzed: yang na tshad ma srid pas mi spong ngo //
translated: or one would not reject it because a valid means of knowledge is possible.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rang bzhin nam don 'ga' zhig mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir shes par byed pa ma grub pa yin yang de tsam gyis de med par nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rang bzhin nam don 'ga' zhig mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir shes par byed pa ma grub pa yin yang de tsam gyis de med par nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no clear seeing of any nature or meaning in this case, and since there is no certainty that causes produce effects, the proof of cognition is not established. However, merely by that, it is not ascertained that it does not exist.

original: yang rim gyis 'ga' zhig gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rim gyis 'ga' zhig gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it may become clear again at some point.

original: gang gi phyir de dag las don gyi rang bzhin nges par 'gyur ba sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag las don gyi rang bzhin nges par 'gyur ba sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Because the nature of the object is ascertained from those words, the words do not engage in accordance with the thing.

original: de dag ni smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med pas de nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med pas de nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Because they engage due to the speaker‚Äôs desire to express, they are not mistaken with respect to that, and thus they are understood by that.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa thams cad ni dngos po ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa thams cad ni dngos po ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: All of the desires of persons are not just as things are.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos ni gzhan go bar byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos pos ni gzhan go bar byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the nature that is related to them understood by others.

original: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni yid ches pa yin la //
analyzed: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni yid ches pa yin la //
translated: If a person who possesses the qualities of seeing things as they are and so on is trustworthy,

original: des bstan pa'i lung ni mi slu ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des bstan pa'i lung ni mi slu ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then the scripture that he teaches is nondeceptive.

original: gal te khyad par can de nyid //
analyzed: gal te khyad par can de nyid //
translated: If that which is qualified

original: shes par nus na don 'di 'dod //
analyzed: shes par nus na don 'di 'dod //
translated: can be known, then this object is accepted.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can lung ngam lung ma yin pa tshol ba thams cad ni 'jug par 'dod pas yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can lung ngam lung ma yin pa tshol ba thams cad ni 'jug par 'dod pas yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: All those who seek to engage in the scriptures or in non-scripture, who are motivated by the desire to engage, are not motivated by attachment.

original: de skyes bu brtags nas 'jug na ni 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skyes bu brtags nas 'jug na ni 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one engages after examining the person, one will not engage.

original: de lta bu ni shes par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu ni shes par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because such a person cannot be known.

original: mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one does not wish to know.

original: de 'dra ba ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan nges pa'i rtags ni med de de dag ni sems kyi chos yin pas dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir rang las skyes pa'i lus dang ngag gi tha snyad las rjes su dpog grang na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan nges pa'i rtags ni med de de dag ni sems kyi chos yin pas dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir rang las skyes pa'i lus dang ngag gi tha snyad las rjes su dpog grang na /
translated: Because such a person is described as being unmistaken.üîΩThus, there is no sign for ascertaining the faults and qualities of others, because they are mental phenomena and are beyond the senses.

original: tha snyad kyang phal cher blo sngon du btang nas gzhan du bya bar nus te //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang phal cher blo sngon du btang nas gzhan du bya bar nus te //
translated: If one infers from the conventions of one's own body and speech, even those conventions are mostly able to be done otherwise, motivated by the mind.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir @175a * //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir @175a * //
translated: Because they engage according to the person's desire,

original: dang ; de dag kyang bsam pa sna tshogs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ; de dag kyang bsam pa sna tshogs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because they have various intentions.

original: des na 'di rtags 'tshol ba'i phyir ji ltar nges pa med par rtogs par byed /
analyzed: des na 'di rtags 'tshol ba'i phyir ji ltar nges pa med par rtogs par byed /
translated: Therefore, how can this be understood as a sign of the absence of ascertainment?

original: gal te byed pa po shes par dka' ba'i phyir skyes bu la brten pa'i tshig ni lung ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po shes par dka' ba'i phyir skyes bu la brten pa'i tshig ni lung ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that because the agent is difficult to know, the words that depend on a person are not scripture,

original: skyes bus ma byas pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that that which is not made by a person is nonerroneous,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / don brjod pa ni skyes bu'i nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / don brjod pa ni skyes bu'i nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because that is untenable, and because the expression of meaning depends on the demonstration of a person.

original: dmigs par rung ba dang mi rung pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs par rung ba dang mi rung pa bzhin no //
translated: Like what is suitable and unsuitable as an object.

original: de las byung ba yin pas ni de rtogs pa skye ba dang nyams pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba yin pas ni de rtogs pa skye ba dang nyams pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from that, the arising and degeneration of the realization of that does not exist without it.

original: rtag tu de'i bdag yin ni res 'ga' dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de'i bdag yin ni res 'ga' dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the self of that, it follows that it would sometimes be observed and sometimes not observed.

original: gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on another,

original: des de la cung zad kyang ma byas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: des de la cung zad kyang ma byas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it does not do anything to that.

original: gzhan byed na ni de'i zhes 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan byed na ni de'i zhes 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is something else, then the connection ‚Äúhis‚Äù is not tenable.

original: phan pa de dang 'brel pa yin na phan gdags bya 'dogs byed ma yin pa dag ci zhig 'brel /
analyzed: phan pa de dang 'brel pa yin na phan gdags bya 'dogs byed ma yin pa dag ci zhig 'brel /
translated: If the benefit is connected with it, then what is the connection between the one who is benefited and the one who benefits?

original: gal te rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the relation of support and supported,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis phan pa med na de yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis phan pa med na de yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: then if there is no benefit by way of identity, that is not established.

original: bdag nyid gzhan yin na ni brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa dang thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan yin na ni brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa dang thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is identity with another, then the same objection and infinite regress would follow.

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po yin na ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir de rtag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po yin na ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir de rtag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the relation of produced and producer, then it would be permanent, because it would not depend on anything else.

original: ltos na ni thal snga mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos na ni thal snga mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does depend on something else, then the same objection would follow.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang dmigs su rung ba'i bdag nyid res 'ga' ba skyes bu'i byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can de ni skyes bus byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang dmigs su rung ba'i bdag nyid res 'ga' ba skyes bu'i byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can de ni skyes bus byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, sound, which is sometimes manifest and sometimes not, and which follows the activity of a person, is produced by a person.

original: de lta ma yin na med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir don gzhan rtogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir don gzhan rtogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then since there would be no invariable concomitance, there would be no understanding of the meaning.

original: sgra'i yod pa nyid ni don gyi khyad par rang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i yod pa nyid ni don gyi khyad par rang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The existence of the word is not related to the particular meaning,

original: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated in all cases.

original: gal te dbang dang yul bzhin du phan tshun rung ba nyid nges par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang dang yul bzhin du phan tshun rung ba nyid nges par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it be said that the mutual fitness of the word and the meaning is what determines the relation,

original: ma yin te de la yang gcig la so sor nges pa ni des bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang gcig la so sor nges pa ni des bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: no, because in that case, the fitness of each in one would be the characteristic of the production of the word,

original: des phan btags pa'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des phan btags pa'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense faculty that is helped by it produces the consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na phan mi 'dogs pa ni ltos par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phan mi 'dogs pa ni ltos par bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then that which does not help would not be the basis,

original: yul gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan bzhin no //
translated: like another object.

original: gal te ci'i phyir de kho nas phan 'dogs par @175b byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir de kho nas phan 'dogs par @175b byed ce na /
translated: If it be asked why it is that it helps just that,

original: de la gang de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gang de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs par byed pa yin no //
translated: the answer is that it is the nature of things to be just that way.

original: 'di ltar s'a lu'i sa bon las ni nas kyi myu gu mi 'byung gi /'on kyang nas sa bon la yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar s'a lu'i sa bon las ni nas kyi myu gu mi 'byung gi /'on kyang nas sa bon la yin no //
translated: Thus, a barley sprout does not arise from a rice seed, but rather from a barley seed.

original: de bzhin du gal te sgra rnams kyang don las skye ba yin na ni rung ba nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te sgra rnams kyang don las skye ba yin na ni rung ba nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, if words were to arise from objects, then there would be a definite connection.

original: de med na 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de med na 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: If that does not exist, then the connection ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù is not established.

original: don dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor would there be a connection with the object,

original: don las ni shes par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: don las ni shes par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: because it is held that cognition arises from the object.

original: des ni don shes pa'i phyir rab tu sbyar bas na des de dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des ni don shes pa'i phyir rab tu sbyar bas na des de dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Since it is applied because of that cognition of the object, it would be connected with that,

original: lus kyi rig byed la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rig byed la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the bodily expression and so on.

original: de las byung ba yin pas ni de rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yin pas ni de rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it arises from that, it does not make that known,

original: nam mkhas bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkhas bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like a pot, etc. from space.

original: gal te gang gi phyir de las skye bar 'gyur ba sgra'i rang bzhin ni don rnams la nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir de las skye bar 'gyur ba sgra'i rang bzhin ni don rnams la nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the nature of a word that arises from that is not ascertained in objects,

original: 'on kyang 'di ni 'di kho na rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes shes byed nus pa'i nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni 'di kho na rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes shes byed nus pa'i nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But this is the very thing that is being understood.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag gis der 'brel pa yang 'bras bu nyid las ma 'das te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag gis der 'brel pa yang 'bras bu nyid las ma 'das te /
translated: And the relation of existence and non-existence to it does not go beyond the effect,

original: gzhan dag la yang de'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of the other is just that.

original: de las 'das nas ni nges pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'das nas ni nges pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And beyond that, certainty is not tenable.

original: nus pa yang don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid rang gi ngo bos nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid rang gi ngo bos nges pa yin no //
translated: And potentiality is not a different object, so it is just that which is certain by its own nature.

original: don gzhan nyid yin na ni de las don rnams la shes pa skye ba'i phyir sgra ni rjod par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin na ni de las don rnams la shes pa skye ba'i phyir sgra ni rjod par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were a different object, then since the cognition of objects arises from that, sound would not be the expresser,

original: de'i zhes 'brel pa yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes 'brel pa yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation of that would not be established.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du 'ga' zhig tu nges pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad ni rang gi rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las byung ba yin pas nges par byed pa bskyed pa nyid du gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du 'ga' zhig tu nges pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad ni rang gi rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las byung ba yin pas nges par byed pa bskyed pa nyid du gsal bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of something that is ascertained in some way always arises from the nature of its cause, it is clear that the cause generates the ascertainment.

original: gal te med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis sgra las don rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: gal te med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis sgra las don rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi ;
translated: If you say that the meaning is not understood from the word because of the invariable concomitance,

original: 'on kyang sgron mas gzugs bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis yin te /üîΩdes na 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgron mas gzugs bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis yin te / des na 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but rather, like a lamp, through suitability,

original: zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: then the error that it is not understood because there is no relation would not occur.

original: ma yin te /üîΩgzugs la sgron ma bzhin du rang gi ngo bo rtogs par byed pa ma yin @176a * //
analyzed: ma yin te / gzugs la sgron ma bzhin du rang gi ngo bo rtogs par byed pa ma yin @176a * //
translated: That is not so,

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like a lamp, it does not cause the understanding of its own nature.

original: sgra dang rtags dag ni de yod pa dang med pa la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dran pa la ltos nas rang gi yul rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang rtags dag ni de yod pa dang med pa la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dran pa la ltos nas rang gi yul rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: Words and signs cause the understanding of their object through recalling what is seen and not seen in relation to the existence and nonexistence of that object.

original: ma mthong ba dang rjed pa dag gis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / the tshom za ba dang mang po dag la mthong ba la ni the tshom du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gcig la mthong ba la med pa'i phyir dang / yang mthong na 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang rjed pa dag gis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / the tshom za ba dang mang po dag la mthong ba la ni the tshom du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gcig la mthong ba la med pa'i phyir dang / yang mthong na 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not understand through not seeing or through forgetting, because there is doubt when there is seeing of many things, because there is no seeing when there is seeing of one thing, and because there is change when there is seeing.

original: khyad par gzhan la mthong na rnam pa gzhan du sbyar yang log par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba gzhan du gyur na don gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir na mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan la mthong na rnam pa gzhan du sbyar yang log par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba gzhan du gyur na don gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir na mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because there is error when one sees another thing and applies it to another thing, and because one grasps another thing when there is a change in the seeing.

original: ka li dang ma ri zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag la 'gro lding ba dang / yul dbus pa dag gis bsnyo  ba dang / dus kyi khyad par dang / char 'bab pa dang / gsod pa la sogs dag tu rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ka li dang ma ri zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag la 'gro lding ba dang / yul dbus pa dag gis bsnyo  ba dang / dus kyi khyad par dang / char 'bab pa dang / gsod pa la sogs dag tu rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the words kali and mari are understood by the Dravidians to mean ‚Äúgo‚Äù and ‚Äústay,‚Äù respectively, but by the people of the Middle Country to mean ‚Äúfood‚Äù and ‚Äúdrink,‚Äù respectively.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la ltos pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la ltos pa na /
translated: Therefore, when these words are seen or not seen,

original: rtags bzhin du de'i sgrub par byed pa can mi 'khrul ba nyid rtogs pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags bzhin du de'i sgrub par byed pa can mi 'khrul ba nyid rtogs pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: Just like the sign, the non-erroneous nature of the proof is based on the understanding.

original: nye bar bstan pa med na ni mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / nye bar bstan na ni sgra rnams don la bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa med na ni mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / nye bar bstan na ni sgra rnams don la bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no indication, there is no understanding, and if there is indication, there is no obstruction to the meaning of the words.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rang dbang nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa sel ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rang dbang nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa sel ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the independence of the person's desire is eliminated.

original: rtsod pa 'di rgyas par ni kho bos tshad ma rnam 'grel du bkag pa'i phyir 'dir mi spro'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di rgyas par ni kho bos tshad ma rnam 'grel du bkag pa'i phyir 'dir mi spro'o //
translated: This debate is extensively refuted by me in the Pramanavarttika, so I will not elaborate on it here.

original: bdag nyid chags sogs ldan pa'am //
analyzed: bdag nyid chags sogs ldan pa'am //
translated: One who possesses attachment and so forth

original: gzhan las rig byed don rig min //
analyzed: gzhan las rig byed don rig min //
translated: Does not know the meaning of the Vedas from another.

original: rig byed rig par byed min na //
analyzed: rig byed rig par byed min na //
translated: If the Vedas do not make one understand,

original: rig byed don ni gang las rtogs //
analyzed: rig byed don ni gang las rtogs //
translated: How is the meaning of the Vedas understood?

original: des na mtho ris 'dod me la //
analyzed: des na mtho ris 'dod me la //
translated: Therefore, for one who desires heaven,

original: sbyin sreg sbyin zhes thos pa na //
analyzed: sbyin sreg sbyin zhes thos pa na //
translated: It is heard that one should perform fire sacrifices.

original: khyi sha zo zhes bya ba 'di //
analyzed: khyi sha zo zhes bya ba 'di //
translated: This is like saying Eat dog meat,

original: don min zhes 'dir tshad ma gang //
analyzed: don min zhes 'dir tshad ma gang //
translated: What is the valid cognition here that says it is not the meaning?

original: 'jig rten tshig grags zhe na 'dir //
analyzed: 'jig rten tshig grags zhe na 'dir //
translated: If it is said that this is known in the world,

original: dbang po las 'das don mthong gang //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das don mthong gang //
translated: How can one see a meaning that is beyond the senses?

original: sna tshogs don can sgra rnams la //
analyzed: sna tshogs don can sgra rnams la //
translated: In the case of words that have various meanings,

original: gang gis don 'di rnam 'byed nus //
analyzed: gang gis don 'di rnam 'byed nus //
translated: how can one determine the meaning?

original: mtho ris lha mo la sogs sgra //
analyzed: mtho ris lha mo la sogs sgra //
translated: One sees the words of the celestial maidens of the heavens

original: grags pa ma yin don brjod mthong //
analyzed: grags pa ma yin don brjod mthong //
translated: expressing meanings that are not well known.

original: de 'dra'i sgra gzhan dag la ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i sgra gzhan dag la ni //
translated: In the case of other words,

original: de 'dra'i rnam rtog nyid @176b du 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'dra'i rnam rtog nyid @176b du 'gyur //
translated: such a meaning is not understood.

original: don dang ldan bar ma grub pa //
analyzed: don dang ldan bar ma grub pa //
translated: The meaning is not established as being meaningful,

original: de rab 'grub pa'i sgrub byed la //
analyzed: de rab 'grub pa'i sgrub byed la //
translated: and the proof that establishes it

original: rang don ma grub nus med de //
analyzed: rang don ma grub nus med de //
translated: is not established as having its own meaning,

original: brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs phyir ro //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs phyir ro //
translated: because the objection and the analysis are the same.

original: grags pa'ang mi yi brjod pa yin //
analyzed: grags pa'ang mi yi brjod pa yin //
translated: Fame is the expression of people,

original: de ni tshad mar mi 'dod dang // de las don yang rtogs byed pa'i //
analyzed: de ni tshad mar mi 'dod dang // de las don yang rtogs byed pa'i //
translated: and that is not accepted as valid cognition.

original: sdang 'dod 'di ni ci zhig yin //
analyzed: sdang 'dod 'di ni ci zhig yin //
translated: What is the point of wanting to be famousüîΩwhen one understands the meaning from that?

original: gal te grags pa las brgal bar //
analyzed: gal te grags pa las brgal bar //
translated: If one objects to fame,

original: rtog la rgyu ci yod ce na //
analyzed: rtog la rgyu ci yod ce na //
translated: what is the point of having a concept?

original: rab grags tshad ma nyid min phyir //
analyzed: rab grags tshad ma nyid min phyir //
translated: Because fame is not valid cognition,

original: der 'dzin pa la rgyu ci yod //
analyzed: der 'dzin pa la rgyu ci yod //
translated: what is the point of grasping at it?

original: grags pa nyid kyi sgra don ni //
analyzed: grags pa nyid kyi sgra don ni //
translated: The meaning of the words of fame

original: nges la dogs skyed byed pa de //üîΩgang phyir de la sna tshogs kyi //
analyzed: nges la dogs skyed byed pa de // gang phyir de la sna tshogs kyi //
translated: And the doubt is produced by the certainty.üîΩBecause the word is seen to be applied

original: don la sgra 'jug mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: don la sgra 'jug mthong phyir ro //
translated: To various objects.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa gang la //üîΩrigs pas gnod med de bzung na //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa gang la // rigs pas gnod med de bzung na //
translated: If the world accepts something

original: rigs las gnod pa yod min pa'i //
analyzed: rigs las gnod pa yod min pa'i //
translated: That is not contradicted by reasoning,

original: rlung gi bu de cis mi 'dzin //üîΩdbang po 'das la lung don gyi //
analyzed: rlung gi bu de cis mi 'dzin // dbang po 'das la lung don gyi //
translated: Why not accept the son of the windüîΩSince there is no contradiction with reasoning?üîΩThere is no reasoning other than

original: rten can las gzhan rigs pa med //
analyzed: rten can las gzhan rigs pa med //
translated: The one based on the meaning of the scripturesüîΩThat is beyond the senses.

original: de yi don yang gnas med phyir //
analyzed: de yi don yang gnas med phyir //
translated: And since that meaning is not established,

original: 'di la rigs pa srid ma yin //
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa srid ma yin //
translated: Reasoning is not possible here.

original: rnam gzhan mi srid med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam gzhan mi srid med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since another possibility is impossible,

original: rang nyid sna tshogs nus can sgras //üîΩnges byed mthong ba med pa rnams //
analyzed: rang nyid sna tshogs nus can sgras // nges byed mthong ba med pa rnams //
translated: The word, which is capable of various meanings,üîΩIs seen to determine the meaning.

original: gdon mi za bar the tshom 'gyur //üîΩ'ga' zhig lam ni 'di yin zhes //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar the tshom 'gyur // 'ga' zhig lam ni 'di yin zhes //
translated: Those who do not see this will undoubtedly doubt.üîΩSome say, ‚ÄúThis is the path,‚ÄùüîΩAnd others say, ‚ÄúThis is the path,‚Äù

original: sdom dum 'di smra zhes zer dang // gzhan dag bdag nyid smra de ltar //
analyzed: sdom dum 'di smra zhes zer dang // gzhan dag bdag nyid smra de ltar //
