translated: it would arise without a cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses of summary.

original: 'o na da ni ji ltar lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa las 'bras bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o na da ni ji ltar lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa las 'bras bu 'byung ste /
translated: Now, how does an effect arise from a collection of different co-operating causes?

original: dper na mig dang gzugs la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mig dang gzugs la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: For example, like consciousness from eye, form, etc.

original: gcig pu skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gcig pu skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: There is nothing that produces it singly,

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: nor is it the nature of that.

original: 'on kyang tshogs skyed par byed pa dang de'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs skyed par byed pa dang de'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: But the collection produces it, and that is its nature.

original: de kho na rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de kho na rjes su dpag go //
translated: That is inferred.

original: tshogs pa de nyid 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa de nyid 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten yin no //
translated: That very collection is the basis for the existence of the nature of the effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rnam grangs med par skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rnam grangs med par skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the co-operating causes are also producers without distinction.

original: gang yang cung zad lci ba la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa las autpala la sogs pa 'byung @182b bar mthong ba la de la yang de skad du brjod kyang rang gi sa bon las rab tu skye ba can las rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yodüîΩpa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang yang cung zad lci ba la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa las autpala la sogs pa 'byung @182b bar mthong ba la de la yang de skad du brjod kyang rang gi sa bon las rab tu skye ba can las rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Even though it is seen that a lotus, etc. arises from a different type of cause, such as a seed, etc., which is slightly heavy, etc., even though it is said that the lotus, etc. arises from that, it arises from its own seed, and its own nature is different.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang sdong bu las skye ba'i chu shing lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang sdong bu las skye ba'i chu shing lta bu'o //
translated: Because the nature of the cause is different, for example, like a plantain tree which arises from a seed and a bulb.

original: de lta bu ni 'jig rten na gsal ba kho nar rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'jig rten na gsal ba kho nar rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'byed do //
translated: Such a thing is clearly distinguished in the world by way of its different aspects.

original: 'bras bu rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu yang de ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rgyu yang de ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The cause which is inferred from the effect is also immediate.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i rdzas rang bzhin mtshungs pa rnams la 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i rdzas rang bzhin mtshungs pa rnams la 'dra ba yin te /
translated: That is similar to the substances of the effect which are of the same nature.

original: dper na rjes su 'brel pa'i chu shing sdong bu las skye ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su 'brel pa'i chu shing sdong bu las skye ba dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, the sprouts that arise from the trunk of a plantain tree are related to it.

original: gang la dngos kyi rgyu tha dad pa de la ni rang bzhin tha dad pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la dngos kyi rgyu tha dad pa de la ni rang bzhin tha dad pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: But when there is a difference in the material cause, there is also a difference in the nature of the effect.

original: dper na sa bon dang sdong bu las skye ba can de dag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang sdong bu las skye ba can de dag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, those very sprouts that arise from the seed and the trunk.

original: des na gang la ci 'dra ba mthong ba de las ni de 'dra ba rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang la ci 'dra ba mthong ba de las ni de 'dra ba rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one sees something like that, one infers something like that.

original: bar du chud pa'i rgyu brgyud pa dag ni rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa nyid pas 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: bar du chud pa'i rgyu brgyud pa dag ni rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa nyid pas 'khrul pa med do //
translated: But when there is an intervening cause, there is no inference, so there is no error.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa 'ba' zhig ni de dang de ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa 'ba' zhig ni de dang de ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ma yin no //
translated: And a mere difference in form is not the reason for being or not being that.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te /
translated: But there is also a difference in nature.

original: bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i nor bu dang mu tig dang byi ru la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i nor bu dang mu tig dang byi ru la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the artificial and non-artificial jewels, pearls, corals, etc.

original: kha cig tu ni me tog tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni me tog tha dad pa ste /
translated: And in some cases, there is a difference in flowers.

original: sngon po dang cig shos kyi me tog can gyi shur pa ka bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang cig shos kyi me tog can gyi shur pa ka bzhin no //
translated: like a grove of blue and other lotuses.

original: kha cig tu ni 'bras bu ste //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'bras bu ste //
translated: In some cases, the effect is known from the effect,

original: 'bras bu med pa dang cig shos kyi kar go ta bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa dang cig shos kyi kar go ta bzhin no //
translated: like a mango and other trees.

original: kha cig tu ni ro las te //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni ro las te //
translated: In some cases, it is known from taste,

original: nags dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon bzhin no //
analyzed: nags dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon bzhin no //
translated: like a forest and a grove of mango trees.

original: kha cig tu ni nus pa ste //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni nus pa ste //
translated: In some cases, it is known from potency,

original: reg pa dang myangs pas 'khru ba'i aa ru ra bzhin no //
analyzed: reg pa dang myangs pas 'khru ba'i aa ru ra bzhin no //
translated: like myrobalan fruit, which is purgative when touched or tasted.

original: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the effect is never in error with regard to the cause.

original: rgyu khyad par yod kyang 'bras bu khyad par med na skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par yod kyang 'bras bu khyad par med na skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were a cause with a distinction, but the effect were without distinction, there would be an error.

original: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa las //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa las //
translated: From the concomitance and nonconcomitance,

original: gang zhig gang gi rjes 'gror mthong //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rjes 'gror mthong //
translated: whatever is seen to follow from whatever,

original: de yi rang bzhin du rgyu can //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin du rgyu can //
translated: that is the cause of the nature of that,

original: de phyir mi mthun las mi 'byung //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po'am //
analyzed: de phyir mi mthun las mi 'byung // rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po'am //
translated: therefore it does not arise from a dissimilar cause.üîΩFrom the ascertainment of the nature of the cause and effect,

original: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las //
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las //
translated: or from the ascertainment of the nature,

original: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //
translated: there is the ascertainment of the invariable concomitance.

original: ma mthong las min mthong las min //
analyzed: ma mthong las min mthong las min //
translated: Not from the unseen, not from the seen.

original: gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
translated: How can one thing be the nature of another?

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos //
translated: If a phenomenon has a different object as its cause,

original: yin na gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: yin na gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: It is like a cloth and the dye.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the summary verse.

original: gzhan yang / chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can //
translated: Moreover, if a phenomenon has a different object as its cause,

original: yin par gyur na de gzhan nyid //
analyzed: yin par gyur na de gzhan nyid //
translated: It would be different from that.

original: de grub na ma grub pa'am rgyu tha dad pa ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de grub na ma grub pa'am rgyu tha dad pa ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were established, it would not be established as different from it, and it is not reasonable that a different cause would be its nature.

original: dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'am /
translated: The difference of thingsüîΩis only this:

original: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te /üîΩchos 'gal bar @183a * //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te / chos 'gal bar @183a * //
translated: They are mutually exclusive,

original: gnas pa'am rgyu tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'am rgyu tha dad pa'o //
translated: or they have different causes.

original: des kyang tha dad par mi 'grub na ni 'ga' yang gang las kyang tha dad pa med pas ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang tha dad par mi 'grub na ni 'ga' yang gang las kyang tha dad pa med pas ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not established as different by that, then nothing would be different from anything, and everything would be a single substance.

original: des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang / thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang / thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro//
translated: Therefore, co-origination and destruction would be applied to everything in every way.

original: de ltar ma yin na cig ces bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na cig ces bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If that were not so, then it would not be called ‚Äúsimultaneous‚Äù or

original: ming tha dad par zad de /
analyzed: ming tha dad par zad de /
translated: it would be just a different name.

original: don khas blangs nas de skad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don khas blangs nas de skad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning is accepted and expressed in that way.

original: rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang dngos po'i dus na mi rtag nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang dngos po'i dus na mi rtag nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even though the meaning of the cause is not different, since impermanence is not established at the time of the thing, is it not the same as not being its nature?

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba gang phyis 'grub bar 'gyur ba gzhan ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba gang phyis 'grub bar 'gyur ba gzhan ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no other impermanence at all that is established later,

original: dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can de kho na mi rtag pa yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can de kho na mi rtag pa yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: because that very thing that has the property of momentary duration is impermanent. This has been explained many times.

original: chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa la yang rgyu mtshan khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs ni tshad ma rnam 'grel du bstan zin to //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa la yang rgyu mtshan khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs ni tshad ma rnam 'grel du bstan zin to //
translated: The difference between the words ‚Äúquality‚Äù and ‚Äúpossessor of the quality‚Äù is also explained in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika in the context of the refutation and non-refutation of other reasons.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin de ni mthong bzhin du yang blo zhan pa yod pa dmigs pas rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin de ni mthong bzhin du yang blo zhan pa yod pa dmigs pas rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa'am /
translated: Even though the nature of the pot is seen, the weak-minded, deceived by the appearance of its existence, doubt that it exists in that way.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pas mi rtogs so //
translated: They do not understand it because they are deceived by the appearance of another similar object.

original: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la nges pa'i phyir 'di mi dmigs pas mi gnas par rtogs pa'i phyir de'i tshe nges pa'i dus yin pas mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go zhes kyang bshad zin to //üîΩde lta ma yin na gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la nges pa'i phyir 'di mi dmigs pas mi gnas par rtogs pa'i phyir de'i tshe nges pa'i dus yin pas mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go zhes kyang bshad zin to // de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin nam /
translated: But because it is ascertained in the case of those who see the final moment, it is understood that it does not endure. Therefore, at that time, because it is the time of its ascertainment, impermanence is established.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then impermanence would be a completely different object, whether it had another as its reason or not.

original: de lta yin na ni dngos po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni dngos po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would not possess that thing,

original: de la mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not need it.

original: dgos na ni de nyid 'di'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin pas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dgos na ni de nyid 'di'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin pas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If it did need it, then it would be impermanent by its very nature, so what would be the use of anything else?

original: rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo na ni don gzhan dang ldan yang de'i ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo na ni don gzhan dang ldan yang de'i ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not move by its very nature, then even if it possessed another object, it would not be tenable that it would have that nature.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dam chos gzhan de yang don gzhan las byung ba na rgyu yin pa'am 'bras bu yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dam chos gzhan de yang don gzhan las byung ba na rgyu yin pa'am 'bras bu yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: If impermanence or another attribute arose from another object, would it be a cause or an effect?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is neither a cause nor an effect is unrelated,

original: de @183b la yod par rjes su dpag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de @183b la yod par rjes su dpag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is impossible to infer its existence.

original: de la phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
analyzed: de la phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
translated: It is not a cause because it arises later.

original: 'bras bu na yang ga la nges //
analyzed: 'bras bu na yang ga la nges //
translated: How could it be ascertained as an effect?

original: de dngos po grub nas phyis don gzhan las 'byung na ji ltar de'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: de dngos po grub nas phyis don gzhan las 'byung na ji ltar de'i rgyu yin /
translated: If it arose later from another object after the thing was established, how could it be its cause?

original: gzhan gyi phan pa la ltos pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phan pa la ltos pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: And because the effect that depends on the benefit of another does not exist in the cause, the reason for its existence is uncertain.

original: dngos po tsam las byung ba yin na yang gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa dang de tsam gyis rjes su 'brel par grub po /
analyzed: dngos po tsam las byung ba yin na yang gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa dang de tsam gyis rjes su 'brel par grub po /
translated: If it were to arise from mere entity, it would be causeless, because it would not depend on another. And it would be established as related to that mere entity.

original: de las 'ga' zhig byung yang de la mi dgos pas nyams pa med pa'i phyir thal ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de las 'ga' zhig byung yang de la mi dgos pas nyams pa med pa'i phyir thal ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And even if it arose from that, it would not be necessary for it, so it would not be impaired. Therefore, the consequence is the same as before.

original: des na mi 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po la rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po la rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not inferred from an entity that has the nature of fearlessness.

original: ji ltar rjes su mi dpog /'di ltar mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la ni 'gar yang skye ba ma mthong la /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su mi dpog /'di ltar mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la ni 'gar yang skye ba ma mthong la /
translated: How is it not inferred? Thus, the arising of an entity that is not impermanent is not seen anywhere.

original: ma mthong ba las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa des na 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa des na 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: And from what is not seen, the exclusion from the discordant class is not seen. Therefore, it is not nonerroneous.

original: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba //
translated: Not seeing in the discordant class,

original: tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min //
analyzed: tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min //
translated: But that does not mean that there is no error.

original: 'khrul pa srid pa tsam nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid pa tsam nyid phyir //
translated: Because error is possible,

original: phru ba'i 'bras ni tshos pa bzhin //
analyzed: phru ba'i 'bras ni tshos pa bzhin //
translated: Like the rice in the pot.

original: mang po zhig tshos par mthong /
analyzed: mang po zhig tshos par mthong /
translated: You see some of the rice cooked.

original: yang phru ba'i nang du chud pa tsam gyis ni tshos par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: yang phru ba'i nang du chud pa tsam gyis ni tshos par mi 'grub ste /
translated: But just because it is in the pot does not mean that it is cooked.

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you see error.

original: 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin yin la 'di dang tshos pa'i rgyu 'dra ba dag tshos so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin yin la 'di dang tshos pa'i rgyu 'dra ba dag tshos so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then it would not be the case that only those which are similar to the cause of cooking are cooked.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: Otherwise, that inference would be erroneous, because it would have a remainder.

original: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /üîΩgang zhig ma mthong ba tsam gyis //
analyzed: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na / gang zhig ma mthong ba tsam gyis //
translated: What is this remainder?üîΩThat which is shown to be absent

original: ldog pa rab tu ston byed pa //
analyzed: ldog pa rab tu ston byed pa //
translated: merely by not being seen.

original: de'i ldog pa de ni ma nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ldog pa de ni ma nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
translated: The absence of that is uncertain, because there is doubt that it occurs in the discordant side.

original: ldog pa sgrub pa ma mthong tsam //
analyzed: ldog pa sgrub pa ma mthong tsam //
translated: The proof of the absence is merely not seeing.

original: de ni the tshom rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: de ni the tshom rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of doubt.

original: de la lhag ma ldan zhes brjod //
analyzed: de la lhag ma ldan zhes brjod //
translated: The remainder is said to be possessed.

original: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Not all non-apprehension proves non-existence.

original: de'i phyir gcig log pas gzhan ldog par 'dod pas ni de gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya dgos so //üîΩde lta ma yin na gtan tshigs @184a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig log pas gzhan ldog par 'dod pas ni de gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya dgos so // de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs @184a * //
translated: Therefore, he who maintains that the cessation of one thing is the cessation of another must also maintain that the two are related in some way.

original: go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the reason would not be understood.

original: gtan tshigs kyi ni tshul gsum la'ang //üîΩde yis ma grub ldog don dang // 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi ni tshul gsum la'ang // de yis ma grub ldog don dang // 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni //
translated: The three modes of the reasonüîΩare stated for the purpose of refuting

original: nges pa brjod par mdzad pa yin //
analyzed: nges pa brjod par mdzad pa yin //
translated: the non-establishment, the contradictory, and the doubtful.

original: 'brel pa med par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa med de /
translated: There is no invariable concomitance of presence and absence without a relation.

original: des na de nyid ston par mdzad pa ni gnyis ka la rab tu grub pa ni sgrub pa yin no zhes nges pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid ston par mdzad pa ni gnyis ka la rab tu grub pa ni sgrub pa yin no zhes nges pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement of the ascertainment is the proof that the establishment of the reason is established for both parties.

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams bsal lo //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams bsal lo //
translated: The ascertainment of concomitance eliminates the contradictory and the inconclusive.

original: ldog pa nges pas ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa nges pas ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the reverse eliminates the unestablished reason.

original: gnyis ka la zhes bya bas ni gcig la grub pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la zhes bya bas ni gcig la grub pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin both‚Äù excludes the established reason.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúwell established‚Äù excludes the remaining doubt and the uncommon reason in regard to the similar and dissimilar instances.

original: rab tu grub pa zhes bya bas ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la the tshom za ba lhag ma dang ldan pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dag go /'brel pa med par ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na ni re zhig 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs so zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa zhes bya bas ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la the tshom za ba lhag ma dang ldan pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dag go /'brel pa med par ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na ni re zhig 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs so zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: If the mere non-observation of the relation of the reason to the predicate were the reverse, then it would be reasonable to state both the contradictory and the inconclusive as antidotes, since it is said that ‚Äúthis is the case for the time being.‚Äù

original: chos mi mthun pa smos pa ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa smos pa ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The mention of the dissimilar instance is the antidote to the inconclusive.

original: gal te des mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ston par byed na ni de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te des mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ston par byed na ni de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it shows the non-observation of the dissimilar instance, then it would be understood even if it were not mentioned.

original: de la sngar brjod pas ldog par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la sngar brjod pas ldog par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no error here, since the previously mentioned refutation applies.

original: gal te tshig gis ma mthong ba la dran par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshig gis ma mthong ba la dran par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù makes one remember what was not seen,

original: mthong ba ma rtogs par ni yan lag ma yin pas de la ni dran pa'i don du brjod par rigs na /
analyzed: mthong ba ma rtogs par ni yan lag ma yin pas de la ni dran pa'i don du brjod par rigs na /
translated: then it is reasonable to say that the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is used to remind one of what was not understood, since it is not a part of the seeing.

original: ma mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin te /
translated: But what was not seen is the absence of seeing.

original: de la ni mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: So the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is used to negate seeing.

original: de med na grub pa kho na yin pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa don med do //
analyzed: de med na grub pa kho na yin pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa don med do //
translated: But if that does not exist, then it is established, and so it is pointless to use the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù to establish it.

original: gal te ma dmigs pa de tsam gyis med do zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid pas de'i don du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs pa de tsam gyis med do zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid pas de'i don du brjod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is used to refer to that absence, since it is not the case that something does not exist merely because it is not perceived,

original: gal te ma dmigs kyang med do zhes bya bar mi rtogs na brjod pas kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs kyang med do zhes bya bar mi rtogs na brjod pas kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then if one does not understand that something does not exist merely because it is not perceived, one will not understand it even if it is expressed.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa kho na rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa kho na rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that absence is expressed only by the word ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: gcig mi dmigs pa ni gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig mi dmigs pa ni gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The non-observation of one thing is not a proof of the non-existence of another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: des sgrub @184b pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des sgrub @184b pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a proof,

original: 'on kyang rang nyid ma dmigs pas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid ma dmigs pas yin no zhe na /
translated: but rather it is by the non-observation of itself.

original: snang ba ma mthong na ni med par rigs kyi /
analyzed: snang ba ma mthong na ni med par rigs kyi /
translated: If the light is not seen, it is reasonable to say that it does not exist.

original: de med na ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de med na ni mi rigs te /
translated: But if it does not exist, it is not reasonable,

original: la lar 'dod rgyal du de ltar gyur kyang de dag 'brel pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar 'dod rgyal du de ltar gyur kyang de dag 'brel pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it were so by chance in some places, there would be no connection between them, and so the pervasion would not be established.

original: des med do zhes brjod pas kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des med do zhes brjod pas kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: And by saying ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù with that, it would not be so,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: de bas na ldog par 'dod pas de la gang gis na 'di ldog pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na ldog par 'dod pas de la gang gis na 'di ldog pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to refute should state the reasoning by which it would be called ‚Äúrefuted.‚Äù

original: med ces bya ba'i tshig gis kyang //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i tshig gis kyang //
translated: Even by the word ‚Äúdoes not exist,‚Äù

original: de med kho na min gal te //
analyzed: de med kho na min gal te //
translated: if it is not just the non-existence of that,

original: ji ltar med rigs de brjod na //
analyzed: ji ltar med rigs de brjod na //
translated: then how it is reasonable to say ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù should be stated.

original: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs //
analyzed: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs //
translated: At that time, it is understood as ‚Äúdoes not exist.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the concluding verse.

original: de med pa la mi dmigs pas ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa la mi dmigs pas ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the pervasion established by the non-observation of the absence of the reason?

original: 'di la cung zad brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di la cung zad brjod zin to //
translated: We have already said something about this.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te ma mthong bas ldog 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te ma mthong bas ldog 'gyur //
translated: If the pervasion is established by non-observation,

original: ji ltar lhag ldan 'khrul can yin //üîΩdper na 'bras bu 'di dag ni smin pa'am ro 'di bro ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar lhag ldan 'khrul can yin // dper na 'bras bu 'di dag ni smin pa'am ro 'di bro ba yin te /
translated: How can there be a mistaken pervasion?

original: gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gcig las skyes pa'i phyir zos pa dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gcig las skyes pa'i phyir zos pa dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThese fruits are ripe or this taste is sweet, because the form is indistinguishable and they arise from the same thing, like what was eaten.‚Äù

original: 'di la yang zos pas las gzhan phyogs su byas nas bsgrub par bya ba med pa las gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la yang zos pas las gzhan phyogs su byas nas bsgrub par bya ba med pa las gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
translated: Here too, after the action of eating is done, the probandum is absent in the locus where the reason is present. How can there be a mistaken pervasion?

original: kha cig na re mngon sum gyi gnod par dogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re mngon sum gyi gnod par dogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is a mistaken pervasion because it is suspected to be contradicted by perception.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: phyogs su byas pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs su byas pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum is absent in the locus where the reason is present.

original: gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were so,

original: de lta bur dogs med na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur dogs med na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no such doubt, there would be an absurd consequence,

original: gzhan la yang med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshad ma zhugs pas gnod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan la yang med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // tshad ma zhugs pas gnod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: because there would be no certainty that it does not exist elsewhere.üîΩIt is the valid cognition that invalidates, not the absence of valid cognition.

original: ma zhugs par gnod na ni thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
analyzed: ma zhugs par gnod na ni thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
translated: If there were invalidation without the presence of valid cognition, then nothing would be reliable.

original: ldog pa ni grub pa kho na sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa ni grub pa kho na sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The negative pervasion is established only when the positive pervasion is established.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo ni nges pa la ltos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo ni nges pa la ltos so //
translated: Therefore, such a nature depends on certainty.

original: mi dmigs pas 'ga' zhig la med par grub kyang 'brel pa med pa ni de med pa thams cad la med par mi 'grub pas the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa med pa ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas 'ga' zhig la med par grub kyang 'brel pa med pa ni de med pa thams cad la med par mi 'grub pas the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa med pa ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Although non-apprehension establishes the non-existence of something in some places, without a connection, it does not establish the non-existence of everything that does not exist. Therefore, the absence of a negative pervasion is a fault that has a remainder.

original: gzhan yang / ldog pa can yang gtan @185a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ldog pa can yang gtan @185a * //
translated: Moreover, the negative pervasion would become a reason:

original: tshigs 'gyur // gson pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs 'gyur // gson pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: This living body is not without a self,

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that it would not possess life and so on.

original: bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba dag la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba dag la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the nonexistence of the self is pervaded by the nonexistence of such things as pots.

original: de log na khyab par bya ba ldog pas /
analyzed: de log na khyab par bya ba ldog pas /
translated: When that is refuted, the pervaded is refuted.

original: bdag yod par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag yod par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the self is understood to exist.

original: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas med pa ma grub na bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs ldog pa med do //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas med pa ma grub na bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs ldog pa med do //
translated: If nonexistence is not established by the nonapprehension of the unobservable, then the existence of the self is not refuted by the nonexistence of such things as pots.

original: gal te khas blangs pa'i phyir 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa'i phyir 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established by assertion,

original: de ni ji ltar bdag 'grub gzhan bdag med pa tshad ma can ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'grub pa yin /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar bdag 'grub gzhan bdag med pa tshad ma can ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'grub pa yin /
translated: then how is the self established? How is the nonexistence of the self established by a nonvalid cognition?

original: khas blangs pas bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa dag rnam par phye nas de la med pas rtogs par byed pa nyid du rjod par byed pas ni /
analyzed: khas blangs pas bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa dag rnam par phye nas de la med pas rtogs par byed pa nyid du rjod par byed pas ni /
translated: By asserting that the existence and nonexistence of the self are distinguished, you are saying that the self is understood by the nonexistence of that.

original: bdag lung las grub par khas blang bar 'gyur gyi /üîΩrjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag lung las grub par khas blang bar 'gyur gyi / rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, you are accepting that the self is established by scripture,üîΩbut it is not to be inferred.üîΩAlso,

original: gang yang / ma grub sbyar ba /
analyzed: gang yang / ma grub sbyar ba /
translated: The nonestablished is not applied.

original: de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba de yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba de yang /
translated: So too, one should say in the appropriate manner regarding existence and nonexistence in the concordant class and so on.

original: brjod bya ma yin /
analyzed: brjod bya ma yin /
translated: That is not the case.

original: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is doubt due to nonobservation alone.

original: dmigs na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were observed, it would not be nonexistent.

original: ldog pa yang mi dmigs pa nyid las yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa yang mi dmigs pa nyid las yin te /
translated: Also, the reverse is due to nonobservation alone.

original: des na the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even doubt would not be averted.

original: gal te ci rigs par zhes smos pa'i phyir ma bzlog pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci rigs par zhes smos pa'i phyir ma bzlog pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not averted because it is said in the appropriate manner,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang zhig gnyis ka la nges pa brjod pa de kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gnyis ka la nges pa brjod pa de kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that only that which is ascertained in both is the case and so on.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas ldog pa med par dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas ldog pa med par dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, it is thought that even though there is nonobservation, there is no reversal due to doubt.

original: de dgag par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dgag par bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is explained as the negation of that.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir de las zlog pas de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir de las zlog pas de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not seen that what is to be heard is either permanent or impermanent, the opposite of that is the logical proof that excludes those two.

original: de rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las zlog pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las zlog pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The exclusion of those two is not other than the opposite of those two.

original: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni gang las kyang ldog pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni gang las kyang ldog pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not an exclusion is not ascertained as the opposite of anything.

original: gang zhig gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de yod na ji @185b ltar de med par rtogs par mi byed /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de yod na ji @185b ltar de med par rtogs par mi byed /
translated: When one ascertains that something does not exist in something else, how could one not understand that it does not exist?

original: gal te gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIt is not an exclusion of both,

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is undermined by another valid cognition,‚Äù

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can rnams ni gcig rnam par bcad pas gzhan sgrub pa'i phyir dgag ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can rnams ni gcig rnam par bcad pas gzhan sgrub pa'i phyir dgag ba ma yin te /
translated: then it is not a negation because the nature of mutual exclusion establishes the other when one is excluded.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because affirmation and negation are contradictory.

original: da ni ma mthong ba tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni ma mthong ba tshad ma yin te /
translated: Now, non-seeing is a valid cognition.

original: gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that it is contradicted.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid de /
translated: In the same way, it is possible that another valid cognition contradicts another valid cognition.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
translated: If it is possible that a valid cognition endowed with the characteristics is contradicted, then the characteristics themselves are refuted, and so one cannot rely on any valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong bas yid brtan du med par thal lo zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong bas yid brtan du med par thal lo zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: It follows, absurdly, that one cannot rely on any direct perception or inference because one sees that they are contradicted by other direct perceptions and inferences.

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bu la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bu la mi srid pa'i phyir ro // 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: No, because it is impossible for them to be as you have described.üîΩYou are saying that there is no contradiction that is not erroneous,üîΩbut we do not say that there is no contradiction in the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma brjod pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma brjod pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin no //
translated: We say that it is impossible for there to be a contradiction in the object of inference.

original: 'di'i yul ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: The object of inference must be taught.

original: gang yang gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis snang ba dag la 'gog par byed na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis snang ba dag la 'gog par byed na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it not reasonable?

original: mi dmigs pas med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-apprehension establishes non-existence.

original: reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i phyir dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i phyir dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not reasonable to deny the existence of contact because it is characterized by apprehension?

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable.

original: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin gyi yul la yod pa tsam ni 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin gyi yul la yod pa tsam ni 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere existence of appearances and their objects is not denied.

original: des na sa la sogs pa spyir bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
analyzed: des na sa la sogs pa spyir bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, having taken earth, etc. in general, the denial is stated.

original: de la yang shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa la de yod kyang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa la de yod kyang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And there, although it exists in cotton, stone, leaves, etc., contact is seen to be different.

original: khyad par 'ga' zhig la srid par dogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad la ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' zhig la srid par dogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad la ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is possible that there is some difference, it is not reasonable to deny everything simply because one does not see it.

original: gzhan yang gal te ci zhig ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'brel pa med pa yang de 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ci zhig ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'brel pa med pa yang de 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if you say that the absence of a connection is not a mistake, because it is not seen in any way in the discordant side,

original: yul 'ga' zhig na rdzas kha cig ji ltar mthong ba gzhan na gzhan du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig na rdzas kha cig ji ltar mthong ba gzhan na gzhan du yang snang ngo //
translated: then in some places some substances are seen in one way, and in other places in another way.

original: dper na sman kha cig zhing khyad par can las ni ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa @186a * //üîΩkhyad par can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na sman kha cig zhing khyad par can las ni ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa @186a * // khyad par can du 'gyur la /
translated: For example, some medicines have a special taste, potency, and ripening effect in a special field,

original: gzhan las ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: but not in another.

original: dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: And the same is true of time and the special action.

original: yul de ba rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te /
analyzed: yul de ba rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te /
translated: The people of that country see it that way,

original: de nyid kyis de lta bu yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de lta bu yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: but that alone does not make it so.

original: rgyu khyad par srid pa rnams la yon tan gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par srid pa rnams la yon tan gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible for other qualities to exist in substances with different causes.

original: rgyu khyad par med na ni rjes su dpag tu rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu khyad par med na ni rjes su dpag tu rung ste /
translated: But if there is no difference in causes, it is suitable for inference.

original: dper na byed pa po mthong ba can gyi tshig kyang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byed pa po mthong ba can gyi tshig kyang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the statement ‚ÄúThe one who sees the agent is preceded by the activity of the person‚Äù is not a proof.

original: tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no difference in the words.

original: rnam pa thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in every way, the person is seen to be the cause.

original: gang gis na tshig la sogs pa cung zad tsam chos mthun pas rnam pa thams cad mthun par rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba de ltar skyes bu dag ni rgyu khyad par med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis na tshig la sogs pa cung zad tsam chos mthun pas rnam pa thams cad mthun par rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba de ltar skyes bu dag ni rgyu khyad par med pa can ma yin te /
translated: The person is not the cause of everything, because the words and so on are similar in some respects but not in every way.

original: yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the person is seen to be the cause of all qualities.

original: legs par bya ba'i bye brag las khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i bye brag las khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference is understood from the difference in the activity.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible in other cases.

original: mi srid pa rjes su dpag pa las yang gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi srid pa rjes su dpag pa las yang gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no reason to refute the inference.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir la ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir la ;
translated: because one does not see the absence of passion,

original: ma mthong ba dang ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa mi byed 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa mi byed 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the non-seeing and the seen are not established as the one who is harmed and the one who harms.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul ba med pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul ba med pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no result of passion, etc., that is not erroneous.

original: srid kyang khyab pa rnams bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid kyang khyab pa rnams bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there were, the pervasives are not visible.

original: de lta bu dag ni spang bar 'os pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni spang bar 'os pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not proper to reject such things.

original: tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Words are not like that.

original: khyad par ba ltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ba ltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are suitable as special cases.

original: bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig yin na yang khyad par ma mthong ba rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid du khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig yin na yang khyad par ma mthong ba rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid du khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they were not visible, it would be contradictory to accept that they are not of the same type, since their difference is not seen.

original: de'i khyad par rnams ni gzhan la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par rnams ni gzhan la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their differences are capable of being applied to others.

original: sgra mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no non-perceptibility in the case of directly perceived sounds.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because there is no cause for error.

original: gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Error is not established because there is no injury.

original: skyes bu dag la ni khyad par mthong ba gnod par byed pa @186b yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu dag la ni khyad par mthong ba gnod par byed pa @186b yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But in the case of a person, the seeing of a difference is the injury.

original: mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the same.

original: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni de'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni de'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: A difference in words is not the nature of that.

original: de'i phyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad skyes bus byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad skyes bus byed do //
translated: Therefore, the nature of all things, which is without difference, is created by a person.

original: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Or else, it is not created by anyone at all.

original: de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel ba'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel ba'i //
translated: Therefore, the nature of that which is related to that extent

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid //
translated: is by nature its own nature.

original: ldog par byed pa'am /
analyzed: ldog par byed pa'am /
translated: It is not possible to remove it,

original: dper na shing gis shing sha ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing gis shing sha ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is a tree.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na la de skad du grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na la de skad du grags pa'i phyir /
translated: It is called that only in a certain difference that possesses branches, etc.

original: de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin na rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin na rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is its own nature, then how could it exist after abandoning its own nature?

original: rang bzhin 'brel ba'i phyir de la ni 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel ba'i phyir de la ni 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Because of the natural relation, there is no error in this.

original: rgyu yis kyang /
analyzed: rgyu yis kyang /
translated: By the cause,

original: 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin te /
translated: the effect is stopped,

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error.

original: rgyu log pa na yang 'bras bu ldog par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu log pa na yang 'bras bu ldog par byed do //
translated: When the cause is stopped, the effect is stopped.

original: gzhan du na de de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be its effect.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang rang bzhin nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang rang bzhin nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation of cause and effect is also determined by nature.

original: de'i phyir gnyi gar yang rang bzhin 'brel ba kho nas ldog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi gar yang rang bzhin 'brel ba kho nas ldog go //
translated: Therefore, in both cases, there is cessation only by the natural relation.

original: de lta min na gcig log pas //
analyzed: de lta min na gcig log pas //
translated: If it were not so,üîΩhow could the cessation of one

original: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur //
translated: be the cessation of the other?

original: mi la rta mi bdog ces te //
analyzed: mi la rta mi bdog ces te //
translated: If a man does not own a horse,

original: phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci //üîΩde bzhin gcig gcig nye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci // de bzhin gcig gcig nye ba'i phyir //
translated: does he also not own cattle?üîΩIn the same way, how can one thing

original: ji ltar gzhan ni nye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni nye bar 'gyur //
translated: be related to another if it is not related to itself?

original: mi la phyugs ni bdog ces te //
analyzed: mi la phyugs ni bdog ces te //
translated: If a man owns cattle,

original: de bzhin rta yang bdog gam ci //
analyzed: de bzhin rta yang bdog gam ci //
translated: does he also own a horse?

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel ba kho nas gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel ba kho nas gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is understood to prove the probandum only by the relation of nature.

original: de yang de'i tshe ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: And that is either the nature of that or the nature of arising from that.

original: med na mi 'byung ba de nyid dpe dag gis rab tu ston to //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba de nyid dpe dag gis rab tu ston to //
translated: That non-existence without is shown by examples.

original: de'i phyir chos mi mthun dpe la //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mi mthun dpe la //
translated: Therefore, in the example of the dissimilar,

original: nges par 'di las gzhi mi 'dod //
analyzed: nges par 'di las gzhi mi 'dod //
translated: one does not accept the basis as this.

original: dpe la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i ngo bor de tsam dang 'brel bas ston te /
analyzed: dpe la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i ngo bor de tsam dang 'brel bas ston te /
translated: In the example, the probandum is shown as just that nature, related to that extent.

original: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bor gyur bar bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bor gyur bar bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is the nature of the produced, that is produced as the nature of the impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshad ma dpes rab tu ston to //üîΩtshad ma des kyang bsgrub par bya @187a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshad ma dpes rab tu ston to // tshad ma des kyang bsgrub par bya @187a * //
translated: This is shown by the valid example.

original: ba'i chos de tsam dang rjes su 'brel bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i chos de tsam dang rjes su 'brel bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that valid example, the probandum is understood to be related to that extent.

original: yang na rgyu yi dngos por te //
analyzed: yang na rgyu yi dngos por te //
translated: Or, in the nature of the cause,

original: de yod pa nyid na yod pa'i phyir ro zhes don gzhan rab tu ston to //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na yod pa'i phyir ro zhes don gzhan rab tu ston to //
translated: because it exists when that exists.

original: de ltar de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu grub na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med la /
analyzed: de ltar de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu grub na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med la /
translated: Thus, when the nature and cause are well established, if impermanence does not exist, then the produced does not exist.

original: me med na yang du ba ste /
analyzed: me med na yang du ba ste /
translated: And if fire does not exist, then smoke does not exist.üîΩThus, if that is the nature and cause, how could it exist without a cause?

original: 'di ltar de ni rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rgyu med par yod par 'gyur zhes gzhi med par yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog pa rab tu 'grub bo //üîΩde'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dang // med pa 'ga' zhig dgag pa'i yang ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rgyu med par yod par 'gyur zhes gzhi med par yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog pa rab tu 'grub bo // de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dang // med pa 'ga' zhig dgag pa'i yang ;
translated: In this way, the contrapositive is established in the example of a dissimilar instance without a basis.üîΩTherefore, a cause, a nature, and a non-existent

original: / gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: / gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: are also reasons for a negation.

original: de dag kho na ldog pa na rang dang 'brel ba ldog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kho na ldog pa na rang dang 'brel ba ldog par byed do //
translated: Because when only those are reversed, the related object is reversed.

original: de'i phyir don 'ga' zhig dgag pa sgrub par 'dod pas kyang rgyu'am rang bzhin khyab par byed pa ldog pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don 'ga' zhig dgag pa sgrub par 'dod pas kyang rgyu'am rang bzhin khyab par byed pa ldog pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even one who wishes to prove a negation of some object should state a cause, a nature, or a pervader that is reversed as the reason.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel ba med pa log pas gzhan lo ga bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel ba med pa log pas gzhan lo ga bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the absence of a connection would not be established by the absence of a connection with something else.

original: dmigs par ni rigs ldan de mi dmigs par yang dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par ni rigs ldan de mi dmigs par yang dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the object is a reason for negation.

original: dgag pa'i yul can tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs la de'i gtan tshigs zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul can tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs la de'i gtan tshigs zhes bshad de /
translated: A reason for a negation, which has a negated object, is called a reason for a negation.

original: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni rang nyid dgag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni rang nyid dgag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Such a non-apprehension is itself of the nature of a negation.

original: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni gnyi ga'i yang gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni gnyi ga'i yang gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of a cause and the non-apprehension of a difference-maker are reasons for both.
